00030 
00031       subroutine balanc(nm,n,a,low,igh,scale) 
00032 !                                                                       
00033       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,jj,nm,igh,low,iexc 
00034       real(wp) a(nm,n),scale(n) 
00035       real(wp) c,f,g,r,s,b2,radix 
00036       logical noconv 
00037 !                                                                       
00038 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure balance,  
00039 !     num. math. 13, 293-304(1969) by parlett and reinsch.              
00040 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 315-326(1971).   
00041 !                                                                       
00042 !     this subroutine balances a real matrix and isolates               
00043 !     eigenvalues whenever possible.                                    
00044 !                                                                       
00045 !     on input                                                          
00046 !                                                                       
00047 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
00048 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
00049 !          dimension statement.                                         
00050 !                                                                       
00051 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
00052 !                                                                       
00053 !        a contains the input matrix to be balanced.                    
00054 !                                                                       
00055 !     on output                                                         
00056 !                                                                       
00057 !        a contains the balanced matrix.                                
00058 !                                                                       
00059 !        low and igh are two integers such that a(i,j)                  
00060 !          is equal to zero if                                          
00061 !           (1) i is greater than j and                                 
00062 !           (2) j=1,...,low-1 or i=igh+1,...,n.                         
00063 !                                                                       
00064 !        scale contains information determining the                     
00065 !           permutations and scaling factors used.                      
00066 !                                                                       
00067 !     suppose that the principal submatrix in rows low through igh      
00068 !     has been balanced, that p(j) denotes the index interchanged       
00069 !     with j during the permutation step, and that the elements         
00070 !     of the diagonal matrix used are denoted by d(i,j).  then          
00071 !        scale(j) = p(j),    for j = 1,...,low-1                        
00072 !                 = d(j,j),      j = low,...,igh                        
00073 !                 = p(j)         j = igh+1,...,n.                       
00074 !     the order in which the interchanges are made is n to igh+1,       
00075 !     then 1 to low-1.                                                  
00076 !                                                                       
00077 !     note that 1 is returned for igh if igh is zero formally.          
00078 !                                                                       
00079 !     the algol procedure exc contained in balance appears in           
00080 !     balanc  in line.  (note that the algol roles of identifiers       
00081 !     k,l have been reversed.)                                          
00082 !                                                                       
00083 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
00084 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
00085 !                                                                       
00086 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
00087 !                                                                       
00088 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00089 !                                                                       
00090       radix = 16.0_wp 
00091 !                                                                       
00092       b2 = radix * radix 
00093       k = 1 
00094       l = n 
00095       go to 100 
00096 !     .......... in-line procedure for row and                          
00097 !                column exchange ..........                             
00098    20 scale(m) = j 
00099       if (j  ==  m) go to 50 
00100 !                                                                       
00101       do 30 i = 1, l 
00102          f = a(i,j) 
00103          a(i,j) = a(i,m) 
00104          a(i,m) = f 
00105    30 continue 
00106 !                                                                       
00107       do 40 i = k, n 
00108          f = a(j,i) 
00109          a(j,i) = a(m,i) 
00110          a(m,i) = f 
00111    40 continue 
00112 !                                                                       
00113    50 go to (80,130), iexc 
00114 !     .......... search for rows isolating an eigenvalue                
00115 !                and push them down ..........                          
00116    80 if (l  ==  1) go to 280 
00117       l = l - 1 
00118 !     .......... for j=l step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
00119   100 do 120 jj = 1, l 
00120          j = l + 1 - jj 
00121 !                                                                       
00122          do 110 i = 1, l 
00123             if (i  ==  j) go to 110 
00124             if (a(j,i)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 120 
00125   110    continue 
00126 !                                                                       
00127          m = l 
00128          iexc = 1 
00129          go to 20 
00130   120 continue 
00131 !                                                                       
00132       go to 140 
00133 !     .......... search for columns isolating an eigenvalue             
00134 !                and push them left ..........                          
00135   130 k = k + 1 
00136 !                                                                       
00137   140 do 170 j = k, l 
00138 !                                                                       
00139          do 150 i = k, l 
00140             if (i  ==  j) go to 150 
00141             if (a(i,j)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 170 
00142   150    continue 
00143 !                                                                       
00144          m = k 
00145          iexc = 2 
00146          go to 20 
00147   170 continue 
00148 !     .......... now balance the submatrix in rows k to l ..........    
00149       do 180 i = k, l 
00150   180 scale(i) = 1.0_wp 
00151 !     .......... iterative loop for norm reduction ..........           
00152   190 noconv = .false. 
00153 !                                                                       
00154       do 270 i = k, l 
00155          c = 0.0_wp 
00156          r = 0.0_wp 
00157 !                                                                       
00158          do 200 j = k, l 
00159             if (j  ==  i) go to 200 
00160             c = c + abs(a(j,i)) 
00161             r = r + abs(a(i,j)) 
00162   200    continue 
00163 !     .......... guard against zero c or r due to underflow ..........  
00164          if (c  ==  0.0_wp .or. r  ==  0.0_wp) go to 270 
00165          g = r / radix 
00166          f = 1.0_wp 
00167          s = c + r 
00168   210    if (c  >=  g) go to 220 
00169          f = f * radix 
00170          c = c * b2 
00171          go to 210 
00172   220    g = r * radix 
00173   230    if (c  <  g) go to 240 
00174          f = f / radix 
00175          c = c / b2 
00176          go to 230 
00177 !     .......... now balance ..........                                 
00178   240    if ((c + r) / f  >=  0.95_wp * s) go to 270 
00179          g = 1.0_wp / f 
00180          scale(i) = scale(i) * f 
00181          noconv = .true. 
00182 !                                                                       
00183          do 250 j = k, n 
00184   250    a(i,j) = a(i,j) * g 
00185 !                                                                       
00186          do 260 j = 1, l 
00187   260    a(j,i) = a(j,i) * f 
00188 !                                                                       
00189   270 continue 
00190 !                                                                       
00191       if (noconv) go to 190 
00192 !                                                                       
00193   280 low = k 
00194       igh = l 
00195       return 
00196       end subroutine balanc
00197 
00198 !=============================================================================80
00199 
00200       subroutine balbak(nm,n,low,igh,scale,m,z) 
00201 !                                                                       
00202       integer i,j,k,m,n,ii,nm,igh,low 
00203       real(wp) scale(n),z(nm,m) 
00204       real(wp) s 
00205 !                                                                       
00206 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure balbak,   
00207 !     num. math. 13, 293-304(1969) by parlett and reinsch.              
00208 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 315-326(1971).   
00209 !                                                                       
00210 !     this subroutine forms the eigenvectors of a real general          
00211 !     matrix by back transforming those of the corresponding            
00212 !     balanced matrix determined by  balanc.                            
00213 !                                                                       
00214 !     on input                                                          
00215 !                                                                       
00216 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
00217 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
00218 !          dimension statement.                                         
00219 !                                                                       
00220 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
00221 !                                                                       
00222 !        low and igh are integers determined by  balanc.                
00223 !                                                                       
00224 !        scale contains information determining the permutations        
00225 !          and scaling factors used by  balanc.                         
00226 !                                                                       
00227 !        m is the number of columns of z to be back transformed.        
00228 !                                                                       
00229 !        z contains the real and imaginary parts of the eigen-          
00230 !          vectors to be back transformed in its first m columns.       
00231 !                                                                       
00232 !     on output                                                         
00233 !                                                                       
00234 !        z contains the real and imaginary parts of the                 
00235 !          transformed eigenvectors in its first m columns.             
00236 !                                                                       
00237 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
00238 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
00239 !                                                                       
00240 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
00241 !                                                                       
00242 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00243 !                                                                       
00244       if (m  ==  0) go to 200 
00245       if (igh  ==  low) go to 120 
00246 !                                                                       
00247       do 110 i = low, igh 
00248          s = scale(i) 
00249 !     .......... left hand eigenvectors are back transformed            
00250 !                if the foregoing statement is replaced by              
00251 !                s=1.0_wp/scale(i). ..........                           
00252          do 100 j = 1, m 
00253   100    z(i,j) = z(i,j) * s 
00254 !                                                                       
00255   110 continue 
00256 !     ......... for i=low-1 step -1 until 1,                            
00257 !               igh+1 step 1 until n do -- ..........                   
00258   120 do 140 ii = 1, n 
00259          i = ii 
00260          if (i  >=  low .and. i  <=  igh) go to 140 
00261          if (i  <  low) i = low - ii 
00262          k = scale(i) 
00263          if (k  ==  i) go to 140 
00264 !                                                                       
00265          do 130 j = 1, m 
00266             s = z(i,j) 
00267             z(i,j) = z(k,j) 
00268             z(k,j) = s 
00269   130    continue 
00270 !                                                                       
00271   140 continue 
00272 !                                                                       
00273   200 return 
00274       end subroutine balbak
00275

00278       subroutine cdiv(ar,ai,br,bi,cr,ci) 
00279       real(wp) ar,ai,br,bi,cr,ci 
00280 !                                                                       
00281 !     complex division, (cr,ci) = (ar,ai)/(br,bi)                       
00282 !                                                                       
00283       real(wp) s,ars,ais,brs,bis 
00284       s = abs(br) + abs(bi) 
00285       ars = ar/s 
00286       ais = ai/s 
00287       brs = br/s 
00288       bis = bi/s 
00289       s = brs**2 + bis**2 
00290       cr = (ars*brs + ais*bis)/s 
00291       ci = (ais*brs - ars*bis)/s 
00292       return 
00293       end subroutine cdiv
00294

00296 
00297       subroutine elmhes(nm,n,low,igh,a,int) 
00298 !                                                                       
00299       integer i,j,m,n,la,nm,igh,kp1,low,mm1,mp1 
00300       real(wp) a(nm,n) 
00301       real(wp) x,y 
00302       integer int(igh) 
00303 !                                                                       
00304 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure elmhes,   
00305 !     num. math. 12, 349-368(1968) by martin and wilkinson.             
00306 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 339-358(1971).   
00307 !                                                                       
00308 !     given a real general matrix, this subroutine                      
00309 !     reduces a submatrix situated in rows and columns                  
00310 !     low through igh to upper hessenberg form by                       
00311 !     stabilized elementary similarity transformations.                 
00312 !                                                                       
00313 !     on input                                                          
00314 !                                                                       
00315 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
00316 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
00317 !          dimension statement.                                         
00318 !                                                                       
00319 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
00320 !                                                                       
00321 !        low and igh are integers determined by the balancing           
00322 !          subroutine  balanc.  if  balanc  has not been used,          
00323 !          set low=1, igh=n.                                            
00324 !                                                                       
00325 !        a contains the input matrix.                                   
00326 !                                                                       
00327 !     on output                                                         
00328 !                                                                       
00329 !        a contains the hessenberg matrix.  the multipliers             
00330 !          which were used in the reduction are stored in the           
00331 !          remaining triangle under the hessenberg matrix.              
00332 !                                                                       
00333 !        int contains information on the rows and columns               
00334 !          interchanged in the reduction.                               
00335 !          only elements low through igh are used.                      
00336 !                                                                       
00337 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
00338 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
00339 !                                                                       
00340 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
00341 !                                                                       
00342 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00343 !                                                                       
00344       la = igh - 1 
00345       kp1 = low + 1 
00346       if (la  <  kp1) go to 200 
00347 !                                                                       
00348       do 180 m = kp1, la 
00349          mm1 = m - 1 
00350          x = 0.0_wp 
00351          i = m 
00352 !                                                                       
00353          do 100 j = m, igh 
00354             if (abs(a(j,mm1))  <=  abs(x)) go to 100 
00355             x = a(j,mm1) 
00356             i = j 
00357   100    continue 
00358 !                                                                       
00359          int(m) = i 
00360          if (i  ==  m) go to 130 
00361 !     .......... interchange rows and columns of a ..........           
00362          do 110 j = mm1, n 
00363             y = a(i,j) 
00364             a(i,j) = a(m,j) 
00365             a(m,j) = y 
00366   110    continue 
00367 !                                                                       
00368          do 120 j = 1, igh 
00369             y = a(j,i) 
00370             a(j,i) = a(j,m) 
00371             a(j,m) = y 
00372   120    continue 
00373 !     .......... end interchange ..........                             
00374   130    if (x  ==  0.0_wp) go to 180 
00375          mp1 = m + 1 
00376 !                                                                       
00377          do 160 i = mp1, igh 
00378             y = a(i,mm1) 
00379             if (y  ==  0.0_wp) go to 160 
00380             y = y / x 
00381             a(i,mm1) = y 
00382 !                                                                       
00383             do 140 j = m, n 
00384   140       a(i,j) = a(i,j) - y * a(m,j) 
00385 !                                                                       
00386             do 150 j = 1, igh 
00387   150       a(j,m) = a(j,m) + y * a(j,i) 
00388 !                                                                       
00389   160    continue 
00390 !                                                                       
00391   180 continue 
00392 !                                                                       
00393   200 return 
00394       end subroutine elmhes
00395 
00396 !=============================================================================80
00397 
00398       subroutine eltran(nm,n,low,igh,a,int,z) 
00399 !                                                                       
00400       integer i,j,n,kl,mm,mp,nm,igh,low,mp1 
00401       real(wp) a(nm,igh),z(nm,n) 
00402       integer int(igh) 
00403 !                                                                       
00404 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure elmtrans, 
00405 !     num. math. 16, 181-204(1970) by peters and wilkinson.             
00406 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 372-395(1971).   
00407 !                                                                       
00408 !     this subroutine accumulates the stabilized elementary             
00409 !     similarity transformations used in the reduction of a             
00410 !     real general matrix to upper hessenberg form by  elmhes.          
00411 !                                                                       
00412 !     on input                                                          
00413 !                                                                       
00414 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
00415 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
00416 !          dimension statement.                                         
00417 !                                                                       
00418 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
00419 !                                                                       
00420 !        low and igh are integers determined by the balancing           
00421 !          subroutine  balanc.  if  balanc  has not been used,          
00422 !          set low=1, igh=n.                                            
00423 !                                                                       
00424 !        a contains the multipliers which were used in the              
00425 !          reduction by  elmhes  in its lower triangle                  
00426 !          below the subdiagonal.                                       
00427 !                                                                       
00428 !        int contains information on the rows and columns               
00429 !          interchanged in the reduction by  elmhes.                    
00430 !          only elements low through igh are used.                      
00431 !                                                                       
00432 !     on output                                                         
00433 !                                                                       
00434 !        z contains the transformation matrix produced in the           
00435 !          reduction by  elmhes.                                        
00436 !                                                                       
00437 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
00438 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
00439 !                                                                       
00440 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
00441 !                                                                       
00442 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00443 !                                                                       
00444 !     .......... initialize z to identity matrix ..........             
00445       do 80 j = 1, n 
00446 !                                                                       
00447          do 60 i = 1, n 
00448    60    z(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
00449 !                                                                       
00450          z(j,j) = 1.0_wp 
00451    80 continue 
00452 !                                                                       
00453       kl = igh - low - 1 
00454       if (kl  <  1) go to 200 
00455 !     .......... for mp=igh-1 step -1 until low+1 do -- ..........      
00456       do 140 mm = 1, kl 
00457          mp = igh - mm 
00458          mp1 = mp + 1 
00459 !                                                                       
00460          do 100 i = mp1, igh 
00461   100    z(i,mp) = a(i,mp-1) 
00462 !                                                                       
00463          i = int(mp) 
00464          if (i  ==  mp) go to 140 
00465 !                                                                       
00466          do 130 j = mp, igh 
00467             z(mp,j) = z(i,j) 
00468             z(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
00469   130    continue 
00470 !                                                                       
00471          z(i,mp) = 1.0_wp 
00472   140 continue 
00473 !                                                                       
00474   200 return 
00475       end subroutine eltran
00476

00479       real(wp) function epslon (x) 
00480       real(wp) x 
00481 !                                                                       
00482 !     estimate unit roundoff in quantities of size x.                   
00483 !                                                                       
00484       real(wp) a,b,c,eps 
00485 !                                                                       
00486 !     this program should function properly on all systems              
00487 !     satisfying the following two assumptions,                         
00488 !        1.  the base used in representing floating point               
00489 !            numbers is not a power of three.                           
00490 !        2.  the quantity  a  in statement 10 is represented to         
00491 !            the accuracy used in floating point variables              
00492 !            that are stored in memory.                                 
00493 !     the statement number 10 and the go to 10 are intended to          
00494 !     force optimizing compilers to generate code satisfying            
00495 !     assumption 2.                                                     
00496 !     under these assumptions, it should be true that,                  
00497 !            a  is not exactly equal to four-thirds,                    
00498 !            b  has a zero for its last bit or digit,                   
00499 !            c  is not exactly equal to one,                            
00500 !            eps  measures the separation of 1.0 from                   
00501 !                 the next larger floating point number.                
00502 !     the developers of eispack would appreciate being informed         
00503 !     about any systems where these assumptions do not hold.            
00504 !                                                                       
00505 !     this version dated 4/6/83.                                        
00506 !                                                                       
00507       a = 4.0_wp/3.0_wp 
00508    10 b = a - 1.0_wp 
00509       c = b + b + b 
00510       eps = abs(c-1.0_wp) 
00511       if (eps  ==  0.0_wp) go to 10 
00512       epslon = eps*abs(x) 
00513       return 
00514       end function epslon
00515 
00516 !=============================================================================80
00517 
00518       subroutine hqr1(nm,n,low,igh,h,wr,wi,ierr) 
00519 !  RESTORED CORRECT INDICES OF LOOPS (200,210,230,240). (9/29/89 BSG)   
00520 !                                                                       
00521       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,en,ll,mm,na,nm,igh,itn,its,low,mp2,enm2,ierr 
00522       real(wp) h(nm,n),wr(n),wi(n) 
00523       real(wp) p,q,r,s,t,w,x,y,zz,norm,tst1,tst2 
00524       logical notlas 
00525 !                                                                       
00526 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure hqr,      
00527 !     num. math. 14, 219-231(1970) by martin, peters, and wilkinson.    
00528 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 359-371(1971).   
00529 !                                                                       
00530 !     this subroutine finds the eigenvalues of a real                   
00531 !     upper hessenberg matrix by the qr method.                         
00532 !                                                                       
00533 !     on input                                                          
00534 !                                                                       
00535 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
00536 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
00537 !          dimension statement.                                         
00538 !                                                                       
00539 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
00540 !                                                                       
00541 !        low and igh are integers determined by the balancing           
00542 !          subroutine  balanc.  if  balanc  has not been used,          
00543 !          set low=1, igh=n.                                            
00544 !                                                                       
00545 !        h contains the upper hessenberg matrix.  information about     
00546 !          the transformations used in the reduction to hessenberg      
00547 !          form by  elmhes  or  orthes, if performed, is stored         
00548 !          in the remaining triangle under the hessenberg matrix.       
00549 !                                                                       
00550 !     on output                                                         
00551 !                                                                       
00552 !        h has been destroyed.  therefore, it must be saved             
00553 !          before calling  hqr  if subsequent calculation and           
00554 !          back transformation of eigenvectors is to be performed.      
00555 !                                                                       
00556 !        wr and wi contain the real and imaginary parts,                
00557 !          respectively, of the eigenvalues.  the eigenvalues           
00558 !          are unordered except that complex conjugate pairs            
00559 !          of values appear consecutively with the eigenvalue           
00560 !          having the positive imaginary part first.  if an             
00561 !          error exit is made, the eigenvalues should be correct        
00562 !          for indices ierr+1,...,n.                                    
00563 !                                                                       
00564 !        ierr is set to                                                 
00565 !          zero       for normal return,                                
00566 !          j          if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted      
00567 !                     while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.        
00568 !                                                                       
00569 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
00570 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
00571 !                                                                       
00572 !     this version dated september 1989.                                
00573 !                                                                       
00574 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00575 !                                                                       
00576       ierr = 0 
00577       norm = 0.0_wp 
00578       k = 1 
00579 !     .......... store roots isolated by balanc                         
00580 !                and compute matrix norm ..........                     
00581       do 50 i = 1, n 
00582 !                                                                       
00583          do 40 j = k, n 
00584    40    norm = norm + abs(h(i,j)) 
00585 !                                                                       
00586          k = i 
00587          if (i  >=  low .and. i  <=  igh) go to 50 
00588          wr(i) = h(i,i) 
00589          wi(i) = 0.0_wp 
00590    50 continue 
00591 !                                                                       
00592       en = igh 
00593       t = 0.0_wp 
00594       itn = 30*n 
00595 !     .......... search for next eigenvalues ..........                 
00596    60 if (en  <  low) go to 1001 
00597       its = 0 
00598       na = en - 1 
00599       enm2 = na - 1 
00600 !     .......... look for single small sub-diagonal element             
00601 !                for l=en step -1 until low do -- ..........            
00602    70 do 80 ll = low, en 
00603          l = en + low - ll 
00604          if (l  ==  low) go to 100 
00605          s = abs(h(l-1,l-1)) + abs(h(l,l)) 
00606          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) s = norm 
00607          tst1 = s 
00608          tst2 = tst1 + abs(h(l,l-1)) 
00609          if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 100 
00610    80 continue 
00611 !     .......... form shift ..........                                  
00612   100 x = h(en,en) 
00613       if (l  ==  en) go to 270 
00614       y = h(na,na) 
00615       w = h(en,na) * h(na,en) 
00616       if (l  ==  na) go to 280 
00617       if (itn  ==  0) go to 1000 
00618       if (its  /=  10 .and. its  /=  20) go to 130 
00619 !     .......... form exceptional shift ..........                      
00620       t = t + x 
00621 !                                                                       
00622       do 120 i = low, en 
00623   120 h(i,i) = h(i,i) - x 
00624 !                                                                       
00625       s = abs(h(en,na)) + abs(h(na,enm2)) 
00626       x = 0.75_wp * s 
00627       y = x 
00628       w = -0.4375_wp * s * s 
00629   130 its = its + 1 
00630       itn = itn - 1 
00631 !     .......... look for two consecutive small                         
00632 !                sub-diagonal elements.                                 
00633 !                for m=en-2 step -1 until l do -- ..........            
00634       do 140 mm = l, enm2 
00635          m = enm2 + l - mm 
00636          zz = h(m,m) 
00637          r = x - zz 
00638          s = y - zz 
00639          p = (r * s - w) / h(m+1,m) + h(m,m+1) 
00640          q = h(m+1,m+1) - zz - r - s 
00641          r = h(m+2,m+1) 
00642          s = abs(p) + abs(q) + abs(r) 
00643          p = p / s 
00644          q = q / s 
00645          r = r / s 
00646          if (m  ==  l) go to 150 
00647          tst1 = abs(p)*(abs(h(m-1,m-1)) + abs(zz) + abs(h(m+1,m+1))) 
00648          tst2 = tst1 + abs(h(m,m-1))*(abs(q) + abs(r)) 
00649          if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 150 
00650   140 continue 
00651 !                                                                       
00652   150 mp2 = m + 2 
00653 !                                                                       
00654       do 160 i = mp2, en 
00655          h(i,i-2) = 0.0_wp 
00656          if (i  ==  mp2) go to 160 
00657          h(i,i-3) = 0.0_wp 
00658   160 continue 
00659 !     .......... double qr step involving rows l to en and              
00660 !                columns m to en ..........                             
00661       do 260 k = m, na 
00662          notlas = k  /=  na 
00663          if (k  ==  m) go to 170 
00664          p = h(k,k-1) 
00665          q = h(k+1,k-1) 
00666          r = 0.0_wp 
00667          if (notlas) r = h(k+2,k-1) 
00668          x = abs(p) + abs(q) + abs(r) 
00669          if (x  ==  0.0_wp) go to 260 
00670          p = p / x 
00671          q = q / x 
00672          r = r / x 
00673   170    s = sign(sqrt(p*p+q*q+r*r),p) 
00674          if (k  ==  m) go to 180 
00675          h(k,k-1) = -s * x 
00676          go to 190 
00677   180    if (l  /=  m) h(k,k-1) = -h(k,k-1) 
00678   190    p = p + s 
00679          x = p / s 
00680          y = q / s 
00681          zz = r / s 
00682          q = q / p 
00683          r = r / p 
00684          if (notlas) go to 225 
00685 !     .......... row modification ..........                            
00686          do 200 j = k, EN 
00687             p = h(k,j) + q * h(k+1,j) 
00688             h(k,j) = h(k,j) - p * x 
00689             h(k+1,j) = h(k+1,j) - p * y 
00690   200    continue 
00691 !                                                                       
00692          j = min0(en,k+3) 
00693 !     .......... column modification ..........                         
00694          do 210 i = L, j 
00695             p = x * h(i,k) + y * h(i,k+1) 
00696             h(i,k) = h(i,k) - p 
00697             h(i,k+1) = h(i,k+1) - p * q 
00698   210    continue 
00699          go to 255 
00700   225    continue 
00701 !     .......... row modification ..........                            
00702          do 230 j = k, EN 
00703             p = h(k,j) + q * h(k+1,j) + r * h(k+2,j) 
00704             h(k,j) = h(k,j) - p * x 
00705             h(k+1,j) = h(k+1,j) - p * y 
00706             h(k+2,j) = h(k+2,j) - p * zz 
00707   230    continue 
00708 !                                                                       
00709          j = min0(en,k+3) 
00710 !     .......... column modification ..........                         
00711          do 240 i = L, j 
00712             p = x * h(i,k) + y * h(i,k+1) + zz * h(i,k+2) 
00713             h(i,k) = h(i,k) - p 
00714             h(i,k+1) = h(i,k+1) - p * q 
00715             h(i,k+2) = h(i,k+2) - p * r 
00716   240    continue 
00717   255    continue 
00718 !                                                                       
00719   260 continue 
00720 !                                                                       
00721       go to 70 
00722 !     .......... one root found ..........                              
00723   270 wr(en) = x + t 
00724       wi(en) = 0.0_wp 
00725       en = na 
00726       go to 60 
00727 !     .......... two roots found ..........                             
00728   280 p = (y - x) / 2.0_wp 
00729       q = p * p + w 
00730       zz = sqrt(abs(q)) 
00731       x = x + t 
00732       if (q  <  0.0_wp) go to 320 
00733 !     .......... real pair ..........                                   
00734       zz = p + sign(zz,p) 
00735       wr(na) = x + zz 
00736       wr(en) = wr(na) 
00737       if (zz  /=  0.0_wp) wr(en) = x - w / zz 
00738       wi(na) = 0.0_wp 
00739       wi(en) = 0.0_wp 
00740       go to 330 
00741 !     .......... complex pair ..........                                
00742   320 wr(na) = x + p 
00743       wr(en) = x + p 
00744       wi(na) = zz 
00745       wi(en) = -zz 
00746   330 en = enm2 
00747       go to 60 
00748 !     .......... set error -- all eigenvalues have not                  
00749 !                converged after 30*n iterations ..........             
00750  1000 ierr = en 
00751  1001 return 
00752       end subroutine hqr1
00753 
00754 !=============================================================================80
00755 
00756       subroutine hqr2(nm,n,low,igh,h,wr,wi,z,ierr) 
00757 !                                                                       
00758       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,en,ii,jj,ll,mm,na,nm,nn,                      
00759              igh,itn,its,low,mp2,enm2,ierr                             
00760       real(wp) h(nm,n),wr(n),wi(n),z(nm,n) 
00761       real(wp) p,q,r,s,t,w,x,y,ra,sa,vi,vr,zz,norm,tst1,tst2 
00762       logical notlas 
00763 !                                                                       
00764 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure hqr2,     
00765 !     num. math. 16, 181-204(1970) by peters and wilkinson.             
00766 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 372-395(1971).   
00767 !                                                                       
00768 !     this subroutine finds the eigenvalues and eigenvectors            
00769 !     of a real upper hessenberg matrix by the qr method.  the          
00770 !     eigenvectors of a real general matrix can also be found           
00771 !     if  elmhes  and  eltran  or  orthes  and  ortran  have            
00772 !     been used to reduce this general matrix to hessenberg form        
00773 !     and to accumulate the similarity transformations.                 
00774 !                                                                       
00775 !     on input                                                          
00776 !                                                                       
00777 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
00778 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
00779 !          dimension statement.                                         
00780 !                                                                       
00781 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
00782 !                                                                       
00783 !        low and igh are integers determined by the balancing           
00784 !          subroutine  balanc.  if  balanc  has not been used,          
00785 !          set low=1, igh=n.                                            
00786 !                                                                       
00787 !        h contains the upper hessenberg matrix.                        
00788 !                                                                       
00789 !        z contains the transformation matrix produced by  eltran       
00790 !          after the reduction by  elmhes, or by  ortran  after the     
00791 !          reduction by  orthes, if performed.  if the eigenvectors     
00792 !          of the hessenberg matrix are desired, z must contain the     
00793 !          identity matrix.                                             
00794 !                                                                       
00795 !     on output                                                         
00796 !                                                                       
00797 !        h has been destroyed.                                          
00798 !                                                                       
00799 !        wr and wi contain the real and imaginary parts,                
00800 !          respectively, of the eigenvalues.  the eigenvalues           
00801 !          are unordered except that complex conjugate pairs            
00802 !          of values appear consecutively with the eigenvalue           
00803 !          having the positive imaginary part first.  if an             
00804 !          error exit is made, the eigenvalues should be correct        
00805 !          for indices ierr+1,...,n.                                    
00806 !                                                                       
00807 !        z contains the real and imaginary parts of the eigenvectors.   
00808 !          if the i-th eigenvalue is real, the i-th column of z         
00809 !          contains its eigenvector.  if the i-th eigenvalue is complex 
00810 !          with positive imaginary part, the i-th and (i+1)-th          
00811 !          columns of z contain the real and imaginary parts of its     
00812 !          eigenvector.  the eigenvectors are unnormalized.  if an      
00813 !          error exit is made, none of the eigenvectors has been found. 
00814 !                                                                       
00815 !        ierr is set to                                                 
00816 !          zero       for normal return,                                
00817 !          j          if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted      
00818 !                     while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.        
00819 !                                                                       
00820 !     calls cdiv for complex division.                                  
00821 !                                                                       
00822 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
00823 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
00824 !                                                                       
00825 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
00826 !                                                                       
00827 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00828 !                                                                       
00829       ierr = 0 
00830       norm = 0.0_wp 
00831       k = 1 
00832 !     .......... store roots isolated by balanc                         
00833 !                and compute matrix norm ..........                     
00834       do 50 i = 1, n 
00835 !                                                                       
00836          do 40 j = k, n 
00837    40    norm = norm + abs(h(i,j)) 
00838 !                                                                       
00839          k = i 
00840          if (i  >=  low .and. i  <=  igh) go to 50 
00841          wr(i) = h(i,i) 
00842          wi(i) = 0.0_wp 
00843    50 continue 
00844 !                                                                       
00845       en = igh 
00846       t = 0.0_wp 
00847       itn = 30*n 
00848 !     .......... search for next eigenvalues ..........                 
00849    60 if (en  <  low) go to 340 
00850       its = 0 
00851       na = en - 1 
00852       enm2 = na - 1 
00853 !     .......... look for single small sub-diagonal element             
00854 !                for l=en step -1 until low do -- ..........            
00855    70 do 80 ll = low, en 
00856          l = en + low - ll 
00857          if (l  ==  low) go to 100 
00858          s = abs(h(l-1,l-1)) + abs(h(l,l)) 
00859          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) s = norm 
00860          tst1 = s 
00861          tst2 = tst1 + abs(h(l,l-1)) 
00862          if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 100 
00863    80 continue 
00864 !     .......... form shift ..........                                  
00865   100 x = h(en,en) 
00866       if (l  ==  en) go to 270 
00867       y = h(na,na) 
00868       w = h(en,na) * h(na,en) 
00869       if (l  ==  na) go to 280 
00870       if (itn  ==  0) go to 1000 
00871       if (its  /=  10 .and. its  /=  20) go to 130 
00872 !     .......... form exceptional shift ..........                      
00873       t = t + x 
00874 !                                                                       
00875       do 120 i = low, en 
00876   120 h(i,i) = h(i,i) - x 
00877 !                                                                       
00878       s = abs(h(en,na)) + abs(h(na,enm2)) 
00879       x = 0.75_wp * s 
00880       y = x 
00881       w = -0.4375_wp * s * s 
00882   130 its = its + 1 
00883       itn = itn - 1 
00884 !     .......... look for two consecutive small                         
00885 !                sub-diagonal elements.                                 
00886 !                for m=en-2 step -1 until l do -- ..........            
00887       do 140 mm = l, enm2 
00888          m = enm2 + l - mm 
00889          zz = h(m,m) 
00890          r = x - zz 
00891          s = y - zz 
00892          p = (r * s - w) / h(m+1,m) + h(m,m+1) 
00893          q = h(m+1,m+1) - zz - r - s 
00894          r = h(m+2,m+1) 
00895          s = abs(p) + abs(q) + abs(r) 
00896          p = p / s 
00897          q = q / s 
00898          r = r / s 
00899          if (m  ==  l) go to 150 
00900          tst1 = abs(p)*(abs(h(m-1,m-1)) + abs(zz) + abs(h(m+1,m+1))) 
00901          tst2 = tst1 + abs(h(m,m-1))*(abs(q) + abs(r)) 
00902          if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 150 
00903   140 continue 
00904 !                                                                       
00905   150 mp2 = m + 2 
00906 !                                                                       
00907       do 160 i = mp2, en 
00908          h(i,i-2) = 0.0_wp 
00909          if (i  ==  mp2) go to 160 
00910          h(i,i-3) = 0.0_wp 
00911   160 continue 
00912 !     .......... double qr step involving rows l to en and              
00913 !                columns m to en ..........                             
00914       do 260 k = m, na 
00915          notlas = k  /=  na 
00916          if (k  ==  m) go to 170 
00917          p = h(k,k-1) 
00918          q = h(k+1,k-1) 
00919          r = 0.0_wp 
00920          if (notlas) r = h(k+2,k-1) 
00921          x = abs(p) + abs(q) + abs(r) 
00922          if (x  ==  0.0_wp) go to 260 
00923          p = p / x 
00924          q = q / x 
00925          r = r / x 
00926   170    s = sign(sqrt(p*p+q*q+r*r),p) 
00927          if (k  ==  m) go to 180 
00928          h(k,k-1) = -s * x 
00929          go to 190 
00930   180    if (l  /=  m) h(k,k-1) = -h(k,k-1) 
00931   190    p = p + s 
00932          x = p / s 
00933          y = q / s 
00934          zz = r / s 
00935          q = q / p 
00936          r = r / p 
00937          if (notlas) go to 225 
00938 !     .......... row modification ..........                            
00939          do 200 j = k, n 
00940             p = h(k,j) + q * h(k+1,j) 
00941             h(k,j) = h(k,j) - p * x 
00942             h(k+1,j) = h(k+1,j) - p * y 
00943   200    continue 
00944 !                                                                       
00945          j = min0(en,k+3) 
00946 !     .......... column modification ..........                         
00947          do 210 i = 1, j 
00948             p = x * h(i,k) + y * h(i,k+1) 
00949             h(i,k) = h(i,k) - p 
00950             h(i,k+1) = h(i,k+1) - p * q 
00951   210    continue 
00952 !     .......... accumulate transformations ..........                  
00953          do 220 i = low, igh 
00954             p = x * z(i,k) + y * z(i,k+1) 
00955             z(i,k) = z(i,k) - p 
00956             z(i,k+1) = z(i,k+1) - p * q 
00957   220    continue 
00958          go to 255 
00959   225    continue 
00960 !     .......... row modification ..........                            
00961          do 230 j = k, n 
00962             p = h(k,j) + q * h(k+1,j) + r * h(k+2,j) 
00963             h(k,j) = h(k,j) - p * x 
00964             h(k+1,j) = h(k+1,j) - p * y 
00965             h(k+2,j) = h(k+2,j) - p * zz 
00966   230    continue 
00967 !                                                                       
00968          j = min0(en,k+3) 
00969 !     .......... column modification ..........                         
00970          do 240 i = 1, j 
00971             p = x * h(i,k) + y * h(i,k+1) + zz * h(i,k+2) 
00972             h(i,k) = h(i,k) - p 
00973             h(i,k+1) = h(i,k+1) - p * q 
00974             h(i,k+2) = h(i,k+2) - p * r 
00975   240    continue 
00976 !     .......... accumulate transformations ..........                  
00977          do 250 i = low, igh 
00978             p = x * z(i,k) + y * z(i,k+1) + zz * z(i,k+2) 
00979             z(i,k) = z(i,k) - p 
00980             z(i,k+1) = z(i,k+1) - p * q 
00981             z(i,k+2) = z(i,k+2) - p * r 
00982   250    continue 
00983   255    continue 
00984 !                                                                       
00985   260 continue 
00986 !                                                                       
00987       go to 70 
00988 !     .......... one root found ..........                              
00989   270 h(en,en) = x + t 
00990       wr(en) = h(en,en) 
00991       wi(en) = 0.0_wp 
00992       en = na 
00993       go to 60 
00994 !     .......... two roots found ..........                             
00995   280 p = (y - x) / 2.0_wp 
00996       q = p * p + w 
00997       zz = sqrt(abs(q)) 
00998       h(en,en) = x + t 
00999       x = h(en,en) 
01000       h(na,na) = y + t 
01001       if (q  <  0.0_wp) go to 320 
01002 !     .......... real pair ..........                                   
01003       zz = p + sign(zz,p) 
01004       wr(na) = x + zz 
01005       wr(en) = wr(na) 
01006       if (zz  /=  0.0_wp) wr(en) = x - w / zz 
01007       wi(na) = 0.0_wp 
01008       wi(en) = 0.0_wp 
01009       x = h(en,na) 
01010       s = abs(x) + abs(zz) 
01011       p = x / s 
01012       q = zz / s 
01013       r = sqrt(p*p+q*q) 
01014       p = p / r 
01015       q = q / r 
01016 !     .......... row modification ..........                            
01017       do 290 j = na, n 
01018          zz = h(na,j) 
01019          h(na,j) = q * zz + p * h(en,j) 
01020          h(en,j) = q * h(en,j) - p * zz 
01021   290 continue 
01022 !     .......... column modification ..........                         
01023       do 300 i = 1, en 
01024          zz = h(i,na) 
01025          h(i,na) = q * zz + p * h(i,en) 
01026          h(i,en) = q * h(i,en) - p * zz 
01027   300 continue 
01028 !     .......... accumulate transformations ..........                  
01029       do 310 i = low, igh 
01030          zz = z(i,na) 
01031          z(i,na) = q * zz + p * z(i,en) 
01032          z(i,en) = q * z(i,en) - p * zz 
01033   310 continue 
01034 !                                                                       
01035       go to 330 
01036 !     .......... complex pair ..........                                
01037   320 wr(na) = x + p 
01038       wr(en) = x + p 
01039       wi(na) = zz 
01040       wi(en) = -zz 
01041   330 en = enm2 
01042       go to 60 
01043 !     .......... all roots found.  backsubstitute to find               
01044 !                vectors of upper triangular form ..........            
01045   340 if (norm  ==  0.0_wp) go to 1001 
01046 !     .......... for en=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........              
01047       do 800 nn = 1, n 
01048          en = n + 1 - nn 
01049          p = wr(en) 
01050          q = wi(en) 
01051          na = en - 1 
01052          if (q) 710, 600, 800 
01053 !     .......... real vector ..........                                 
01054   600    m = en 
01055          h(en,en) = 1.0_wp 
01056          if (na  ==  0) go to 800 
01057 !     .......... for i=en-1 step -1 until 1 do -- ..........            
01058          do 700 ii = 1, na 
01059             i = en - ii 
01060             w = h(i,i) - p 
01061             r = 0.0_wp 
01062 !                                                                       
01063             do 610 j = m, en 
01064   610       r = r + h(i,j) * h(j,en) 
01065 !                                                                       
01066             if (wi(i)  >=  0.0_wp) go to 630 
01067             zz = w 
01068             s = r 
01069             go to 700 
01070   630       m = i 
01071             if (wi(i)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 640 
01072             t = w 
01073             if (t  /=  0.0_wp) go to 635 
01074                tst1 = norm 
01075                t = tst1 
01076   632          t = 0.01_wp * t 
01077                tst2 = norm + t 
01078                if (tst2  >  tst1) go to 632 
01079   635       h(i,en) = -r / t 
01080             go to 680 
01081 !     .......... solve real equations ..........                        
01082   640       x = h(i,i+1) 
01083             y = h(i+1,i) 
01084             q = (wr(i) - p) * (wr(i) - p) + wi(i) * wi(i) 
01085             t = (x * s - zz * r) / q 
01086             h(i,en) = t 
01087             if (abs(x)  <=  abs(zz)) go to 650 
01088             h(i+1,en) = (-r - w * t) / x 
01089             go to 680 
01090   650       h(i+1,en) = (-s - y * t) / zz 
01091 !                                                                       
01092 !     .......... overflow control ..........                            
01093   680       t = abs(h(i,en)) 
01094             if (t  ==  0.0_wp) go to 700 
01095             tst1 = t 
01096             tst2 = tst1 + 1.0_wp/tst1 
01097             if (tst2  >  tst1) go to 700 
01098             do 690 j = i, en 
01099                h(j,en) = h(j,en)/t 
01100   690       continue 
01101 !                                                                       
01102   700    continue 
01103 !     .......... end real vector ..........                             
01104          go to 800 
01105 !     .......... complex vector ..........                              
01106   710    m = na 
01107 !     .......... last vector component chosen imaginary so that         
01108 !                eigenvector matrix is triangular ..........            
01109          if (abs(h(en,na))  <=  abs(h(na,en))) go to 720 
01110          h(na,na) = q / h(en,na) 
01111          h(na,en) = -(h(en,en) - p) / h(en,na) 
01112          go to 730 
01113   720    call cdiv(0.0_wp,-h(na,en),h(na,na)-p,q,h(na,na),h(na,en)) 
01114   730    h(en,na) = 0.0_wp 
01115          h(en,en) = 1.0_wp 
01116          enm2 = na - 1 
01117          if (enm2  ==  0) go to 800 
01118 !     .......... for i=en-2 step -1 until 1 do -- ..........            
01119          do 795 ii = 1, enm2 
01120             i = na - ii 
01121             w = h(i,i) - p 
01122             ra = 0.0_wp 
01123             sa = 0.0_wp 
01124 !                                                                       
01125             do 760 j = m, en 
01126                ra = ra + h(i,j) * h(j,na) 
01127                sa = sa + h(i,j) * h(j,en) 
01128   760       continue 
01129 !                                                                       
01130             if (wi(i)  >=  0.0_wp) go to 770 
01131             zz = w 
01132             r = ra 
01133             s = sa 
01134             go to 795 
01135   770       m = i 
01136             if (wi(i)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 780 
01137             call cdiv(-ra,-sa,w,q,h(i,na),h(i,en)) 
01138             go to 790 
01139 !     .......... solve complex equations ..........                     
01140   780       x = h(i,i+1) 
01141             y = h(i+1,i) 
01142             vr = (wr(i) - p) * (wr(i) - p) + wi(i) * wi(i) - q * q 
01143             vi = (wr(i) - p) * 2.0_wp * q 
01144             if (vr  /=  0.0_wp .or. vi  /=  0.0_wp) go to 784 
01145                tst1 = norm * (abs(w) + abs(q) + abs(x)               &
01146      &                      + abs(y) + abs(zz))                       
01147                vr = tst1 
01148   783          vr = 0.01_wp * vr 
01149                tst2 = tst1 + vr 
01150                if (tst2  >  tst1) go to 783 
01151   784       call cdiv(x*r-zz*ra+q*sa,x*s-zz*sa-q*ra,vr,vi,              &
01152      &                h(i,na),h(i,en))                                  
01153             if (abs(x)  <=  abs(zz) + abs(q)) go to 785 
01154             h(i+1,na) = (-ra - w * h(i,na) + q * h(i,en)) / x 
01155             h(i+1,en) = (-sa - w * h(i,en) - q * h(i,na)) / x 
01156             go to 790 
01157   785       call cdiv(-r-y*h(i,na),-s-y*h(i,en),zz,q,                   &
01158      &                h(i+1,na),h(i+1,en))                              
01159 !                                                                       
01160 !     .......... overflow control ..........                            
01161   790       t = max(abs(h(i,na)), abs(h(i,en))) 
01162             if (t  ==  0.0_wp) go to 795 
01163             tst1 = t 
01164             tst2 = tst1 + 1.0_wp/tst1 
01165             if (tst2  >  tst1) go to 795 
01166             do 792 j = i, en 
01167                h(j,na) = h(j,na)/t 
01168                h(j,en) = h(j,en)/t 
01169   792       continue 
01170 !                                                                       
01171   795    continue 
01172 !     .......... end complex vector ..........                          
01173   800 continue 
01174 !     .......... end back substitution.                                 
01175 !                vectors of isolated roots ..........                   
01176       do 840 i = 1, n 
01177          if (i  >=  low .and. i  <=  igh) go to 840 
01178 !                                                                       
01179          do 820 j = i, n 
01180   820    z(i,j) = h(i,j) 
01181 !                                                                       
01182   840 continue 
01183 !     .......... multiply by transformation matrix to give              
01184 !                vectors of original full matrix.                       
01185 !                for j=n step -1 until low do -- ..........             
01186       do 880 jj = low, n 
01187          j = n + low - jj 
01188          m = min0(j,igh) 
01189 !                                                                       
01190          do 880 i = low, igh 
01191             zz = 0.0_wp 
01192 !                                                                       
01193             do 860 k = low, m 
01194   860       zz = zz + z(i,k) * h(k,j) 
01195 !                                                                       
01196             z(i,j) = zz 
01197   880 continue 
01198 !                                                                       
01199       go to 1001 
01200 !     .......... set error -- all eigenvalues have not                  
01201 !                converged after 30*n iterations ..........             
01202  1000 ierr = en 
01203  1001 return 
01204       end subroutine hqr2
01205 
01206 !=============================================================================80
01207 
01208       subroutine hqr(nm,n,low,igh,h,wr,wi,ierr) 
01209 !  RESTORED CORRECT INDICES OF LOOPS (200,210,230,240). (9/29/89 BSG)   
01210 !                                                                       
01211       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,en,ll,mm,na,nm,igh,itn,its,low,mp2,enm2,ierr 
01212       real(wp) h(nm,n),wr(n),wi(n) 
01213       real(wp) p,q,r,s,t,w,x,y,zz,norm,tst1,tst2 
01214       logical notlas 
01215 !                                                                       
01216 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure hqr,      
01217 !     num. math. 14, 219-231(1970) by martin, peters, and wilkinson.    
01218 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 359-371(1971).   
01219 !                                                                       
01220 !     this subroutine finds the eigenvalues of a real                   
01221 !     upper hessenberg matrix by the qr method.                         
01222 !                                                                       
01223 !     on input                                                          
01224 !                                                                       
01225 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
01226 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
01227 !          dimension statement.                                         
01228 !                                                                       
01229 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
01230 !                                                                       
01231 !        low and igh are integers determined by the balancing           
01232 !          subroutine  balanc.  if  balanc  has not been used,          
01233 !          set low=1, igh=n.                                            
01234 !                                                                       
01235 !        h contains the upper hessenberg matrix.  information about     
01236 !          the transformations used in the reduction to hessenberg      
01237 !          form by  elmhes  or  orthes, if performed, is stored         
01238 !          in the remaining triangle under the hessenberg matrix.       
01239 !                                                                       
01240 !     on output                                                         
01241 !                                                                       
01242 !        h has been destroyed.  therefore, it must be saved             
01243 !          before calling  hqr  if subsequent calculation and           
01244 !          back transformation of eigenvectors is to be performed.      
01245 !                                                                       
01246 !        wr and wi contain the real and imaginary parts,                
01247 !          respectively, of the eigenvalues.  the eigenvalues           
01248 !          are unordered except that complex conjugate pairs            
01249 !          of values appear consecutively with the eigenvalue           
01250 !          having the positive imaginary part first.  if an             
01251 !          error exit is made, the eigenvalues should be correct        
01252 !          for indices ierr+1,...,n.                                    
01253 !                                                                       
01254 !        ierr is set to                                                 
01255 !          zero       for normal return,                                
01256 !          j          if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted      
01257 !                     while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.        
01258 !                                                                       
01259 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
01260 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
01261 !                                                                       
01262 !     this version dated september 1989.                                
01263 !                                                                       
01264 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
01265 !                                                                       
01266       ierr = 0 
01267       norm = 0.0_wp 
01268       k = 1 
01269 !     .......... store roots isolated by balanc                         
01270 !                and compute matrix norm ..........                     
01271       do 50 i = 1, n 
01272 !                                                                       
01273          do 40 j = k, n 
01274    40    norm = norm + abs(h(i,j)) 
01275 !                                                                       
01276          k = i 
01277          if (i  >=  low .and. i  <=  igh) go to 50 
01278          wr(i) = h(i,i) 
01279          wi(i) = 0.0_wp 
01280    50 continue 
01281 !                                                                       
01282       en = igh 
01283       t = 0.0_wp 
01284       itn = 30*n 
01285 !     .......... search for next eigenvalues ..........                 
01286    60 if (en  <  low) go to 1001 
01287       its = 0 
01288       na = en - 1 
01289       enm2 = na - 1 
01290 !     .......... look for single small sub-diagonal element             
01291 !                for l=en step -1 until low do -- ..........            
01292    70 do 80 ll = low, en 
01293          l = en + low - ll 
01294          if (l  ==  low) go to 100 
01295          s = abs(h(l-1,l-1)) + abs(h(l,l)) 
01296          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) s = norm 
01297          tst1 = s 
01298          tst2 = tst1 + abs(h(l,l-1)) 
01299          if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 100 
01300    80 continue 
01301 !     .......... form shift ..........                                  
01302   100 x = h(en,en) 
01303       if (l  ==  en) go to 270 
01304       y = h(na,na) 
01305       w = h(en,na) * h(na,en) 
01306       if (l  ==  na) go to 280 
01307       if (itn  ==  0) go to 1000 
01308       if (its  /=  10 .and. its  /=  20) go to 130 
01309 !     .......... form exceptional shift ..........                      
01310       t = t + x 
01311 !                                                                       
01312       do 120 i = low, en 
01313   120 h(i,i) = h(i,i) - x 
01314 !                                                                       
01315       s = abs(h(en,na)) + abs(h(na,enm2)) 
01316       x = 0.75_wp * s 
01317       y = x 
01318       w = -0.4375_wp * s * s 
01319   130 its = its + 1 
01320       itn = itn - 1 
01321 !     .......... look for two consecutive small                         
01322 !                sub-diagonal elements.                                 
01323 !                for m=en-2 step -1 until l do -- ..........            
01324       do 140 mm = l, enm2 
01325          m = enm2 + l - mm 
01326          zz = h(m,m) 
01327          r = x - zz 
01328          s = y - zz 
01329          p = (r * s - w) / h(m+1,m) + h(m,m+1) 
01330          q = h(m+1,m+1) - zz - r - s 
01331          r = h(m+2,m+1) 
01332          s = abs(p) + abs(q) + abs(r) 
01333          p = p / s 
01334          q = q / s 
01335          r = r / s 
01336          if (m  ==  l) go to 150 
01337          tst1 = abs(p)*(abs(h(m-1,m-1)) + abs(zz) + abs(h(m+1,m+1))) 
01338          tst2 = tst1 + abs(h(m,m-1))*(abs(q) + abs(r)) 
01339          if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 150 
01340   140 continue 
01341 !                                                                       
01342   150 mp2 = m + 2 
01343 !                                                                       
01344       do 160 i = mp2, en 
01345          h(i,i-2) = 0.0_wp 
01346          if (i  ==  mp2) go to 160 
01347          h(i,i-3) = 0.0_wp 
01348   160 continue 
01349 !     .......... double qr step involving rows l to en and              
01350 !                columns m to en ..........                             
01351       do 260 k = m, na 
01352          notlas = k  /=  na 
01353          if (k  ==  m) go to 170 
01354          p = h(k,k-1) 
01355          q = h(k+1,k-1) 
01356          r = 0.0_wp 
01357          if (notlas) r = h(k+2,k-1) 
01358          x = abs(p) + abs(q) + abs(r) 
01359          if (x  ==  0.0_wp) go to 260 
01360          p = p / x 
01361          q = q / x 
01362          r = r / x 
01363   170    s = sign(sqrt(p*p+q*q+r*r),p) 
01364          if (k  ==  m) go to 180 
01365          h(k,k-1) = -s * x 
01366          go to 190 
01367   180    if (l  /=  m) h(k,k-1) = -h(k,k-1) 
01368   190    p = p + s 
01369          x = p / s 
01370          y = q / s 
01371          zz = r / s 
01372          q = q / p 
01373          r = r / p 
01374          if (notlas) go to 225 
01375 !     .......... row modification ..........                            
01376          do 200 j = k, EN 
01377             p = h(k,j) + q * h(k+1,j) 
01378             h(k,j) = h(k,j) - p * x 
01379             h(k+1,j) = h(k+1,j) - p * y 
01380   200    continue 
01381 !                                                                       
01382          j = min0(en,k+3) 
01383 !     .......... column modification ..........                         
01384          do 210 i = L, j 
01385             p = x * h(i,k) + y * h(i,k+1) 
01386             h(i,k) = h(i,k) - p 
01387             h(i,k+1) = h(i,k+1) - p * q 
01388   210    continue 
01389          go to 255 
01390   225    continue 
01391 !     .......... row modification ..........                            
01392          do 230 j = k, EN 
01393             p = h(k,j) + q * h(k+1,j) + r * h(k+2,j) 
01394             h(k,j) = h(k,j) - p * x 
01395             h(k+1,j) = h(k+1,j) - p * y 
01396             h(k+2,j) = h(k+2,j) - p * zz 
01397   230    continue 
01398 !                                                                       
01399          j = min0(en,k+3) 
01400 !     .......... column modification ..........                         
01401          do 240 i = L, j 
01402             p = x * h(i,k) + y * h(i,k+1) + zz * h(i,k+2) 
01403             h(i,k) = h(i,k) - p 
01404             h(i,k+1) = h(i,k+1) - p * q 
01405             h(i,k+2) = h(i,k+2) - p * r 
01406   240    continue 
01407   255    continue 
01408 !                                                                       
01409   260 continue 
01410 !                                                                       
01411       go to 70 
01412 !     .......... one root found ..........                              
01413   270 wr(en) = x + t 
01414       wi(en) = 0.0_wp 
01415       en = na 
01416       go to 60 
01417 !     .......... two roots found ..........                             
01418   280 p = (y - x) / 2.0_wp 
01419       q = p * p + w 
01420       zz = sqrt(abs(q)) 
01421       x = x + t 
01422       if (q  <  0.0_wp) go to 320 
01423 !     .......... real pair ..........                                   
01424       zz = p + sign(zz,p) 
01425       wr(na) = x + zz 
01426       wr(en) = wr(na) 
01427       if (zz  /=  0.0_wp) wr(en) = x - w / zz 
01428       wi(na) = 0.0_wp 
01429       wi(en) = 0.0_wp 
01430       go to 330 
01431 !     .......... complex pair ..........                                
01432   320 wr(na) = x + p 
01433       wr(en) = x + p 
01434       wi(na) = zz 
01435       wi(en) = -zz 
01436   330 en = enm2 
01437       go to 60 
01438 !     .......... set error -- all eigenvalues have not                  
01439 !                converged after 30*n iterations ..........             
01440  1000 ierr = en 
01441  1001 return 
01442       end subroutine hqr
01443 
01444 !=============================================================================80
01445 
01446       subroutine imtqlv(n,d,e,e2,w,ind,ierr,rv1) 
01447 !                                                                       
01448       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,ii,mml,tag,ierr 
01449       real(wp) d(n),e(n),e2(n),w(n),rv1(n) 
01450       real(wp) b,c,f,g,p,r,s,tst1,tst2
01451       integer ind(n) 
01452 !                                                                       
01453 !     this subroutine is a variant of  imtql1  which is a translation of
01454 !     algol procedure imtql1, num. math. 12, 377-383(1968) by martin and
01455 !     wilkinson, as modified in num. math. 15, 450(1970) by dubrulle.   
01456 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 241-248(1971).   
01457 !                                                                       
01458 !     this subroutine finds the eigenvalues of a symmetric tridiagonal  
01459 !     matrix by the implicit ql method and associates with them         
01460 !     their corresponding submatrix indices.                            
01461 !                                                                       
01462 !     on input                                                          
01463 !                                                                       
01464 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
01465 !                                                                       
01466 !        d contains the diagonal elements of the input matrix.          
01467 !                                                                       
01468 !        e contains the subdiagonal elements of the input matrix        
01469 !          in its last n-1 positions.  e(1) is arbitrary.               
01470 !                                                                       
01471 !        e2 contains the squares of the corresponding elements of e.    
01472 !          e2(1) is arbitrary.                                          
01473 !                                                                       
01474 !     on output                                                         
01475 !                                                                       
01476 !        d and e are unaltered.                                         
01477 !                                                                       
01478 !        elements of e2, corresponding to elements of e regarded        
01479 !          as negligible, have been replaced by zero causing the        
01480 !          matrix to split into a direct sum of submatrices.            
01481 !          e2(1) is also set to zero.                                   
01482 !                                                                       
01483 !        w contains the eigenvalues in ascending order.  if an          
01484 !          error exit is made, the eigenvalues are correct and          
01485 !          ordered for indices 1,2,...ierr-1, but may not be            
01486 !          the smallest eigenvalues.                                    
01487 !                                                                       
01488 !        ind contains the submatrix indices associated with the         
01489 !          corresponding eigenvalues in w -- 1 for eigenvalues          
01490 !          belonging to the first submatrix from the top,               
01491 !          2 for those belonging to the second submatrix, etc..         
01492 !                                                                       
01493 !        ierr is set to                                                 
01494 !          zero       for normal return,                                
01495 !          j          if the j-th eigenvalue has not been               
01496 !                     determined after 30 iterations.                   
01497 !                                                                       
01498 !        rv1 is a temporary storage array.                              
01499 !                                                                       
01500 !     calls pythag for  sqrt(a*a + b*b) .                              
01501 !                                                                       
01502 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
01503 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
01504 !                                                                       
01505 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
01506 !                                                                       
01507 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
01508 !                                                                       
01509       ierr = 0 
01510       k = 0 
01511       tag = 0 
01512 !                                                                       
01513       do 100 i = 1, n 
01514          w(i) = d(i) 
01515          if (i  /=  1) rv1(i-1) = e(i) 
01516   100 continue 
01517 !                                                                       
01518       e2(1) = 0.0_wp 
01519       rv1(n) = 0.0_wp 
01520 !                                                                       
01521       do 290 l = 1, n 
01522          j = 0 
01523 !     .......... look for small sub-diagonal element ..........         
01524   105    do 110 m = l, n 
01525             if (m  ==  n) go to 120 
01526             tst1 = abs(w(m)) + abs(w(m+1)) 
01527             tst2 = tst1 + abs(rv1(m))
