01528             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 120 
01529 !     .......... guard against underflowed element of e2 ..........     
01530             if (e2(m+1)  ==  0.0_wp) go to 125 
01531   110    continue 
01532 !                                                                       
01533   120    if (m  <=  k) go to 130 
01534          if (m  /=  n) e2(m+1) = 0.0_wp 
01535   125    k = m 
01536          tag = tag + 1 
01537   130    p = w(l) 
01538          if (m  ==  l) go to 215 
01539          if (j  ==  30) go to 1000 
01540          j = j + 1 
01541 !     .......... form shift ..........                                  
01542          g = (w(l+1) - p) / (2.0_wp * rv1(l)) 
01543          r = pythag(g,1.0_wp) 
01544          g = w(m) - p + rv1(l) / (g + sign(r,g)) 
01545          s = 1.0_wp 
01546          c = 1.0_wp 
01547          p = 0.0_wp 
01548          mml = m - l 
01549 !     .......... for i=m-1 step -1 until l do -- ..........             
01550          do 200 ii = 1, mml 
01551             i = m - ii 
01552             f = s * rv1(i) 
01553             b = c * rv1(i) 
01554             r = pythag(f,g) 
01555             rv1(i+1) = r 
01556             if (r  ==  0.0_wp) go to 210 
01557             s = f / r 
01558             c = g / r 
01559             g = w(i+1) - p 
01560             r = (w(i) - g) * s + 2.0_wp * c * b 
01561             p = s * r 
01562             w(i+1) = g + p 
01563             g = c * r - b 
01564   200    continue 
01565 !                                                                       
01566          w(l) = w(l) - p 
01567          rv1(l) = g 
01568          rv1(m) = 0.0_wp 
01569          go to 105 
01570 !     .......... recover from underflow ..........                      
01571   210    w(i+1) = w(i+1) - p 
01572          rv1(m) = 0.0_wp 
01573          go to 105 
01574 !     .......... order eigenvalues ..........                           
01575   215    if (l  ==  1) go to 250 
01576 !     .......... for i=l step -1 until 2 do -- ..........               
01577          do 230 ii = 2, l 
01578             i = l + 2 - ii 
01579             if (p  >=  w(i-1)) go to 270 
01580             w(i) = w(i-1) 
01581             ind(i) = ind(i-1) 
01582   230    continue 
01583 !                                                                       
01584   250    i = 1 
01585   270    w(i) = p 
01586          ind(i) = tag 
01587   290 continue 
01588 !                                                                       
01589       go to 1001 
01590 !     .......... set error -- no convergence to an                      
01591 !                eigenvalue after 30 iterations ..........              
01592  1000 ierr = l 
01593  1001 return 
01594       end subroutine imtqlv
01595 
01596 !=============================================================================80
01597 
01598       subroutine minfit(nm,m,n,a,w,ip,b,ierr,rv1) 
01599 !                                                                       
01600       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,ii,ip,i1,kk,k1,ll,l1,m1,nm,its,ierr 
01601       real(wp) a(nm,n),w(n),b(nm,ip),rv1(n) 
01602       real(wp) c,f,g,h,s,x,y,z,tst1,tst2,scale
01603 !                                                                       
01604 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure minfit,   
01605 !     num. math. 14, 403-420(1970) by golub and reinsch.                
01606 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol ii-linear algebra, 134-151(1971).   
01607 !                                                                       
01608 !     this subroutine determines, towards the solution of the linear    
01609 !                                                        t              
01610 !     system ax=b, the singular value decomposition a=usv  of a real    
01611 !                                         t                             
01612 !     m by n rectangular matrix, forming u b rather than u.  householder
01613 !     bidiagonalization and a variant of the qr algorithm are used.     
01614 !                                                                       
01615 !     on input                                                          
01616 !                                                                       
01617 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
01618 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
01619 !          dimension statement.  note that nm must be at least          
01620 !          as large as the maximum of m and n.                          
01621 !                                                                       
01622 !        m is the number of rows of a and b.                            
01623 !                                                                       
01624 !        n is the number of columns of a and the order of v.            
01625 !                                                                       
01626 !        a contains the rectangular coefficient matrix of the system.   
01627 !                                                                       
01628 !        ip is the number of columns of b.  ip can be zero.             
01629 !                                                                       
01630 !        b contains the constant column matrix of the system            
01631 !          if ip is not zero.  otherwise b is not referenced.           
01632 !                                                                       
01633 !     on output                                                         
01634 !                                                                       
01635 !        a has been overwritten by the matrix v (orthogonal) of the     
01636 !          decomposition in its first n rows and columns.  if an        
01637 !          error exit is made, the columns of v corresponding to        
01638 !          indices of correct singular values should be correct.        
01639 !                                                                       
01640 !        w contains the n (non-negative) singular values of a (the      
01641 !          diagonal elements of s).  they are unordered.  if an         
01642 !          error exit is made, the singular values should be correct    
01643 !          for indices ierr+1,ierr+2,...,n.                             
01644 !                                                                       
01645 !                                   t                                   
01646 !        b has been overwritten by u b.  if an error exit is made,      
01647 !                       t                                               
01648 !          the rows of u b corresponding to indices of correct          
01649 !          singular values should be correct.                           
01650 !                                                                       
01651 !        ierr is set to                                                 
01652 !          zero       for normal return,                                
01653 !          k          if the k-th singular value has not been           
01654 !                     determined after 30 iterations.                   
01655 !                                                                       
01656 !        rv1 is a temporary storage array.                              
01657 !                                                                       
01658 !     calls pythag for  sqrt(a*a + b*b) .                              
01659 !                                                                       
01660 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
01661 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
01662 !                                                                       
01663 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
01664 !                                                                       
01665 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
01666 !                                                                       
01667       ierr = 0 
01668 !     .......... householder reduction to bidiagonal form ..........    
01669       g = 0.0_wp 
01670       scale = 0.0_wp 
01671       x = 0.0_wp 
01672 !                                                                       
01673       do 300 i = 1, n 
01674          l = i + 1 
01675          rv1(i) = scale * g 
01676          g = 0.0_wp 
01677          s = 0.0_wp 
01678          scale = 0.0_wp 
01679          if (i  >  m) go to 210 
01680 !                                                                       
01681          do 120 k = i, m 
01682   120    scale = scale + abs(a(k,i)) 
01683 !                                                                       
01684          if (scale  ==  0.0_wp) go to 210 
01685 !                                                                       
01686          do 130 k = i, m 
01687             a(k,i) = a(k,i) / scale 
01688             s = s + a(k,i)**2 
01689   130    continue 
01690 !                                                                       
01691          f = a(i,i) 
01692          g = -sign(sqrt(s),f) 
01693          h = f * g - s 
01694          a(i,i) = f - g 
01695          if (i  ==  n) go to 160 
01696 !                                                                       
01697          do 150 j = l, n 
01698             s = 0.0_wp 
01699 !                                                                       
01700             do 140 k = i, m 
01701   140       s = s + a(k,i) * a(k,j) 
01702 !                                                                       
01703             f = s / h 
01704 !                                                                       
01705             do 150 k = i, m 
01706                a(k,j) = a(k,j) + f * a(k,i) 
01707   150    continue 
01708 !                                                                       
01709   160    if (ip  ==  0) go to 190 
01710 !                                                                       
01711          do 180 j = 1, ip 
01712             s = 0.0_wp 
01713 !                                                                       
01714             do 170 k = i, m 
01715   170       s = s + a(k,i) * b(k,j) 
01716 !                                                                       
01717             f = s / h 
01718 !                                                                       
01719             do 180 k = i, m 
01720                b(k,j) = b(k,j) + f * a(k,i) 
01721   180    continue 
01722 !                                                                       
01723   190    do 200 k = i, m 
01724   200    a(k,i) = scale * a(k,i) 
01725 !                                                                       
01726   210    w(i) = scale * g 
01727          g = 0.0_wp 
01728          s = 0.0_wp 
01729          scale = 0.0_wp 
01730          if (i  >  m .or. i  ==  n) go to 290 
01731 !                                                                       
01732          do 220 k = l, n 
01733   220    scale = scale + abs(a(i,k)) 
01734 !                                                                       
01735          if (scale  ==  0.0_wp) go to 290 
01736 !                                                                       
01737          do 230 k = l, n 
01738             a(i,k) = a(i,k) / scale 
01739             s = s + a(i,k)**2 
01740   230    continue 
01741 !                                                                       
01742          f = a(i,l) 
01743          g = -sign(sqrt(s),f) 
01744          h = f * g - s 
01745          a(i,l) = f - g 
01746 !                                                                       
01747          do 240 k = l, n 
01748   240    rv1(k) = a(i,k) / h 
01749 !                                                                       
01750          if (i  ==  m) go to 270 
01751 !                                                                       
01752          do 260 j = l, m 
01753             s = 0.0_wp 
01754 !                                                                       
01755             do 250 k = l, n 
01756   250       s = s + a(j,k) * a(i,k) 
01757 !                                                                       
01758             do 260 k = l, n 
01759                a(j,k) = a(j,k) + s * rv1(k) 
01760   260    continue 
01761 !                                                                       
01762   270    do 280 k = l, n 
01763   280    a(i,k) = scale * a(i,k) 
01764 !                                                                       
01765   290    x = max(x,abs(w(i))+abs(rv1(i))) 
01766   300 continue 
01767 !     .......... accumulation of right-hand transformations.            
01768 !                for i=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
01769       do 400 ii = 1, n 
01770          i = n + 1 - ii 
01771          if (i  ==  n) go to 390 
01772          if (g  ==  0.0_wp) go to 360 
01773 !                                                                       
01774          do 320 j = l, n 
01775 !     .......... double division avoids possible underflow ..........   
01776   320    a(j,i) = (a(i,j) / a(i,l)) / g 
01777 !                                                                       
01778          do 350 j = l, n 
01779             s = 0.0_wp 
01780 !                                                                       
01781             do 340 k = l, n 
01782   340       s = s + a(i,k) * a(k,j) 
01783 !                                                                       
01784             do 350 k = l, n 
01785                a(k,j) = a(k,j) + s * a(k,i) 
01786   350    continue 
01787 !                                                                       
01788   360    do 380 j = l, n 
01789             a(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
01790             a(j,i) = 0.0_wp 
01791   380    continue 
01792 !                                                                       
01793   390    a(i,i) = 1.0_wp 
01794          g = rv1(i) 
01795          l = i 
01796   400 continue 
01797 !                                                                       
01798       if (m  >=  n .or. ip  ==  0) go to 510 
01799       m1 = m + 1 
01800 !                                                                       
01801       do 500 i = m1, n 
01802 !                                                                       
01803          do 500 j = 1, ip 
01804             b(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
01805   500 continue 
01806 !     .......... diagonalization of the bidiagonal form ..........      
01807   510 tst1 = x 
01808 !     .......... for k=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
01809       do 700 kk = 1, n 
01810          k1 = n - kk 
01811          k = k1 + 1 
01812          its = 0 
01813 !     .......... test for splitting.                                    
01814 !                for l=k step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
01815   520    do 530 ll = 1, k 
01816             l1 = k - ll 
01817             l = l1 + 1 
01818             tst2 = tst1 + abs(rv1(l)) 
01819             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 565 
01820 !     .......... rv1(1) is always zero, so there is no exit             
01821 !                through the bottom of the loop ..........              
01822             tst2 = tst1 + abs(w(l1)) 
01823             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 540 
01824   530    continue 
01825 !     .......... cancellation of rv1(l) if l greater than 1 ..........  
01826   540    c = 0.0_wp 
01827          s = 1.0_wp 
01828 !                                                                       
01829          do 560 i = l, k 
01830             f = s * rv1(i) 
01831             rv1(i) = c * rv1(i) 
01832             tst2 = tst1 + abs(f) 
01833             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 565 
01834             g = w(i) 
01835             h = pythag(f,g) 
01836             w(i) = h 
01837             c = g / h 
01838             s = -f / h 
01839             if (ip  ==  0) go to 560 
01840 !                                                                       
01841             do 550 j = 1, ip 
01842                y = b(l1,j) 
01843                z = b(i,j) 
01844                b(l1,j) = y * c + z * s 
01845                b(i,j) = -y * s + z * c 
01846   550       continue 
01847 !                                                                       
01848   560    continue 
01849 !     .......... test for convergence ..........                        
01850   565    z = w(k) 
01851          if (l  ==  k) go to 650 
01852 !     .......... shift from bottom 2 by 2 minor ..........              
01853          if (its  ==  30) go to 1000 
01854          its = its + 1 
01855          x = w(l) 
01856          y = w(k1) 
01857          g = rv1(k1) 
01858          h = rv1(k) 
01859          f = 0.5_wp* (((g + z) / h) * ((g - z) / y) + y / h - h / y) 
01860          g = pythag(f,1.0_wp) 
01861          f = x - (z / x) * z + (h / x) * (y / (f + sign(g,f)) - h) 
01862 !     .......... next qr transformation ..........                      
01863          c = 1.0_wp 
01864          s = 1.0_wp 
01865 !                                                                       
01866          do 600 i1 = l, k1 
01867             i = i1 + 1 
01868             g = rv1(i) 
01869             y = w(i) 
01870             h = s * g 
01871             g = c * g 
01872             z = pythag(f,h) 
01873             rv1(i1) = z 
01874             c = f / z 
01875             s = h / z 
01876             f = x * c + g * s 
01877             g = -x * s + g * c 
01878             h = y * s 
01879             y = y * c 
01880 !                                                                       
01881             do 570 j = 1, n 
01882                x = a(j,i1) 
01883                z = a(j,i) 
01884                a(j,i1) = x * c + z * s 
01885                a(j,i) = -x * s + z * c 
01886   570       continue 
01887 !                                                                       
01888             z = pythag(f,h) 
01889             w(i1) = z 
01890 !     .......... rotation can be arbitrary if z is zero ..........      
01891             if (z  ==  0.0_wp) go to 580 
01892             c = f / z 
01893             s = h / z 
01894   580       f = c * g + s * y 
01895             x = -s * g + c * y 
01896             if (ip  ==  0) go to 600 
01897 !                                                                       
01898             do 590 j = 1, ip 
01899                y = b(i1,j) 
01900                z = b(i,j) 
01901                b(i1,j) = y * c + z * s 
01902                b(i,j) = -y * s + z * c 
01903   590       continue 
01904 !                                                                       
01905   600    continue 
01906 !                                                                       
01907          rv1(l) = 0.0_wp 
01908          rv1(k) = f 
01909          w(k) = x 
01910          go to 520 
01911 !     .......... convergence ..........                                 
01912   650    if (z  >=  0.0_wp) go to 700 
01913 !     .......... w(k) is made non-negative ..........                   
01914          w(k) = -z 
01915 !                                                                       
01916          do 690 j = 1, n 
01917   690    a(j,k) = -a(j,k) 
01918 !                                                                       
01919   700 continue 
01920 !                                                                       
01921       go to 1001 
01922 !     .......... set error -- no convergence to a                       
01923 !                singular value after 30 iterations ..........          
01924  1000 ierr = k 
01925  1001 return 
01926       end subroutine minfit
01927 
01928 !=============================================================================80
01929 
01930       subroutine tqlrat(n,d,e2,ierr) 
01931 !                                                                       
01932       integer i,j,l,m,n,ii,l1,mml,ierr 
01933       real(wp) d(n),e2(n) 
01934       real(wp) b,c,f,g,h,p,r,s,t
01935 !                                                                       
01936 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure tqlrat,   
01937 !     algorithm 464, comm. acm 16, 689(1973) by reinsch.                
01938 !                                                                       
01939 !     this subroutine finds the eigenvalues of a symmetric              
01940 !     tridiagonal matrix by the rational ql method.                     
01941 !                                                                       
01942 !     on input                                                          
01943 !                                                                       
01944 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
01945 !                                                                       
01946 !        d contains the diagonal elements of the input matrix.          
01947 !                                                                       
01948 !        e2 contains the squares of the subdiagonal elements of the     
01949 !          input matrix in its last n-1 positions.  e2(1) is arbitrary. 
01950 !                                                                       
01951 !      on output                                                        
01952 !                                                                       
01953 !        d contains the eigenvalues in ascending order.  if an          
01954 !          error exit is made, the eigenvalues are correct and          
01955 !          ordered for indices 1,2,...ierr-1, but may not be            
01956 !          the smallest eigenvalues.                                    
01957 !                                                                       
01958 !        e2 has been destroyed.                                         
01959 !                                                                       
01960 !        ierr is set to                                                 
01961 !          zero       for normal return,                                
01962 !          j          if the j-th eigenvalue has not been               
01963 !                     determined after 30 iterations.                   
01964 !                                                                       
01965 !     calls pythag for  sqrt(a*a + b*b) .                              
01966 !                                                                       
01967 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
01968 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
01969 !                                                                       
01970 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
01971 !                                                                       
01972 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
01973 !                                                                       
01974       ierr = 0 
01975       if (n  ==  1) go to 1001 
01976 !                                                                       
01977       do 100 i = 2, n 
01978   100 e2(i-1) = e2(i) 
01979 !                                                                       
01980       f = 0.0_wp 
01981       t = 0.0_wp 
01982       e2(n) = 0.0_wp 
01983 !                                                                       
01984       do 290 l = 1, n 
01985          j = 0 
01986          h = abs(d(l)) + sqrt(e2(l)) 
01987          if (t  >  h) go to 105 
01988          t = h 
01989          b = epslon(t) 
01990          c = b * b 
01991 !     .......... look for small squared sub-diagonal element .......... 
01992   105    do 110 m = l, n 
01993             if (e2(m)  <=  c) go to 120 
01994 !     .......... e2(n) is always zero, so there is no exit              
01995 !                through the bottom of the loop ..........              
01996   110    continue 
01997 !                                                                       
01998   120    if (m  ==  l) go to 210 
01999   130    if (j  ==  50) go to 1000 
02000          j = j + 1 
02001 !     .......... form shift ..........                                  
02002          l1 = l + 1 
02003          s = sqrt(e2(l)) 
02004          g = d(l) 
02005          p = (d(l1) - g) / (2.0_wp * s) 
02006          r = pythag(p,1.0_wp) 
02007          d(l) = s / (p + sign(r,p)) 
02008          h = g - d(l) 
02009 !                                                                       
02010          do 140 i = l1, n 
02011   140    d(i) = d(i) - h 
02012 !                                                                       
02013          f = f + h 
02014 !     .......... rational ql transformation ..........                  
02015          g = d(m) 
02016          if (g  ==  0.0_wp) g = b 
02017          h = g 
02018          s = 0.0_wp 
02019          mml = m - l 
02020 !     .......... for i=m-1 step -1 until l do -- ..........             
02021          do 200 ii = 1, mml 
02022             i = m - ii 
02023             p = g * h 
02024             r = p + e2(i) 
02025             e2(i+1) = s * r 
02026             s = e2(i) / r 
02027             d(i+1) = h + s * (h + d(i)) 
02028             g = d(i) - e2(i) / g 
02029             if (g  ==  0.0_wp) g = b 
02030             h = g * p / r 
02031   200    continue 
02032 !                                                                       
02033          e2(l) = s * g 
02034          d(l) = h 
02035 !     .......... guard against underflow in convergence test .......... 
02036          if (h  ==  0.0_wp) go to 210 
02037          if (abs(e2(l))  <=  abs(c/h)) go to 210 
02038          e2(l) = h * e2(l) 
02039          if (e2(l)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 130 
02040   210    p = d(l) + f 
02041 !     .......... order eigenvalues ..........                           
02042          if (l  ==  1) go to 250 
02043 !     .......... for i=l step -1 until 2 do -- ..........               
02044          do 230 ii = 2, l 
02045             i = l + 2 - ii 
02046             if (p  >=  d(i-1)) go to 270 
02047             d(i) = d(i-1) 
02048   230    continue 
02049 !                                                                       
02050   250    i = 1 
02051   270    d(i) = p 
02052   290 continue 
02053 !                                                                       
02054       go to 1001 
02055 !     .......... set error -- no convergence to an                      
02056 !                eigenvalue after 30 iterations ..........              
02057  1000 ierr = l 
02058  1001 return 
02059       end subroutine tqlrat
02060 
02061 !=============================================================================80
02062 
02063       real(wp) function pythag(a,b) 
02064       real(wp) a,b 
02065 !                                                                       
02066 !     finds sqrt(a**2+b**2) without overflow or destructive underflow  
02067 !                                                                       
02068       real(wp) p,r,s,t,u 
02069       p = max(abs(a),abs(b)) 
02070       if (p  ==  0.0_wp) go to 20 
02071       r = (min(abs(a),abs(b))/p)**2 
02072    10 continue 
02073          t = 4.0_wp + r 
02074          if (t  ==  4.0_wp) go to 20 
02075          s = r/t 
02076          u = 1.0_wp + 2.0_wp*s 
02077          p = u*p 
02078          r = (s/u)**2 * r 
02079       go to 10 
02080    20 pythag = p 
02081       return 
02082       end function pythag
02083 
02084 !=============================================================================80
02085 
02086       subroutine qsortd(x,ind,n)
02087 
02088 !       Code converted using TO_F90 by Alan Miller
02089 !       Date: 2002-12-18  Time: 11:55:47
02090 
02091       real(wp), INTENT(IN)  :: x(:)
02092       INTEGER, INTENT(OUT)   :: ind(:)
02093       INTEGER, INTENT(IN)    :: n
02094 
02095 !***************************************************************************
02096 
02097 !                                                         ROBERT RENKA
02098 !                                                 OAK RIDGE NATL. LAB.
02099 
02100 !   THIS SUBROUTINE USES AN ORDER N*LOG(N) QUICK SORT TO SORT A REAL(wp)
02101 ! ARRAY X INTO INCREASING ORDER.  THE ALGORITHM IS AS FOLLOWS.  IND IS
02102 ! INITIALIZED TO THE ORDERED SEQUENCE OF INDICES 1,...,N, AND ALL INTERCHANGES
02103 ! ARE APPLIED TO IND.  X IS DIVIDED INTO TWO PORTIONS BY PICKING A CENTRAL
02104 ! ELEMENT T.  THE FIRST AND LAST ELEMENTS ARE COMPARED WITH T, AND
02105 ! INTERCHANGES ARE APPLIED AS NECESSARY SO THAT THE THREE VALUES ARE IN
02106 ! ASCENDING ORDER.  INTERCHANGES ARE THEN APPLIED SO THAT ALL ELEMENTS
02107 ! GREATER THAN T ARE IN THE UPPER PORTION OF THE ARRAY AND ALL ELEMENTS
02108 ! LESS THAN T ARE IN THE LOWER PORTION.  THE UPPER AND LOWER INDICES OF ONE
02109 ! OF THE PORTIONS ARE SAVED IN LOCAL ARRAYS, AND THE PROCESS IS REPEATED
02110 ! ITERATIVELY ON THE OTHER PORTION.  WHEN A PORTION IS COMPLETELY SORTED,
02111 ! THE PROCESS BEGINS AGAIN BY RETRIEVING THE INDICES BOUNDING ANOTHER
02112 ! UNSORTED PORTION.
02113 
02114 ! INPUT PARAMETERS -   N - LENGTH OF THE ARRAY X.
02115 
02116 !                      X - VECTOR OF LENGTH N TO BE SORTED.
02117 
02118 !                    IND - VECTOR OF LENGTH >= N.
02119 
02120 ! N AND X ARE NOT ALTERED BY THIS ROUTINE.
02121 
02122 ! OUTPUT PARAMETER - IND - SEQUENCE OF INDICES 1,...,N PERMUTED IN THE SAME
02123 !                          FASHION AS X WOULD BE.  THUS, THE ORDERING ON
02124 !                          X IS DEFINED BY Y(I) = X(IND(I)).
02125 
02126 !*********************************************************************
02127 
02128 ! NOTE -- IU AND IL MUST BE DIMENSIONED >= LOG(N) WHERE LOG HAS BASE 2.
02129 
02130 !*********************************************************************
02131 
02132       INTEGER     :: iu(21), il(21)
02133       INTEGER     :: m, i, j, k, l, ij, it, itt, indx
02134       REAL        :: r
02135       REAL(wp) :: t
02136 
02137 ! LOCAL PARAMETERS -
02138 
02139 ! IU,IL =  TEMPORARY STORAGE FOR THE UPPER AND LOWER
02140 !            INDICES OF PORTIONS OF THE ARRAY X
02141 ! M =      INDEX FOR IU AND IL
02142 ! I,J =    LOWER AND UPPER INDICES OF A PORTION OF X
02143 ! K,L =    INDICES IN THE RANGE I,...,J
02144 ! IJ =     RANDOMLY CHOSEN INDEX BETWEEN I AND J
02145 ! IT,ITT = TEMPORARY STORAGE FOR INTERCHANGES IN IND
02146 ! INDX =   TEMPORARY INDEX FOR X
02147 ! R =      PSEUDO RANDOM NUMBER FOR GENERATING IJ
02148 ! T =      CENTRAL ELEMENT OF X
02149 
02150       IF (n <= 0) RETURN
02151 
02152 ! INITIALIZE IND, M, I, J, AND R
02153 
02154       DO  i = 1, n
02155         ind(i) = i
02156       END DO
02157       m = 1
02158       i = 1
02159       j = n
02160       r = .375
02161 
02162 ! TOP OF LOOP
02163 
02164       20 IF (i >= j) GO TO 70
02165       IF (r <= .5898437) THEN
02166         r = r + .0390625
02167       ELSE
02168         r = r - .21875
02169       END IF
02170 
02171 ! INITIALIZE K
02172 
02173       30 k = i
02174 
02175 ! SELECT A CENTRAL ELEMENT OF X AND SAVE IT IN T
02176 
02177       ij = i + r*(j-i)
02178       it = ind(ij)
02179       t = x(it)
02180 
02181 ! IF THE FIRST ELEMENT OF THE ARRAY IS GREATER THAN T,
02182 !   INTERCHANGE IT WITH T
02183 
02184       indx = ind(i)
02185       IF (x(indx) > t) THEN
02186         ind(ij) = indx
02187         ind(i) = it
02188         it = indx
02189         t = x(it)
02190       END IF
02191 
02192 ! INITIALIZE L
02193 
02194       l = j
02195 
02196 ! IF THE LAST ELEMENT OF THE ARRAY IS LESS THAN T,
02197 !   INTERCHANGE IT WITH T
02198 
02199       indx = ind(j)
02200       IF (x(indx) >= t) GO TO 50
02201       ind(ij) = indx
02202       ind(j) = it
02203       it = indx
02204       t = x(it)
02205 
02206 ! IF THE FIRST ELEMENT OF THE ARRAY IS GREATER THAN T,
02207 !   INTERCHANGE IT WITH T
02208 
02209       indx = ind(i)
02210       IF (x(indx) <= t) GO TO 50
02211       ind(ij) = indx
02212       ind(i) = it
02213       it = indx
02214       t = x(it)
02215       GO TO 50
02216 
02217 ! INTERCHANGE ELEMENTS K AND L
02218 
02219       40 itt = ind(l)
02220       ind(l) = ind(k)
02221       ind(k) = itt
02222 
02223 ! FIND AN ELEMENT IN THE UPPER PART OF THE ARRAY WHICH IS
02224 !   NOT LARGER THAN T
02225 
02226       50 l = l - 1
02227       indx = ind(l)
02228       IF (x(indx) > t) GO TO 50
02229 
02230 ! FIND AN ELEMENT IN THE LOWER PART OF THE ARRAY WHCIH IS NOT SMALLER THAN T
02231 
02232       60 k = k + 1
02233       indx = ind(k)
02234       IF (x(indx) < t) GO TO 60
02235 
02236 ! IF K <= L, INTERCHANGE ELEMENTS K AND L
02237 
02238       IF (k <= l) GO TO 40
02239 
02240 ! SAVE THE UPPER AND LOWER SUBSCRIPTS OF THE PORTION OF THE
02241 !   ARRAY YET TO BE SORTED
02242 
02243       IF (l-i > j-k) THEN
02244         il(m) = i
02245         iu(m) = l
02246         i = k
02247         m = m + 1
02248         GO TO 80
02249       END IF
02250 
02251       il(m) = k
02252       iu(m) = j
02253       j = l
02254       m = m + 1
02255       GO TO 80
02256 
02257 ! BEGIN AGAIN ON ANOTHER UNSORTED PORTION OF THE ARRAY
02258 
02259       70 m = m - 1
02260       IF (m == 0) RETURN
02261       i = il(m)
02262       j = iu(m)
02263 
02264       80 IF (j-i >= 11) GO TO 30
02265       IF (i == 1) GO TO 20
02266       i = i - 1
02267 
02268 ! SORT ELEMENTS I+1,...,J.  NOTE THAT 1 <= I < J AND J-I < 11.
02269 
02270       90 i = i + 1
02271       IF (i == j) GO TO 70
02272       indx = ind(i+1)
02273       t = x(indx)
02274       it = indx
02275       indx = ind(i)
02276       IF (x(indx) <= t) GO TO 90
02277       k = i
02278 
02279       100 ind(k+1) = ind(k)
02280       k = k - 1
02281       indx = ind(k)
02282       IF (t < x(indx)) GO TO 100
02283 
02284       ind(k+1) = it
02285       GO TO 90
02286       end subroutine qsortd
02287 
02288 !=============================================================================80
02289 
02290       subroutine qzhes(nm,n,a,b,matz,z) 
02291 !                                                                       
02292 !     integer, parameter               :: dp = 8    ! double precision
02293       integer i,j,k,l,n,lb,l1,nm,nk1,nm1,nm2 
02294       real(wp) a(nm,n),b(nm,n),z(nm,n) 
02295       real(wp) r,s,t,u1,u2,v1,v2,rho 
02296       logical matz 
02297 !                                                                       
02298 !     this subroutine is the first step of the qz algorithm             
02299 !     for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems,               
02300 !     siam j. numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by moler and stewart.      
02301 !                                                                       
02302 !     this subroutine accepts a pair of real general matrices and       
02303 !     reduces one of them to upper hessenberg form and the other        
02304 !     to upper triangular form using orthogonal transformations.        
02305 !     it is usually followed by  qzit,  qzval  and, possibly,  qzvec.   
02306 !                                                                       
02307 !     on input                                                          
02308 !                                                                       
02309 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
02310 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
02311 !          dimension statement.                                         
02312 !                                                                       
02313 !        n is the order of the matrices.                                
02314 !                                                                       
02315 !        a contains a real general matrix.                              
02316 !                                                                       
02317 !        b contains a real general matrix.                              
02318 !                                                                       
02319 !        matz should be set to .true. if the right hand transformations 
02320 !          are to be accumulated for later use in computing             
02321 !          eigenvectors, and to .false. otherwise.                      
02322 !                                                                       
02323 !     on output                                                         
02324 !                                                                       
02325 !        a has been reduced to upper hessenberg form.  the elements     
02326 !          below the first subdiagonal have been set to zero.           
02327 !                                                                       
02328 !        b has been reduced to upper triangular form.  the elements     
02329 !          below the main diagonal have been set to zero.               
02330 !                                                                       
02331 !        z contains the product of the right hand transformations if    
02332 !          matz has been set to .true.  otherwise, z is not referenced. 
02333 !                                                                       
02334 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
02335 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
02336 !                                                                       
02337 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
02338 !                                                                       
02339 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
02340 !                                                                       
02341 !     .......... initialize z ..........                                
02342       if (.not. matz) go to 10 
02343 !                                                                       
02344       do 3 j = 1, n 
02345 !                                                                       
02346          do 2 i = 1, n 
02347             z(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
02348     2    continue 
02349 !                                                                       
02350          z(j,j) = 1.0_wp 
02351     3 continue 
02352 !     .......... reduce b to upper triangular form ..........           
02353    10 if (n  <=  1) go to 170 
02354       nm1 = n - 1 
02355 !                                                                       
02356       do 100 l = 1, nm1 
02357          l1 = l + 1 
02358          s = 0.0_wp 
02359 !                                                                       
02360          do 20 i = l1, n 
02361             s = s + abs(b(i,l)) 
02362    20    continue 
02363 !                                                                       
02364          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 100 
02365          s = s + abs(b(l,l)) 
02366          r = 0.0_wp 
02367 !                                                                       
02368          do 25 i = l, n 
02369             b(i,l) = b(i,l) / s 
02370             r = r + b(i,l)**2 
02371    25    continue 
02372 !                                                                       
02373          r = sign(sqrt(r),b(l,l)) 
02374          b(l,l) = b(l,l) + r 
02375          rho = r * b(l,l) 
02376 !                                                                       
02377          do 50 j = l1, n 
02378             t = 0.0_wp 
02379 !                                                                       
02380             do 30 i = l, n 
02381                t = t + b(i,l) * b(i,j) 
02382    30       continue 
02383 !                                                                       
02384             t = -t / rho 
02385 !                                                                       
02386             do 40 i = l, n 
02387                b(i,j) = b(i,j) + t * b(i,l) 
02388    40       continue 
02389 !                                                                       
02390    50    continue 
02391 !                                                                       
02392          do 80 j = 1, n 
02393             t = 0.0_wp 
02394 !                                                                       
02395             do 60 i = l, n 
02396                t = t + b(i,l) * a(i,j) 
02397    60       continue 
02398 !                                                                       
02399             t = -t / rho 
02400 !                                                                       
02401             do 70 i = l, n 
02402                a(i,j) = a(i,j) + t * b(i,l) 
02403    70       continue 
02404 !                                                                       
02405    80    continue 
02406 !                                                                       
02407          b(l,l) = -s * r 
02408 !                                                                       
02409          do 90 i = l1, n 
02410             b(i,l) = 0.0_wp 
02411    90    continue 
02412 !                                                                       
02413   100 continue 
02414 !     .......... reduce a to upper hessenberg form, while               
02415 !                keeping b triangular ..........                        
02416       if (n  ==  2) go to 170 
02417       nm2 = n - 2 
02418 !                                                                       
02419       do 160 k = 1, nm2 
02420          nk1 = nm1 - k 
02421 !     .......... for l=n-1 step -1 until k+1 do -- ..........           
02422          do 150 lb = 1, nk1 
02423             l = n - lb 
02424             l1 = l + 1 
02425 !     .......... zero a(l+1,k) ..........                               
02426             s = abs(a(l,k)) + abs(a(l1,k)) 
02427             if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 150 
02428             u1 = a(l,k) / s 
02429             u2 = a(l1,k) / s 
02430             r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2),u1) 
02431             v1 =  -(u1 + r) / r 
02432             v2 = -u2 / r 
02433             u2 = v2 / v1 
02434 !                                                                       
02435             do 110 j = k, n 
02436                t = a(l,j) + u2 * a(l1,j) 
02437                a(l,j) = a(l,j) + t * v1 
02438                a(l1,j) = a(l1,j) + t * v2 
02439   110       continue 
02440 !                                                                       
02441             a(l1,k) = 0.0_wp 
02442 !                                                                       
02443             do 120 j = l, n 
02444                t = b(l,j) + u2 * b(l1,j) 
02445                b(l,j) = b(l,j) + t * v1 
02446                b(l1,j) = b(l1,j) + t * v2 
02447   120       continue 
02448 !     .......... zero b(l+1,l) ..........                               
02449             s = abs(b(l1,l1)) + abs(b(l1,l)) 
02450             if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 150 
02451             u1 = b(l1,l1) / s 
02452             u2 = b(l1,l) / s 
02453             r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2),u1) 
02454             v1 =  -(u1 + r) / r 
02455             v2 = -u2 / r 
02456             u2 = v2 / v1 
02457 !                                                                       
02458             do 130 i = 1, l1 
02459                t = b(i,l1) + u2 * b(i,l) 
02460                b(i,l1) = b(i,l1) + t * v1 
02461                b(i,l) = b(i,l) + t * v2 
02462   130       continue 
02463 !                                                                       
02464             b(l1,l) = 0.0_wp 
02465 !                                                                       
02466             do 140 i = 1, n 
02467                t = a(i,l1) + u2 * a(i,l) 
02468                a(i,l1) = a(i,l1) + t * v1 
02469                a(i,l) = a(i,l) + t * v2 
02470   140       continue 
02471 !                                                                       
02472             if (.not. matz) go to 150 
02473 !                                                                       
02474             do 145 i = 1, n 
02475                t = z(i,l1) + u2 * z(i,l) 
02476                z(i,l1) = z(i,l1) + t * v1 
02477                z(i,l) = z(i,l) + t * v2 
02478   145       continue 
02479 !                                                                       
02480   150    continue 
02481 !                                                                       
02482   160 continue 
02483 !                                                                       
02484   170 return 
02485       end subroutine qzhes
02486 
02487 !=============================================================================80
02488 
02489       subroutine qzit(nm,n,a,b,eps1,matz,z,ierr) 
02490 !                                                                       
02491 !     integer, parameter               :: dp = 8    ! double precision
02492       integer i,j,k,l,n,en,k1,k2,ld,ll,l1,na,nm,ish,itn,its,km1,lm1,    
02493              enm2,ierr,lor1,enorn                                      
02494       real(wp) a(nm,n),b(nm,n),z(nm,n) 
02495       real(wp) r,s,t,a1,a2,a3,ep,sh,u1,u2,u3,v1,v2,v3,ani,a11,  
02496             a12,a21,a22,a33,a34,a43,a44,bni,b11,b12,b22,b33,b34,       &
02497             b44,epsa,epsb,eps1,anorm,bnorm
02498       logical matz,notlas 
02499 !                                                                       
02500 !     this subroutine is the second step of the qz algorithm            
02501 !     for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems,               
02502 !     siam j. numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by moler and stewart,      
02503 !     as modified in technical note nasa tn d-7305(1973) by ward.       
02504 !                                                                       
02505 !     this subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them      
02506 !     in upper hessenberg form and the other in upper triangular form.  
02507 !     it reduces the hessenberg matrix to quasi-triangular form using   
02508 !     orthogonal transformations while maintaining the triangular form  
02509 !     of the other matrix.  it is usually preceded by  qzhes  and       
02510 !     followed by  qzval  and, possibly,  qzvec.                        
02511 !                                                                       
02512 !     on input                                                          
02513 !                                                                       
02514 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
02515 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
02516 !          dimension statement.                                         
02517 !                                                                       
02518 !        n is the order of the matrices.                                
02519 !                                                                       
02520 !        a contains a real upper hessenberg matrix.                     
02521 !                                                                       
02522 !        b contains a real upper triangular matrix.                     
02523 !                                                                       
02524 !        eps1 is a tolerance used to determine negligible elements.     
02525 !          eps1 = 0.0 (or negative) may be input, in which case an      
02526 !          element will be neglected only if it is less than roundoff   
02527 !          error times the norm of its matrix.  if the input eps1 is    
02528 !          positive, then an element will be considered negligible      
02529 !          if it is less than eps1 times the norm of its matrix.  a     
02530 !          positive value of eps1 may result in faster execution,       
02531 !          but less accurate results.                                   
02532 !                                                                       
02533 !        matz should be set to .true. if the right hand transformations 
02534 !          are to be accumulated for later use in computing             
02535 !          eigenvectors, and to .false. otherwise.                      
02536 !                                                                       
02537 !        z contains, if matz has been set to .true., the                
02538 !          transformation matrix produced in the reduction              
02539 !          by  qzhes, if performed, or else the identity matrix.        
02540 !          if matz has been set to .false., z is not referenced.        
02541 !                                                                       
02542 !     on output                                                         
02543 !                                                                       
02544 !        a has been reduced to quasi-triangular form.  the elements     
02545 !          below the first subdiagonal are still zero and no two        
02546 !          consecutive subdiagonal elements are nonzero.                
02547 !                                                                       
02548 !        b is still in upper triangular form, although its elements     
02549 !          have been altered.  the location b(n,1) is used to store     
02550 !          eps1 times the norm of b for later use by  qzval  and  qzvec.
02551 !                                                                       
02552 !        z contains the product of the right hand transformations       
02553 !          (for both steps) if matz has been set to .true..             
02554 !                                                                       
02555 !        ierr is set to                                                 
02556 !          zero       for normal return,                                
02557 !          j          if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted      
02558 !                     while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.        
02559 !                                                                       
02560 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
02561 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
02562 !                                                                       
02563 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
02564 !                                                                       
02565 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
02566 !                                                                       
02567       ierr = 0 
02568 !     .......... compute epsa,epsb ..........                           
02569       anorm = 0.0_wp 
02570       bnorm = 0.0_wp 
02571 !                                                                       
02572       do 30 i = 1, n 
02573          ani = 0.0_wp 
02574          if (i  /=  1) ani = abs(a(i,i-1)) 
02575          bni = 0.0_wp 
02576 !                                                                       
02577          do 20 j = i, n 
02578             ani = ani + abs(a(i,j)) 
02579             bni = bni + abs(b(i,j)) 
02580    20    continue 
02581 !                                                                       
02582          if (ani  >  anorm) anorm = ani 
02583          if (bni  >  bnorm) bnorm = bni 
02584    30 continue 
02585 !                                                                       
02586       if (anorm  ==  0.0_wp) anorm = 1.0_wp 
02587       if (bnorm  ==  0.0_wp) bnorm = 1.0_wp 
02588       ep = eps1 
02589       if (ep  >  0.0_wp) go to 50 
02590 !     .......... use roundoff level if eps1 is zero ..........          
02591       ep = epslon(1.0_wp) 
02592    50 epsa = ep * anorm 
02593       epsb = ep * bnorm 
02594 !     .......... reduce a to quasi-triangular form, while               
02595 !                keeping b triangular ..........                        
02596       lor1 = 1 
02597       enorn = n 
02598       en = n 
02599 !     itn = 30*n   original iteration count
02600       itn = 50*n 
02601 !     .......... begin qz step ..........                               
02602    60 if (en  <=  2) go to 1001 
02603       if (.not. matz) enorn = en 
02604       its = 0 
02605       na = en - 1 
02606       enm2 = na - 1 
02607    70 ish = 2 
02608 !     .......... check for convergence or reducibility.                 
02609 !                for l=en step -1 until 1 do -- ..........              
02610       do 80 ll = 1, en 
02611          lm1 = en - ll 
02612          l = lm1 + 1 
02613          if (l  ==  1) go to 95 
02614          if (abs(a(l,lm1))  <=  epsa) go to 90 
02615    80 continue 
02616 !                                                                       
02617    90 a(l,lm1) = 0.0_wp 
02618       if (l  <  na) go to 95 
02619 !     .......... 1-by-1 or 2-by-2 block isolated ..........             
02620       en = lm1 
02621       go to 60 
02622 !     .......... check for small top of b ..........                    
02623    95 ld = l 
02624   100 l1 = l + 1 
02625       b11 = b(l,l) 
02626       if (abs(b11)  >  epsb) go to 120 
02627       b(l,l) = 0.0_wp 
02628       s = abs(a(l,l)) + abs(a(l1,l)) 
02629       u1 = a(l,l) / s 
02630       u2 = a(l1,l) / s 
02631       r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2),u1) 
02632       v1 = -(u1 + r) / r 
02633       v2 = -u2 / r 
02634       u2 = v2 / v1 
02635 !                                                                       
02636       do 110 j = l, enorn 
02637          t = a(l,j) + u2 * a(l1,j) 
02638          a(l,j) = a(l,j) + t * v1 
02639          a(l1,j) = a(l1,j) + t * v2 
02640          t = b(l,j) + u2 * b(l1,j) 
02641          b(l,j) = b(l,j) + t * v1 
02642          b(l1,j) = b(l1,j) + t * v2 
02643   110 continue 
02644 !                                                                       
02645       if (l  /=  1) a(l,lm1) = -a(l,lm1) 
02646       lm1 = l 
02647       l = l1 
02648       go to 90 
02649   120 a11 = a(l,l) / b11 
02650       a21 = a(l1,l) / b11 
02651       if (ish  ==  1) go to 140 
02652 !     .......... iteration strategy ..........                          
02653       if (itn  ==  0) go to 1000 
02654       if (its  ==  10) go to 155 
02655 !     .......... determine type of shift ..........                     
02656       b22 = b(l1,l1) 
02657       if (abs(b22)  <  epsb) b22 = epsb 
02658       b33 = b(na,na) 
02659       if (abs(b33)  <  epsb) b33 = epsb 
02660       b44 = b(en,en) 
02661       if (abs(b44)  <  epsb) b44 = epsb 
02662       a33 = a(na,na) / b33 
02663       a34 = a(na,en) / b44 
02664       a43 = a(en,na) / b33 
02665       a44 = a(en,en) / b44 
02666       b34 = b(na,en) / b44 
02667       t = 0.5_wp * (a43 * b34 - a33 - a44) 
02668       r = t * t + a34 * a43 - a33 * a44 
02669       if (r  <  0.0_wp) go to 150 
02670 !     .......... determine single shift zeroth column of a ..........   
02671       ish = 1 
02672       r = sqrt(r) 
02673       sh = -t + r 
02674       s = -t - r 
02675       if (abs(s-a44)  <  abs(sh-a44)) sh = s 
02676 !     .......... look for two consecutive small                         
02677 !                sub-diagonal elements of a.                            
02678 !                for l=en-2 step -1 until ld do -- ..........           
02679       do 130 ll = ld, enm2 
02680          l = enm2 + ld - ll 
02681          if (l  ==  ld) go to 140 
02682          lm1 = l - 1 
02683          l1 = l + 1 
02684          t = a(l,l) 
02685          if (abs(b(l,l))  >  epsb) t = t - sh * b(l,l) 
02686          if (abs(a(l,lm1))  <=  abs(t/a(l1,l)) * epsa) go to 100 
02687   130 continue 
02688 !                                                                       
02689   140 a1 = a11 - sh 
02690       a2 = a21 
02691       if (l  /=  ld) a(l,lm1) = -a(l,lm1) 
02692       go to 160 
02693 !     .......... determine double shift zeroth column of a ..........   
02694   150 a12 = a(l,l1) / b22 
02695       a22 = a(l1,l1) / b22 
02696       b12 = b(l,l1) / b22 
02697       a1 = ((a33 - a11) * (a44 - a11) - a34 * a43 + a43 * b34 * a11)    &
02698      &     / a21 + a12 - a11 * b12                                      
02699       a2 = (a22 - a11) - a21 * b12 - (a33 - a11) - (a44 - a11)          &
02700      &     + a43 * b34                                                  
02701       a3 = a(l1+1,l1) / b22 
02702       go to 160 
02703 !     .......... ad hoc shift ..........                                
02704   155 a1 = 0.0_wp 
02705       a2 = 1.0_wp 
02706       a3 = 1.1605_wp 
02707   160 its = its + 1 
02708       itn = itn - 1 
02709       if (.not. matz) lor1 = ld 
02710 !     .......... main loop ..........                                   
02711       do 260 k = l, na 
02712          notlas = k  /=  na .and. ish  ==  2 
02713          k1 = k + 1 
02714          k2 = k + 2 
02715          km1 = max0(k-1,l) 
02716          ll = min0(en,k1+ish) 
02717          if (notlas) go to 190 
02718 !     .......... zero a(k+1,k-1) ..........                             
02719          if (k  ==  l) go to 170 
02720          a1 = a(k,km1) 
02721          a2 = a(k1,km1) 
02722   170    s = abs(a1) + abs(a2) 
02723          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 70 
02724          u1 = a1 / s 
02725          u2 = a2 / s 
02726          r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2),u1) 
02727          v1 = -(u1 + r) / r 
02728          v2 = -u2 / r 
02729          u2 = v2 / v1 
02730 !                                                                       
02731          do 180 j = km1, enorn 
02732             t = a(k,j) + u2 * a(k1,j) 
02733             a(k,j) = a(k,j) + t * v1 
02734             a(k1,j) = a(k1,j) + t * v2 
02735             t = b(k,j) + u2 * b(k1,j) 
02736             b(k,j) = b(k,j) + t * v1 
02737             b(k1,j) = b(k1,j) + t * v2 
02738   180    continue 
02739 !                                                                       
02740          if (k  /=  l) a(k1,km1) = 0.0_wp 
02741          go to 240 
02742 !     .......... zero a(k+1,k-1) and a(k+2,k-1) ..........              
02743   190    if (k  ==  l) go to 200 
02744          a1 = a(k,km1) 
02745          a2 = a(k1,km1) 
02746          a3 = a(k2,km1) 
02747   200    s = abs(a1) + abs(a2) + abs(a3) 
02748          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 260 
02749          u1 = a1 / s 
02750          u2 = a2 / s 
02751          u3 = a3 / s 
02752          r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2+u3*u3),u1) 
02753          v1 = -(u1 + r) / r 
02754          v2 = -u2 / r 
02755          v3 = -u3 / r 
02756          u2 = v2 / v1 
02757          u3 = v3 / v1 
02758 !                                                                       
02759          do 210 j = km1, enorn 
02760             t = a(k,j) + u2 * a(k1,j) + u3 * a(k2,j) 
02761             a(k,j) = a(k,j) + t * v1 
02762             a(k1,j) = a(k1,j) + t * v2 
02763             a(k2,j) = a(k2,j) + t * v3 
02764             t = b(k,j) + u2 * b(k1,j) + u3 * b(k2,j) 
02765             b(k,j) = b(k,j) + t * v1 
02766             b(k1,j) = b(k1,j) + t * v2 
02767             b(k2,j) = b(k2,j) + t * v3 
02768   210    continue 
02769 !                                                                       
02770          if (k  ==  l) go to 220 
02771          a(k1,km1) = 0.0_wp 
02772          a(k2,km1) = 0.0_wp 
02773 !     .......... zero b(k+2,k+1) and b(k+2,k) ..........                
02774   220    s = abs(b(k2,k2)) + abs(b(k2,k1)) + abs(b(k2,k)) 
02775          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 240 
02776          u1 = b(k2,k2) / s 
02777          u2 = b(k2,k1) / s 
02778          u3 = b(k2,k) / s 
02779          r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2+u3*u3),u1) 
02780          v1 = -(u1 + r) / r 
02781          v2 = -u2 / r 
02782          v3 = -u3 / r 
02783          u2 = v2 / v1 
02784          u3 = v3 / v1 
02785 !                                                                       
02786          do 230 i = lor1, ll 
02787             t = a(i,k2) + u2 * a(i,k1) + u3 * a(i,k) 
02788             a(i,k2) = a(i,k2) + t * v1 
02789             a(i,k1) = a(i,k1) + t * v2 
02790             a(i,k) = a(i,k) + t * v3 
02791             t = b(i,k2) + u2 * b(i,k1) + u3 * b(i,k) 
02792             b(i,k2) = b(i,k2) + t * v1 
02793             b(i,k1) = b(i,k1) + t * v2 
02794             b(i,k) = b(i,k) + t * v3 
02795   230    continue 
02796 !                                                                       
02797          b(k2,k) = 0.0_wp 
02798          b(k2,k1) = 0.0_wp 
02799          if (.not. matz) go to 240 
02800 !                                                                       
02801          do 235 i = 1, n 
02802             t = z(i,k2) + u2 * z(i,k1) + u3 * z(i,k) 
02803             z(i,k2) = z(i,k2) + t * v1 
02804             z(i,k1) = z(i,k1) + t * v2 
02805             z(i,k) = z(i,k) + t * v3 
02806   235    continue 
02807 !     .......... zero b(k+1,k) ..........                               
02808   240    s = abs(b(k1,k1)) + abs(b(k1,k)) 
02809          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 260 
02810          u1 = b(k1,k1) / s 
02811          u2 = b(k1,k) / s 
02812          r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2),u1) 
02813          v1 = -(u1 + r) / r 
02814          v2 = -u2 / r 
02815          u2 = v2 / v1 
02816 !                                                                       
02817          do 250 i = lor1, ll 
02818             t = a(i,k1) + u2 * a(i,k) 
02819             a(i,k1) = a(i,k1) + t * v1 
02820             a(i,k) = a(i,k) + t * v2 
02821             t = b(i,k1) + u2 * b(i,k) 
02822             b(i,k1) = b(i,k1) + t * v1 
02823             b(i,k) = b(i,k) + t * v2 
02824   250    continue 
02825 !                                                                       
02826          b(k1,k) = 0.0_wp 
02827          if (.not. matz) go to 260 
02828 !                                                                       
02829          do 255 i = 1, n 
02830             t = z(i,k1) + u2 * z(i,k) 
02831             z(i,k1) = z(i,k1) + t * v1 
02832             z(i,k) = z(i,k) + t * v2 
02833   255    continue 
02834 !                                                                       
02835   260 continue 
02836 !     .......... end qz step ..........                                 
02837       go to 70 
02838 !     .......... set error -- all eigenvalues have not                  
02839 !                converged after 30*n iterations ..........             
02840  1000 ierr = en 
02841 !     .......... save epsb for use by qzval and qzvec ..........        
02842  1001 if (n  >  1) b(n,1) = epsb 
02843       if(epsb >= 1.0e-10_wp)                                                &
02844         write(*,*)'Watch the eigenvalues:  Error = ',epsb
02845       return 
02846       end subroutine qzit
02847 
02848 !=============================================================================80
02849 
02850       subroutine qzval(nm,n,a,b,alfr,alfi,beta,matz,z) 
02851 !                                                                       
02852       integer i,j,n,en,na,nm,nn,isw 
02853       real(wp) a(nm,n),b(nm,n),alfr(n),alfi(n),beta(n),z(nm,n) 
02854       real(wp) c,d,e,r,s,t,an,a1,a2,bn,cq,cz,di,dr,ei,ti,tr,u1, 
02855             u2,v1,v2,a1i,a11,a12,a2i,a21,a22,b11,b12,b22,sqi,sqr,      &
02856             ssi,ssr,szi,szr,a11i,a11r,a12i,a12r,a22i,a22r,epsb         
02857       logical matz 
02858 !                                                                       
02859 !     this subroutine is the third step of the qz algorithm             
02860 !     for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems,               
02861 !     siam j. numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by moler and stewart.      
02862 !                                                                       
02863 !     this subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them      
02864 !     in quasi-triangular form and the other in upper triangular form.  
02865 !     it reduces the quasi-triangular matrix further, so that any       
02866 !     remaining 2-by-2 blocks correspond to pairs of complex            
02867 !     eigenvalues, and returns quantities whose ratios give the         
02868 !     generalized eigenvalues.  it is usually preceded by  qzhes        
02869 !     and  qzit  and may be followed by  qzvec.                         
02870 !                                                                       
02871 !     on input                                                          
02872 !                                                                       
02873 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
02874 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
02875 !          dimension statement.                                         
02876 !                                                                       
02877 !        n is the order of the matrices.                                
02878 !                                                                       
02879 !        a contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.               
02880 !                                                                       
02881 !        b contains a real upper triangular matrix.  in addition,       
02882 !          location b(n,1) contains the tolerance quantity (epsb)       
02883 !          computed and saved in  qzit.                                 
02884 !                                                                       
02885 !        matz should be set to .true. if the right hand transformations 
02886 !          are to be accumulated for later use in computing             
02887 !          eigenvectors, and to .false. otherwise.                      
02888 !                                                                       
02889 !        z contains, if matz has been set to .true., the                
02890 !          transformation matrix produced in the reductions by qzhes    
02891 !          and qzit, if performed, or else the identity matrix.         
02892 !          if matz has been set to .false., z is not referenced.        
02893 !                                                                       
02894 !     on output                                                         
02895 !                                                                       
02896 !        a has been reduced further to a quasi-triangular matrix        
02897 !          in which all nonzero subdiagonal elements correspond to      
02898 !          pairs of complex eigenvalues.                                
02899 !                                                                       
02900 !        b is still in upper triangular form, although its elements     
02901 !          have been altered.  b(n,1) is unaltered.                     
02902 !                                                                       
02903 !        alfr and alfi contain the real and imaginary parts of the      
02904 !          diagonal elements of the triangular matrix that would be     
02905 !          obtained if a were reduced completely to triangular form     
02906 !          by unitary transformations.  non-zero values of alfi occur   
02907 !          in pairs, the first member positive and the second negative. 
02908 !                                                                       
02909 !        beta contains the diagonal elements of the corresponding b,    
02910 !          normalized to be real and non-negative.  the generalized     
02911 !          eigenvalues are then the ratios ((alfr+i*alfi)/beta).        
02912 !                                                                       
02913 !        z contains the product of the right hand transformations       
02914 !          (for all three steps) if matz has been set to .true.         
02915 !                                                                       
02916 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
02917 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
02918 !                                                                       
02919 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
02920 !                                                                       
02921 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
02922 !                                                                       
02923       epsb = b(n,1) 
02924       isw = 1 
02925 !     .......... find eigenvalues of quasi-triangular matrices.         
02926 !                for en=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........              
02927       do 510 nn = 1, n 
02928          en = n + 1 - nn 
02929          na = en - 1 
02930          if (isw  ==  2) go to 505 
02931          if (en  ==  1) go to 410 
02932          if (a(en,na)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 420 
02933 !     .......... 1-by-1 block, one real root ..........                 
02934   410    alfr(en) = a(en,en) 
02935          if (b(en,en)  <  0.0_wp) alfr(en) = -alfr(en) 
02936          beta(en) = abs(b(en,en)) 
02937          alfi(en) = 0.0_wp 
02938          go to 510 
02939 !     .......... 2-by-2 block ..........                                
02940   420    if (abs(b(na,na))  <=  epsb) go to 455 
02941          if (abs(b(en,en))  >  epsb) go to 430 
02942          a1 = a(en,en) 
02943          a2 = a(en,na) 
02944          bn = 0.0_wp 
02945          go to 435 
02946   430    an = abs(a(na,na)) + abs(a(na,en)) + abs(a(en,na))          &
02947      &      + abs(a(en,en))                                            
02948          bn = abs(b(na,na)) + abs(b(na,en)) + abs(b(en,en)) 
02949          a11 = a(na,na) / an 
02950          a12 = a(na,en) / an 
02951          a21 = a(en,na) / an 
02952          a22 = a(en,en) / an 
02953          b11 = b(na,na) / bn 
02954          b12 = b(na,en) / bn 
02955          b22 = b(en,en) / bn 
02956          e = a11 / b11 
02957          ei = a22 / b22 
02958          s = a21 / (b11 * b22) 
02959          t = (a22 - e * b22) / b22 
02960          if (abs(e)  <=  abs(ei)) go to 431 
02961          e = ei 
02962          t = (a11 - e * b11) / b11 
02963   431    c = 0.5_wp * (t - s * b12) 
02964          d = c * c + s * (a12 - e * b12) 
02965          if (d  <  0.0_wp) go to 480 
02966 !     .......... two real roots.                                        
02967 !                zero both a(en,na) and b(en,na) ..........             
02968          e = e + (c + sign(sqrt(d),c)) 
02969          a11 = a11 - e * b11 
02970          a12 = a12 - e * b12 
02971          a22 = a22 - e * b22 
02972          if (abs(a11) + abs(a12)  <                                  &
02973      &       abs(a21) + abs(a22)) go to 432                           
02974          a1 = a12 
02975          a2 = a11 
02976          go to 435 
02977   432    a1 = a22 
02978          a2 = a21 
02979 !     .......... choose and apply real z ..........                     
02980   435    s = abs(a1) + abs(a2) 
02981          u1 = a1 / s 
02982          u2 = a2 / s 
02983          r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2),u1) 
02984          v1 = -(u1 + r) / r 
02985          v2 = -u2 / r 
02986          u2 = v2 / v1 
02987 !                                                                       
02988          do 440 i = 1, en 
02989             t = a(i,en) + u2 * a(i,na) 
02990             a(i,en) = a(i,en) + t * v1 
02991             a(i,na) = a(i,na) + t * v2 
02992             t = b(i,en) + u2 * b(i,na) 
02993             b(i,en) = b(i,en) + t * v1 
02994             b(i,na) = b(i,na) + t * v2 
02995   440    continue 
02996 !                                                                       
02997          if (.not. matz) go to 450 
02998 !                                                                       
02999          do 445 i = 1, n 
03000             t = z(i,en) + u2 * z(i,na) 
03001             z(i,en) = z(i,en) + t * v1 
03002             z(i,na) = z(i,na) + t * v2 
03003   445    continue 
03004 !                                                                       
03005   450    if (bn  ==  0.0_wp) go to 475 
03006          if (an  <  abs(e) * bn) go to 455 
03007          a1 = b(na,na) 
03008          a2 = b(en,na) 
03009          go to 460 
03010   455    a1 = a(na,na) 
03011          a2 = a(en,na) 
03012 !     .......... choose and apply real q ..........                     
03013   460    s = abs(a1) + abs(a2) 
03014          if (s  ==  0.0_wp) go to 475 
03015          u1 = a1 / s 
03016          u2 = a2 / s 
03017          r = sign(sqrt(u1*u1+u2*u2),u1) 
03018          v1 = -(u1 + r) / r 
03019          v2 = -u2 / r 
03020          u2 = v2 / v1 
03021 !                                                                       
03022          do 470 j = na, n 
03023             t = a(na,j) + u2 * a(en,j) 
03024             a(na,j) = a(na,j) + t * v1 
03025             a(en,j) = a(en,j) + t * v2 
03026             t = b(na,j) + u2 * b(en,j) 
03027             b(na,j) = b(na,j) + t * v1 
03028             b(en,j) = b(en,j) + t * v2 
03029   470    continue 
03030 !                                                                       
03031   475    a(en,na) = 0.0_wp 
03032          b(en,na) = 0.0_wp 
03033          alfr(na) = a(na,na) 
03034          alfr(en) = a(en,en) 
03035          if (b(na,na)  <  0.0_wp) alfr(na) = -alfr(na) 
03036          if (b(en,en)  <  0.0_wp) alfr(en) = -alfr(en) 
03037          beta(na) = abs(b(na,na)) 
03038          beta(en) = abs(b(en,en)) 
03039          alfi(en) = 0.0_wp 
03040          alfi(na) = 0.0_wp 
03041          go to 505 
03042 !     .......... two complex roots ..........                           
03043   480    e = e + c 
03044          ei = sqrt(-d) 
03045          a11r = a11 - e * b11 
03046          a11i = ei * b11 
03047          a12r = a12 - e * b12 
03048          a12i = ei * b12 
03049          a22r = a22 - e * b22 
03050          a22i = ei * b22 
03051          if (abs(a11r) + abs(a11i) + abs(a12r) + abs(a12i)  <      &
03052      &       abs(a21) + abs(a22r) + abs(a22i)) go to 482             
03053          a1 = a12r 
03054          a1i = a12i 
03055          a2 = -a11r 
03056          a2i = -a11i 
03057          go to 485 
03058   482    a1 = a22r 
03059          a1i = a22i 
03060          a2 = -a21 
03061          a2i = 0.0_wp 
03062 !     .......... choose complex z ..........                            
03063   485    cz = sqrt(a1*a1+a1i*a1i) 
03064          if (cz  ==  0.0_wp) go to 487 
03065          szr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cz 
03066          szi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cz 
03067          r = sqrt(cz*cz+szr*szr+szi*szi) 
03068          cz = cz / r 
03069          szr = szr / r 
03070          szi = szi / r 
03071          go to 490 
03072   487    szr = 1.0_wp 
03073          szi = 0.0_wp 
03074   490    if (an  <  (abs(e) + ei) * bn) go to 492 
03075          a1 = cz * b11 + szr * b12 
03076          a1i = szi * b12 
03077          a2 = szr * b22 
03078          a2i = szi * b22 
03079          go to 495 
03080   492    a1 = cz * a11 + szr * a12 
03081          a1i = szi * a12 
03082          a2 = cz * a21 + szr * a22 
03083          a2i = szi * a22 
03084 !     .......... choose complex q ..........                            
03085   495    cq = sqrt(a1*a1+a1i*a1i) 
03086          if (cq  ==  0.0_wp) go to 497 
03087          sqr = (a1 * a2 + a1i * a2i) / cq 
03088          sqi = (a1 * a2i - a1i * a2) / cq 
03089          r = sqrt(cq*cq+sqr*sqr+sqi*sqi) 
03090          cq = cq / r 
03091          sqr = sqr / r 
03092          sqi = sqi / r 
03093          go to 500 
03094   497    sqr = 1.0_wp 
03095          sqi = 0.0_wp 
03096 !     .......... compute diagonal elements that would result            
03097 !                if transformations were applied ..........             
03098   500    ssr = sqr * szr + sqi * szi 
03099          ssi = sqr * szi - sqi * szr 
03100          i = 1 
03101          tr = cq * cz * a11 + cq * szr * a12 + sqr * cz * a21           &
03102      &      + ssr * a22                                                 
03103          ti = cq * szi * a12 - sqi * cz * a21 + ssi * a22 
03104          dr = cq * cz * b11 + cq * szr * b12 + ssr * b22 
03105          di = cq * szi * b12 + ssi * b22 
03106          go to 503 
03107   502    i = 2 
03108          tr = ssr * a11 - sqr * cz * a12 - cq * szr * a21               &
03109      &      + cq * cz * a22                                             
03110          ti = -ssi * a11 - sqi * cz * a12 + cq * szi * a21 
03111          dr = ssr * b11 - sqr * cz * b12 + cq * cz * b22 
03112          di = -ssi * b11 - sqi * cz * b12 
03113   503    t = ti * dr - tr * di 
03114          j = na 
03115          if (t  <  0.0_wp) j = en 
03116          r = sqrt(dr*dr+di*di) 
03117          beta(j) = bn * r 
03118          alfr(j) = an * (tr * dr + ti * di) / r 
03119          alfi(j) = an * t / r 
03120          if (i  ==  1) go to 502 
03121   505    isw = 3 - isw 
03122   510 continue 
03123       b(n,1) = epsb 
03124 !                                                                       
03125       return 
03126       end subroutine qzval
03127 
03128 !=============================================================================80
03129 
03130       subroutine qzvec(nm,n,a,b,alfr,alfi,beta,z) 
03131 !                                                                       
03132       integer i,j,k,m,n,en,ii,jj,na,nm,nn,isw,enm2 
03133       real(wp) a(nm,n),b(nm,n),alfr(n),alfi(n),beta(n),z(nm,n) 
03134       real(wp) d,q,r,s,t,w,x,y,di,dr,ra,rr,sa,ti,tr,t1,t2,w1,x1,
03135             zz,z1,alfm,almi,almr,betm,epsb                             
03136 !                                                                       
03137 !     this subroutine is the optional fourth step of the qz algorithm   
03138 !     for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems,               
03139 !     siam j. numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by moler and stewart.      
03140 !                                                                       
03141 !     this subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in   
03142 !     quasi-triangular form (in which each 2-by-2 block corresponds to  
03143 !     a pair of complex eigenvalues) and the other in upper triangular  
03144 !     form.  it computes the eigenvectors of the triangular problem and 
03145 !     transforms the results back to the original coordinate system.    
03146 !     it is usually preceded by  qzhes,  qzit, and  qzval.              
03147 !                                                                       
03148 !     on input                                                          
03149 !                                                                       
03150 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
03151 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program
