03152 !          dimension statement.                                         
03153 !                                                                       
03154 !        n is the order of the matrices.                                
03155 !                                                                       
03156 !        a contains a real upper quasi-triangular matrix.               
03157 !                                                                       
03158 !        b contains a real upper triangular matrix.  in addition,       
03159 !          location b(n,1) contains the tolerance quantity (epsb)       
03160 !          computed and saved in  qzit.                                 
03161 !                                                                       
03162 !        alfr, alfi, and beta  are vectors with components whose        
03163 !          ratios ((alfr+i*alfi)/beta) are the generalized              
03164 !          eigenvalues.  they are usually obtained from  qzval.         
03165 !                                                                       
03166 !        z contains the transformation matrix produced in the           
03167 !          reductions by  qzhes,  qzit, and  qzval, if performed.       
03168 !          if the eigenvectors of the triangular problem are            
03169 !          desired, z must contain the identity matrix.                 
03170 !                                                                       
03171 !     on output                                                         
03172 !                                                                       
03173 !        a is unaltered.  its subdiagonal elements provide information  
03174 !           about the storage of the complex eigenvectors.              
03175 !                                                                       
03176 !        b has been destroyed.                                          
03177 !                                                                       
03178 !        alfr, alfi, and beta are unaltered.                            
03179 !                                                                       
03180 !        z contains the real and imaginary parts of the eigenvectors.   
03181 !          if alfi(i)  ==  0.0, the i-th eigenvalue is real and         
03182 !            the i-th column of z contains its eigenvector.             
03183 !          if alfi(i)  /=  0.0, the i-th eigenvalue is complex.         
03184 !            if alfi(i)  >  0.0, the eigenvalue is the first of        
03185 !              a complex pair and the i-th and (i+1)-th columns         
03186 !              of z contain its eigenvector.                            
03187 !            if alfi(i)  <  0.0, the eigenvalue is the second of       
03188 !              a complex pair and the (i-1)-th and i-th columns         
03189 !              of z contain the conjugate of its eigenvector.           
03190 !          each eigenvector is normalized so that the modulus           
03191 !          of its largest component is 1.0 .                            
03192 !                                                                       
03193 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03194 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03195 !                                                                       
03196 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03197 !                                                                       
03198 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03199 !                                                                       
03200       epsb = b(n,1) 
03201       isw = 1 
03202 !     .......... for en=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........              
03203       do 800 nn = 1, n 
03204          en = n + 1 - nn 
03205          na = en - 1 
03206          if (isw  ==  2) go to 795 
03207          if (alfi(en)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 710 
03208 !     .......... real vector ..........                                 
03209          m = en 
03210          b(en,en) = 1.0_wp 
03211          if (na  ==  0) go to 800 
03212          alfm = alfr(m) 
03213          betm = beta(m) 
03214 !     .......... for i=en-1 step -1 until 1 do -- ..........            
03215          do 700 ii = 1, na 
03216             i = en - ii 
03217             w = betm * a(i,i) - alfm * b(i,i) 
03218             r = 0.0_wp 
03219 !                                                                       
03220             do 610 j = m, en 
03221   610       r = r + (betm * a(i,j) - alfm * b(i,j)) * b(j,en) 
03222 !                                                                       
03223             if (i  ==  1 .or. isw  ==  2) go to 630 
03224             if (betm * a(i,i-1)  ==  0.0_wp) go to 630 
03225             zz = w 
03226             s = r 
03227             go to 690 
03228   630       m = i 
03229             if (isw  ==  2) go to 640 
03230 !     .......... real 1-by-1 block ..........                           
03231             t = w 
03232             if (w  ==  0.0_wp) t = epsb 
03233             b(i,en) = -r / t 
03234             go to 700 
03235 !     .......... real 2-by-2 block ..........                           
03236   640       x = betm * a(i,i+1) - alfm * b(i,i+1) 
03237             y = betm * a(i+1,i) 
03238             q = w * zz - x * y 
03239             t = (x * s - zz * r) / q 
03240             b(i,en) = t 
03241             if (abs(x)  <=  abs(zz)) go to 650 
03242             b(i+1,en) = (-r - w * t) / x 
03243             go to 690 
03244   650       b(i+1,en) = (-s - y * t) / zz 
03245   690       isw = 3 - isw 
03246   700    continue 
03247 !     .......... end real vector ..........                             
03248          go to 800 
03249 !     .......... complex vector ..........                              
03250   710    m = na 
03251          almr = alfr(m) 
03252          almi = alfi(m) 
03253          betm = beta(m) 
03254 !     .......... last vector component chosen imaginary so that         
03255 !                eigenvector matrix is triangular ..........            
03256          y = betm * a(en,na) 
03257          b(na,na) = -almi * b(en,en) / y 
03258          b(na,en) = (almr * b(en,en) - betm * a(en,en)) / y 
03259          b(en,na) = 0.0_wp 
03260          b(en,en) = 1.0_wp 
03261          enm2 = na - 1 
03262          if (enm2  ==  0) go to 795 
03263 !     .......... for i=en-2 step -1 until 1 do -- ..........            
03264          do 790 ii = 1, enm2 
03265             i = na - ii 
03266             w = betm * a(i,i) - almr * b(i,i) 
03267             w1 = -almi * b(i,i) 
03268             ra = 0.0_wp 
03269             sa = 0.0_wp 
03270 !                                                                       
03271             do 760 j = m, en 
03272                x = betm * a(i,j) - almr * b(i,j) 
03273                x1 = -almi * b(i,j) 
03274                ra = ra + x * b(j,na) - x1 * b(j,en) 
03275                sa = sa + x * b(j,en) + x1 * b(j,na) 
03276   760       continue 
03277 !                                                                       
03278             if (i  ==  1 .or. isw  ==  2) go to 770 
03279             if (betm * a(i,i-1)  ==  0.0_wp) go to 770 
03280             zz = w 
03281             z1 = w1 
03282             r = ra 
03283             s = sa 
03284             isw = 2 
03285             go to 790 
03286   770       m = i 
03287             if (isw  ==  2) go to 780 
03288 !     .......... complex 1-by-1 block ..........                        
03289             tr = -ra 
03290             ti = -sa 
03291   773       dr = w 
03292             di = w1 
03293 !     .......... complex divide (t1,t2) = (tr,ti) / (dr,di) ..........  
03294   775       if (abs(di)  >  abs(dr)) go to 777 
03295             rr = di / dr 
03296             d = dr + di * rr 
03297             t1 = (tr + ti * rr) / d 
03298             t2 = (ti - tr * rr) / d 
03299             go to (787,782), isw 
03300   777       rr = dr / di 
03301             d = dr * rr + di 
03302             t1 = (tr * rr + ti) / d 
03303             t2 = (ti * rr - tr) / d 
03304             go to (787,782), isw 
03305 !     .......... complex 2-by-2 block ..........                        
03306   780       x = betm * a(i,i+1) - almr * b(i,i+1) 
03307             x1 = -almi * b(i,i+1) 
03308             y = betm * a(i+1,i) 
03309             tr = y * ra - w * r + w1 * s 
03310             ti = y * sa - w * s - w1 * r 
03311             dr = w * zz - w1 * z1 - x * y 
03312             di = w * z1 + w1 * zz - x1 * y 
03313             if (dr  ==  0.0_wp .and. di  ==  0.0_wp) dr = epsb 
03314             go to 775 
03315   782       b(i+1,na) = t1 
03316             b(i+1,en) = t2 
03317             isw = 1 
03318             if (abs(y)  >  abs(w) + abs(w1)) go to 785 
03319             tr = -ra - x * b(i+1,na) + x1 * b(i+1,en) 
03320             ti = -sa - x * b(i+1,en) - x1 * b(i+1,na) 
03321             go to 773 
03322   785       t1 = (-r - zz * b(i+1,na) + z1 * b(i+1,en)) / y 
03323             t2 = (-s - zz * b(i+1,en) - z1 * b(i+1,na)) / y 
03324   787       b(i,na) = t1 
03325             b(i,en) = t2 
03326   790    continue 
03327 !     .......... end complex vector ..........                          
03328   795    isw = 3 - isw 
03329   800 continue 
03330 !     .......... end back substitution.                                 
03331 !                transform to original coordinate system.               
03332 !                for j=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
03333       do 880 jj = 1, n 
03334          j = n + 1 - jj 
03335 !                                                                       
03336          do 880 i = 1, n 
03337             zz = 0.0_wp 
03338 !                                                                       
03339             do 860 k = 1, j 
03340   860       zz = zz + z(i,k) * b(k,j) 
03341 !                                                                       
03342             z(i,j) = zz 
03343   880 continue 
03344 !     .......... normalize so that modulus of largest                   
03345 !                component of each vector is 1.                         
03346 !                (isw is 1 initially from before) ..........            
03347       do 950 j = 1, n 
03348          d = 0.0_wp 
03349          if (isw  ==  2) go to 920 
03350          if (alfi(j)  /=  0.0_wp) go to 945 
03351 !                                                                       
03352          do 890 i = 1, n 
03353             if (abs(z(i,j))  >  d) d = abs(z(i,j)) 
03354   890    continue 
03355 !                                                                       
03356          do 900 i = 1, n 
03357   900    z(i,j) = z(i,j) / d 
03358 !                                                                       
03359          go to 950 
03360 !                                                                       
03361   920    do 930 i = 1, n 
03362             r = abs(z(i,j-1)) + abs(z(i,j)) 
03363             if (r  /=  0.0_wp) r = r * sqrt((z(i,j-1)/r)**2             &
03364      &                                     +(z(i,j)/r)**2)              
03365             if (r  >  d) d = r 
03366   930    continue 
03367 !                                                                       
03368          do 940 i = 1, n 
03369             z(i,j-1) = z(i,j-1) / d 
03370             z(i,j) = z(i,j) / d 
03371   940    continue 
03372 !                                                                       
03373   945    isw = 3 - isw 
03374   950 continue 
03375 !                                                                       
03376       return 
03377       end subroutine qzvec
03378 
03379 !=============================================================================80
03380 
03381       subroutine rebak(nm,n,b,dl,m,z) 
03382 !                                                                       
03383       integer i,j,k,m,n,i1,ii,nm 
03384       real(wp) b(nm,n),dl(n),z(nm,m) 
03385       real(wp) x 
03386 !                                                                       
03387 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure rebaka,   
03388 !     num. math. 11, 99-110(1968) by martin and wilkinson.              
03389 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 303-314(1971).   
03390 !                                                                       
03391 !     this subroutine forms the eigenvectors of a generalized           
03392 !     symmetric eigensystem by back transforming those of the           
03393 !     derived symmetric matrix determined by  reduc.                    
03394 !                                                                       
03395 !     on input                                                          
03396 !                                                                       
03397 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
03398 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
03399 !          dimension statement.                                         
03400 !                                                                       
03401 !        n is the order of the matrix system.                           
03402 !                                                                       
03403 !        b contains information about the similarity transformation     
03404 !          (cholesky decomposition) used in the reduction by  reduc     
03405 !          in its strict lower triangle.                                
03406 !                                                                       
03407 !        dl contains further information about the transformation.      
03408 !                                                                       
03409 !        m is the number of eigenvectors to be back transformed.        
03410 !                                                                       
03411 !        z contains the eigenvectors to be back transformed             
03412 !          in its first m columns.                                      
03413 !                                                                       
03414 !     on output                                                         
03415 !                                                                       
03416 !        z contains the transformed eigenvectors                        
03417 !          in its first m columns.                                      
03418 !                                                                       
03419 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03420 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03421 !                                                                       
03422 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03423 !                                                                       
03424 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03425 !                                                                       
03426       if (m  ==  0) go to 200 
03427 !                                                                       
03428       do 100 j = 1, m 
03429 !     .......... for i=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
03430          do 100 ii = 1, n 
03431             i = n + 1 - ii 
03432             i1 = i + 1 
03433             x = z(i,j) 
03434             if (i  ==  n) go to 80 
03435 !                                                                       
03436             do 60 k = i1, n 
03437    60       x = x - b(k,i) * z(k,j) 
03438 !                                                                       
03439    80       z(i,j) = x / dl(i) 
03440   100 continue 
03441 !                                                                       
03442   200 return 
03443       end subroutine rebak
03444 
03445 !=============================================================================80
03446 
03447       subroutine reduc(nm,n,a,b,dl,ierr) 
03448 !                                                                       
03449       integer i,j,k,n,i1,j1,nm,nn,ierr 
03450       real(wp) a(nm,n),b(nm,n),dl(n) 
03451       real(wp) x,y 
03452 !                                                                       
03453 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure reduc1,   
03454 !     num. math. 11, 99-110(1968) by martin and wilkinson.              
03455 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 303-314(1971).   
03456 !                                                                       
03457 !     this subroutine reduces the generalized symmetric eigenproblem    
03458 !     ax=(lambda)bx, where b is positive definite, to the standard      
03459 !     symmetric eigenproblem using the cholesky factorization of b.     
03460 !                                                                       
03461 !     on input                                                          
03462 !                                                                       
03463 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
03464 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
03465 !          dimension statement.                                         
03466 !                                                                       
03467 !        n is the order of the matrices a and b.  if the cholesky       
03468 !          factor l of b is already available, n should be prefixed     
03469 !          with a minus sign.                                           
03470 !                                                                       
03471 !        a and b contain the real symmetric input matrices.  only the   
03472 !          full upper triangles of the matrices need be supplied.  if   
03473 !          n is negative, the strict lower triangle of b contains,      
03474 !          instead, the strict lower triangle of its cholesky factor l. 
03475 !                                                                       
03476 !        dl contains, if n is negative, the diagonal elements of l.     
03477 !                                                                       
03478 !     on output                                                         
03479 !                                                                       
03480 !        a contains in its full lower triangle the full lower triangle  
03481 !          of the symmetric matrix derived from the reduction to the    
03482 !          standard form.  the strict upper triangle of a is unaltered. 
03483 !                                                                       
03484 !        b contains in its strict lower triangle the strict lower       
03485 !          triangle of its cholesky factor l.  the full upper           
03486 !          triangle of b is unaltered.                                  
03487 !                                                                       
03488 !        dl contains the diagonal elements of l.                        
03489 !                                                                       
03490 !        ierr is set to                                                 
03491 !          zero       for normal return,                                
03492 !          7*n+1      if b is not positive definite.                    
03493 !                                                                       
03494 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03495 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03496 !                                                                       
03497 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03498 !                                                                       
03499 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03500 !                                                                       
03501       ierr = 0 
03502       nn = iabs(n) 
03503       if (n  <  0) go to 100 
03504 !     .......... form l in the arrays b and dl ..........               
03505       do 80 i = 1, n 
03506          i1 = i - 1 
03507 !                                                                       
03508          do 80 j = i, n 
03509             x = b(i,j) 
03510             if (i  ==  1) go to 40 
03511 !                                                                       
03512             do 20 k = 1, i1 
03513    20       x = x - b(i,k) * b(j,k) 
03514 !                                                                       
03515    40       if (j  /=  i) go to 60 
03516             if (x  <=  0.0_wp) go to 1000 
03517             y = sqrt(x) 
03518             dl(i) = y 
03519             go to 80 
03520    60       b(j,i) = x / y 
03521    80 continue 
03522 !     .......... form the transpose of the upper triangle of inv(l)*a   
03523 !                in the lower triangle of the array a ..........        
03524   100 do 200 i = 1, nn 
03525          i1 = i - 1 
03526          y = dl(i) 
03527 !                                                                       
03528          do 200 j = i, nn 
03529             x = a(i,j) 
03530             if (i  ==  1) go to 180 
03531 !                                                                       
03532             do 160 k = 1, i1 
03533   160       x = x - b(i,k) * a(j,k) 
03534 !                                                                       
03535   180       a(j,i) = x / y 
03536   200 continue 
03537 !     .......... pre-multiply by inv(l) and overwrite ..........        
03538       do 300 j = 1, nn 
03539          j1 = j - 1 
03540 !                                                                       
03541          do 300 i = j, nn 
03542             x = a(i,j) 
03543             if (i  ==  j) go to 240 
03544             i1 = i - 1 
03545 !                                                                       
03546             do 220 k = j, i1 
03547   220       x = x - a(k,j) * b(i,k) 
03548 !                                                                       
03549   240       if (j  ==  1) go to 280 
03550 !                                                                       
03551             do 260 k = 1, j1 
03552   260       x = x - a(j,k) * b(i,k) 
03553 !                                                                       
03554   280       a(i,j) = x / dl(i) 
03555   300 continue 
03556 !                                                                       
03557       go to 1001 
03558 !     .......... set error -- b is not positive definite ..........     
03559  1000 ierr = 7 * n + 1 
03560  1001 return 
03561       end subroutine reduc
03562 
03563 !=============================================================================80
03564 
03565       subroutine rg(nm,n,a,wr,wi,matz,z,iv1,fv1,ierr) 
03566 !                                                                       
03567       integer n,nm,is1,is2,ierr,matz 
03568       real(wp) a(nm,n),wr(n),wi(n),z(nm,n),fv1(n) 
03569       integer iv1(n) 
03570 !                                                                       
03571 !     this subroutine calls the recommended sequence of                 
03572 !     subroutines from the eigensystem subroutine package (eispack)     
03573 !     to find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors (if desired)             
03574 !     of a real general matrix.                                         
03575 !                                                                       
03576 !     on input                                                          
03577 !                                                                       
03578 !        nm  must be set to the row dimension of the two-dimensional    
03579 !        array parameters as declared in the calling program            
03580 !        dimension statement.                                           
03581 !                                                                       
03582 !        n  is the order of the matrix  a.                              
03583 !                                                                       
03584 !        a  contains the real general matrix.                           
03585 !                                                                       
03586 !        matz  is an integer variable set equal to zero if              
03587 !        only eigenvalues are desired.  otherwise it is set to          
03588 !        any non-zero integer for both eigenvalues and eigenvectors.    
03589 !                                                                       
03590 !     on output                                                         
03591 !                                                                       
03592 !        wr  and  wi  contain the real and imaginary parts,             
03593 !        respectively, of the eigenvalues.  complex conjugate           
03594 !        pairs of eigenvalues appear consecutively with the             
03595 !        eigenvalue having the positive imaginary part first.           
03596 !                                                                       
03597 !        z  contains the real and imaginary parts of the eigenvectors   
03598 !        if matz is not zero.  if the j-th eigenvalue is real, the      
03599 !        j-th column of  z  contains its eigenvector.  if the j-th      
03600 !        eigenvalue is complex with positive imaginary part, the        
03601 !        j-th and (j+1)-th columns of  z  contain the real and          
03602 !        imaginary parts of its eigenvector.  the conjugate of this     
03603 !        vector is the eigenvector for the conjugate eigenvalue.        
03604 !                                                                       
03605 !        ierr  is an integer output variable set equal to an error      
03606 !           completion code described in the documentation for hqr      
03607 !           and hqr2.  the normal completion code is zero.              
03608 !                                                                       
03609 !        iv1  and  fv1  are temporary storage arrays.                   
03610 !                                                                       
03611 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03612 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03613 !                                                                       
03614 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03615 !                                                                       
03616 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03617 !                                                                       
03618       if (n  <=  nm) go to 10 
03619       ierr = 10 * n 
03620       go to 50 
03621 !                                                                       
03622    10 call  balanc(nm,n,a,is1,is2,fv1) 
03623       call  elmhes(nm,n,is1,is2,a,iv1) 
03624       if (matz  /=  0) go to 20 
03625 !     .......... find eigenvalues only ..........                       
03626       call  hqr(nm,n,is1,is2,a,wr,wi,ierr) 
03627       go to 50 
03628 !     .......... find both eigenvalues and eigenvectors ..........      
03629    20 call  eltran(nm,n,is1,is2,a,iv1,z) 
03630       call  hqr2(nm,n,is1,is2,a,wr,wi,z,ierr) 
03631       if (ierr  /=  0) go to 50 
03632       call  balbak(nm,n,is1,is2,fv1,n,z) 
03633    50 return 
03634       end subroutine rg
03635 
03636 !=============================================================================80
03637 
03638       subroutine rgg(nm,n,a,b,alfr,alfi,beta,matz,z,ierr) 
03639 !                                                                       
03640       integer, parameter               :: dp = 8    ! double precision
03641 
03642       integer n,nm,ierr,matz 
03643       real(wp) a(nm,n),b(nm,n),alfr(n),alfi(n),beta(n),z(nm,n) 
03644       logical tf 
03645 !                                                                       
03646 !     this subroutine calls the recommended sequence of                 
03647 !     subroutines from the eigensystem subroutine package (eispack)     
03648 !     to find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors (if desired)             
03649 !     for the real general generalized eigenproblem  ax = (lambda)bx.   
03650 !                                                                       
03651 !     on input                                                          
03652 !                                                                       
03653 !        nm  must be set to the row dimension of the two-dimensional    
03654 !        array parameters as declared in the calling program            
03655 !        dimension statement.                                           
03656 !                                                                       
03657 !        n  is the order of the matrices  a  and  b.                    
03658 !                                                                       
03659 !        a  contains a real general matrix.                             
03660 !                                                                       
03661 !        b  contains a real general matrix.                             
03662 !                                                                       
03663 !        matz  is an integer variable set equal to zero if              
03664 !        only eigenvalues are desired.  otherwise it is set to          
03665 !        any non-zero integer for both eigenvalues and eigenvectors.    
03666 !                                                                       
03667 !     on output                                                         
03668 !                                                                       
03669 !        alfr  and  alfi  contain the real and imaginary parts,         
03670 !        respectively, of the numerators of the eigenvalues.            
03671 !                                                                       
03672 !        beta  contains the denominators of the eigenvalues,            
03673 !        which are thus given by the ratios  (alfr+i*alfi)/beta.        
03674 !        complex conjugate pairs of eigenvalues appear consecutively    
03675 !        with the eigenvalue having the positive imaginary part first.  
03676 !                                                                       
03677 !        z  contains the real and imaginary parts of the eigenvectors   
03678 !        if matz is not zero.  if the j-th eigenvalue is real, the      
03679 !        j-th column of  z  contains its eigenvector.  if the j-th      
03680 !        eigenvalue is complex with positive imaginary part, the        
03681 !        j-th and (j+1)-th columns of  z  contain the real and          
03682 !        imaginary parts of its eigenvector.  the conjugate of this     
03683 !        vector is the eigenvector for the conjugate eigenvalue.        
03684 !                                                                       
03685 !        ierr  is an integer output variable set equal to an error      
03686 !           completion code described in the documentation for qzit.    
03687 !           the normal completion code is zero.                         
03688 !                                                                       
03689 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03690 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03691 !                                                                       
03692 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03693 !                                                                       
03694 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03695 !                                                                       
03696       if (n  <=  nm) go to 10 
03697       ierr = 10 * n 
03698       go to 50 
03699 !                                                                       
03700    10 if (matz  /=  0) go to 20 
03701 !     .......... find eigenvalues only ..........                       
03702       tf = .false. 
03703       call  qzhes(nm,n,a,b,tf,z) 
03704       call  qzit(nm,n,a,b,0.0_wp,tf,z,ierr) 
03705       call  qzval(nm,n,a,b,alfr,alfi,beta,tf,z) 
03706       go to 50 
03707 !     .......... find both eigenvalues and eigenvectors ..........      
03708    20 tf = .true. 
03709       call  qzhes(nm,n,a,b,tf,z) 
03710       call  qzit(nm,n,a,b,0.0_wp,tf,z,ierr) 
03711       call  qzval(nm,n,a,b,alfr,alfi,beta,tf,z) 
03712       if (ierr  /=  0) go to 50 
03713       call  qzvec(nm,n,a,b,alfr,alfi,beta,z) 
03714    50 return 
03715       end subroutine rgg
03716 
03717 !=============================================================================80
03718 
03719       subroutine rs(nm,n,a,w,matz,z,fv1,fv2,ierr) 
03720 !                                                                       
03721       integer n,nm,ierr,matz 
03722       real(wp) a(nm,n),w(n),z(nm,n),fv1(n),fv2(n) 
03723 !                                                                       
03724 !     this subroutine calls the recommended sequence of                 
03725 !     subroutines from the eigensystem subroutine package (eispack)     
03726 !     to find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors (if desired)             
03727 !     of a real symmetric matrix.                                       
03728 !                                                                       
03729 !     on input                                                          
03730 !                                                                       
03731 !        nm  must be set to the row dimension of the two-dimensional    
03732 !        array parameters as declared in the calling program            
03733 !        dimension statement.                                           
03734 !                                                                       
03735 !        n  is the order of the matrix  a.                              
03736 !                                                                       
03737 !        a  contains the real symmetric matrix.                         
03738 !                                                                       
03739 !        matz  is an integer variable set equal to zero if              
03740 !        only eigenvalues are desired.  otherwise it is set to          
03741 !        any non-zero integer for both eigenvalues and eigenvectors.    
03742 !                                                                       
03743 !     on output                                                         
03744 !                                                                       
03745 !        w  contains the eigenvalues in ascending order.                
03746 !                                                                       
03747 !        z  contains the eigenvectors if matz is not zero.              
03748 !                                                                       
03749 !        ierr  is an integer output variable set equal to an error      
03750 !           completion code described in the documentation for tqlrat   
03751 !           and tql2.  the normal completion code is zero.              
03752 !                                                                       
03753 !        fv1  and  fv2  are temporary storage arrays.                   
03754 !                                                                       
03755 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03756 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03757 !                                                                       
03758 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03759 !                                                                       
03760 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03761 !                                                                       
03762       if (n  <=  nm) go to 10 
03763       ierr = 10 * n 
03764       go to 50 
03765 !                                                                       
03766    10 if (matz  /=  0) go to 20 
03767 !     .......... find eigenvalues only ..........                       
03768       call  tred1(nm,n,a,w,fv1,fv2) 
03769 !  tqlrat encounters catastrophic underflow on the Vax                  
03770 !     call  tqlrat(n,w,fv2,ierr)                                        
03771       call  tql1(n,w,fv1,ierr) 
03772       go to 50 
03773 !     .......... find both eigenvalues and eigenvectors ..........      
03774    20 call  tred2(nm,n,a,w,fv1,z) 
03775       call  tql2(nm,n,w,fv1,z,ierr) 
03776    50 return 
03777       end subroutine rs
03778 
03779 !=============================================================================80
03780 
03781       subroutine rsg(nm,n,a,b,w,matz,z,fv1,fv2,ierr) 
03782 !                                                                       
03783       integer n,nm,ierr,matz 
03784       real(wp) a(nm,n),b(nm,n),w(n),z(nm,n),fv1(n),fv2(n) 
03785 !                                                                       
03786 !     this subroutine calls the recommended sequence of                 
03787 !     subroutines from the eigensystem subroutine package (eispack)     
03788 !     to find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors (if desired)             
03789 !     for the real symmetric generalized eigenproblem  ax = (lambda)bx. 
03790 !                                                                       
03791 !     on input                                                          
03792 !                                                                       
03793 !        nm  must be set to the row dimension of the two-dimensional    
03794 !        array parameters as declared in the calling program            
03795 !        dimension statement.                                           
03796 !                                                                       
03797 !        n  is the order of the matrices  a  and  b.                    
03798 !                                                                       
03799 !        a  contains a real symmetric matrix.                           
03800 !                                                                       
03801 !        b  contains a positive definite real symmetric matrix.         
03802 !                                                                       
03803 !        matz  is an integer variable set equal to zero if              
03804 !        only eigenvalues are desired.  otherwise it is set to          
03805 !        any non-zero integer for both eigenvalues and eigenvectors.    
03806 !                                                                       
03807 !     on output                                                         
03808 !                                                                       
03809 !        w  contains the eigenvalues in ascending order.                
03810 !                                                                       
03811 !        z  contains the eigenvectors if matz is not zero.              
03812 !                                                                       
03813 !        ierr  is an integer output variable set equal to an error      
03814 !           completion code described in the documentation for tqlrat   
03815 !           and tql2.  the normal completion code is zero.              
03816 !                                                                       
03817 !        fv1  and  fv2  are temporary storage arrays.                   
03818 !                                                                       
03819 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03820 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03821 !                                                                       
03822 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03823 !                                                                       
03824 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03825 !                                                                       
03826       if (n  <=  nm) go to 10 
03827       ierr = 10 * n 
03828       go to 50 
03829 !                                                                       
03830    10 call  reduc(nm,n,a,b,fv2,ierr) 
03831       if (ierr  /=  0) go to 50 
03832       if (matz  /=  0) go to 20 
03833 !     .......... find eigenvalues only ..........                       
03834       call  tred1(nm,n,a,w,fv1,fv2) 
03835       call  tqlrat(n,w,fv2,ierr) 
03836       go to 50 
03837 !     .......... find both eigenvalues and eigenvectors ..........      
03838    20 call  tred2(nm,n,a,w,fv1,z) 
03839       call  tql2(nm,n,w,fv1,z,ierr) 
03840       if (ierr  /=  0) go to 50 
03841       call  rebak(nm,n,b,fv2,n,z) 
03842    50 return 
03843       end subroutine rsg
03844 
03845 !=============================================================================80
03846 
03847       subroutine rsm(nm,n,a,w,m,z,fwork,iwork,ierr) 
03848 !                                                                       
03849       integer n,nm,m,iwork(n),ierr 
03850       integer k1,k2,k3,k4,k5,k6,k7,k8
03851       real(wp) a(nm,n),w(n),z(nm,m),fwork(1) 
03852 !                                                                       
03853 !     this subroutine calls the recommended sequence of                 
03854 !     subroutines from the eigensystem subroutine package (eispack)     
03855 !     to find all of the eigenvalues and some of the eigenvectors       
03856 !     of a real symmetric matrix.                                       
03857 !                                                                       
03858 !     on input                                                          
03859 !                                                                       
03860 !        nm  must be set to the row dimension of the two-dimensional    
03861 !        array parameters as declared in the calling program            
03862 !        dimension statement.                                           
03863 !                                                                       
03864 !        n  is the order of the matrix  a.                              
03865 !                                                                       
03866 !        a  contains the real symmetric matrix.                         
03867 !                                                                       
03868 !        m  the eigenvectors corresponding to the first m eigenvalues   
03869 !           are to be computed.                                         
03870 !           if m = 0 then no eigenvectors are computed.                 
03871 !           if m = n then all of the eigenvectors are computed.         
03872 !                                                                       
03873 !     on output                                                         
03874 !                                                                       
03875 !        w  contains all n eigenvalues in ascending order.              
03876 !                                                                       
03877 !        z  contains the orthonormal eigenvectors associated with       
03878 !           the first m eigenvalues.                                    
03879 !                                                                       
03880 !        ierr  is an integer output variable set equal to an error      
03881 !           completion code described in the documentation for tqlrat,  
03882 !           imtqlv and tinvit.  the normal completion code is zero.     
03883 !                                                                       
03884 !        fwork  is a temporary storage array of dimension 8*n.          
03885 !                                                                       
03886 !        iwork  is an integer temporary storage array of dimension n.   
03887 !                                                                       
03888 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03889 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03890 !                                                                       
03891 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03892 !                                                                       
03893 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03894 !                                                                       
03895       ierr = 10 * n 
03896       if (n  >  nm .or. m  >  nm) go to 50 
03897       k1 = 1 
03898       k2 = k1 + n 
03899       k3 = k2 + n 
03900       k4 = k3 + n 
03901       k5 = k4 + n 
03902       k6 = k5 + n 
03903       k7 = k6 + n 
03904       k8 = k7 + n 
03905       if (m  >  0) go to 10 
03906 !     .......... find eigenvalues only ..........                       
03907       call  tred1(nm,n,a,w,fwork(k1),fwork(k2)) 
03908       call  tqlrat(n,w,fwork(k2),ierr) 
03909       go to 50 
03910 !     .......... find all eigenvalues and m eigenvectors ..........     
03911    10 call  tred1(nm,n,a,fwork(k1),fwork(k2),fwork(k3)) 
03912       call  imtqlv(n,fwork(k1),fwork(k2),fwork(k3),w,iwork,             &
03913      &             ierr,fwork(k4))                                      
03914       call  tinvit(nm,n,fwork(k1),fwork(k2),fwork(k3),m,w,iwork,z,ierr, &
03915      &             fwork(k4),fwork(k5),fwork(k6),fwork(k7),fwork(k8))   
03916       call  trbak1(nm,n,a,fwork(k2),m,z) 
03917    50 return 
03918       end subroutine rsm
03919 
03920 !=============================================================================80
03921 
03922       subroutine svd(nm,m,n,a,w,matu,u,matv,v,ierr,rv1) 
03923 !                                                                       
03924       integer, parameter               :: dp = 8    ! double precision
03925 
03926       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,ii,i1,kk,k1,ll,l1,mn,nm,its,ierr 
03927       real(wp) a(nm,n),w(n),u(nm,n),v(nm,n),rv1(n) 
03928       real(wp) c,f,g,h,s,x,y,z,tst1,tst2,scale
03929       logical matu,matv 
03930 !                                                                       
03931 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure svd,      
03932 !     num. math. 14, 403-420(1970) by golub and reinsch.                
03933 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol ii-linear algebra, 134-151(1971).   
03934 !                                                                       
03935 !     this subroutine determines the singular value decomposition       
03936 !          t                                                            
03937 !     a=usv  of a real m by n rectangular matrix.  householder          
03938 !     bidiagonalization and a variant of the qr algorithm are used.     
03939 !                                                                       
03940 !     on input                                                          
03941 !                                                                       
03942 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
03943 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
03944 !          dimension statement.  note that nm must be at least          
03945 !          as large as the maximum of m and n.                          
03946 !                                                                       
03947 !        m is the number of rows of a (and u).                          
03948 !                                                                       
03949 !        n is the number of columns of a (and u) and the order of v.    
03950 !                                                                       
03951 !        a contains the rectangular input matrix to be decomposed.      
03952 !                                                                       
03953 !        matu should be set to .true. if the u matrix in the            
03954 !          decomposition is desired, and to .false. otherwise.          
03955 !                                                                       
03956 !        matv should be set to .true. if the v matrix in the            
03957 !          decomposition is desired, and to .false. otherwise.          
03958 !                                                                       
03959 !     on output                                                         
03960 !                                                                       
03961 !        a is unaltered (unless overwritten by u or v).                 
03962 !                                                                       
03963 !        w contains the n (non-negative) singular values of a (the      
03964 !          diagonal elements of s).  they are unordered.  if an         
03965 !          error exit is made, the singular values should be correct    
03966 !          for indices ierr+1,ierr+2,...,n.                             
03967 !                                                                       
03968 !        u contains the matrix u (orthogonal column vectors) of the     
03969 !          decomposition if matu has been set to .true.  otherwise      
03970 !          u is used as a temporary array.  u may coincide with a.      
03971 !          if an error exit is made, the columns of u corresponding     
03972 !          to indices of correct singular values should be correct.     
03973 !                                                                       
03974 !        v contains the matrix v (orthogonal) of the decomposition if   
03975 !          matv has been set to .true.  otherwise v is not referenced.  
03976 !          v may also coincide with a if u is not needed.  if an error  
03977 !          exit is made, the columns of v corresponding to indices of   
03978 !          correct singular values should be correct.                   
03979 !                                                                       
03980 !        ierr is set to                                                 
03981 !          zero       for normal return,                                
03982 !          k          if the k-th singular value has not been           
03983 !                     determined after 30 iterations.                   
03984 !                                                                       
03985 !        rv1 is a temporary storage array.                              
03986 !                                                                       
03987 !     calls pythag for  sqrt(a*a + b*b) .                              
03988 !                                                                       
03989 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
03990 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
03991 !                                                                       
03992 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
03993 !                                                                       
03994 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
03995 !                                                                       
03996       ierr = 0 
03997 !                                                                       
03998       do 100 i = 1, m 
03999 !                                                                       
04000          do 100 j = 1, n 
04001             u(i,j) = a(i,j) 
04002   100 continue 
04003 !     .......... householder reduction to bidiagonal form ..........    
04004       g = 0.0_wp 
04005       scale = 0.0_wp 
04006       x = 0.0_wp 
04007 !                                                                       
04008       do 300 i = 1, n 
04009          l = i + 1 
04010          rv1(i) = scale * g 
04011          g = 0.0_wp 
04012          s = 0.0_wp 
04013          scale = 0.0_wp 
04014          if (i  >  m) go to 210 
04015 !                                                                       
04016          do 120 k = i, m 
04017   120    scale = scale + abs(u(k,i)) 
04018 !                                                                       
04019          if (scale  ==  0.0_wp) go to 210 
04020 !                                                                       
04021          do 130 k = i, m 
04022             u(k,i) = u(k,i) / scale 
04023             s = s + u(k,i)**2 
04024   130    continue 
04025 !                                                                       
04026          f = u(i,i) 
04027          g = -sign(sqrt(s),f) 
04028          h = f * g - s 
04029          u(i,i) = f - g 
04030          if (i  ==  n) go to 190 
04031 !                                                                       
04032          do 150 j = l, n 
04033             s = 0.0_wp 
04034 !                                                                       
04035             do 140 k = i, m 
04036   140       s = s + u(k,i) * u(k,j) 
04037 !                                                                       
04038             f = s / h 
04039 !                                                                       
04040             do 150 k = i, m 
04041                u(k,j) = u(k,j) + f * u(k,i) 
04042   150    continue 
04043 !                                                                       
04044   190    do 200 k = i, m 
04045   200    u(k,i) = scale * u(k,i) 
04046 !                                                                       
04047   210    w(i) = scale * g 
04048          g = 0.0_wp 
04049          s = 0.0_wp 
04050          scale = 0.0_wp 
04051          if (i  >  m .or. i  ==  n) go to 290 
04052 !                                                                       
04053          do 220 k = l, n 
04054   220    scale = scale + abs(u(i,k)) 
04055 !                                                                       
04056          if (scale  ==  0.0_wp) go to 290 
04057 !                                                                       
04058          do 230 k = l, n 
04059             u(i,k) = u(i,k) / scale 
04060             s = s + u(i,k)**2 
04061   230    continue 
04062 !                                                                       
04063          f = u(i,l) 
04064          g = -sign(sqrt(s),f) 
04065          h = f * g - s 
04066          u(i,l) = f - g 
04067 !                                                                       
04068          do 240 k = l, n 
04069   240    rv1(k) = u(i,k) / h 
04070 !                                                                       
04071          if (i  ==  m) go to 270 
04072 !                                                                       
04073          do 260 j = l, m 
04074             s = 0.0_wp 
04075 !                                                                       
04076             do 250 k = l, n 
04077   250       s = s + u(j,k) * u(i,k) 
04078 !                                                                       
04079             do 260 k = l, n 
04080                u(j,k) = u(j,k) + s * rv1(k) 
04081   260    continue 
04082 !                                                                       
04083   270    do 280 k = l, n 
04084   280    u(i,k) = scale * u(i,k) 
04085 !                                                                       
04086   290    x = max(x,abs(w(i))+abs(rv1(i))) 
04087   300 continue 
04088 !     .......... accumulation of right-hand transformations ..........  
04089       if (.not. matv) go to 410 
04090 !     .......... for i=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
04091       do 400 ii = 1, n 
04092          i = n + 1 - ii 
04093          if (i  ==  n) go to 390 
04094          if (g  ==  0.0_wp) go to 360 
04095 !                                                                       
04096          do 320 j = l, n 
04097 !     .......... double division avoids possible underflow ..........   
04098   320    v(j,i) = (u(i,j) / u(i,l)) / g 
04099 !                                                                       
04100          do 350 j = l, n 
04101             s = 0.0_wp 
04102 !                                                                       
04103             do 340 k = l, n 
04104   340       s = s + u(i,k) * v(k,j) 
04105 !                                                                       
04106             do 350 k = l, n 
04107                v(k,j) = v(k,j) + s * v(k,i) 
04108   350    continue 
04109 !                                                                       
04110   360    do 380 j = l, n 
04111             v(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
04112             v(j,i) = 0.0_wp 
04113   380    continue 
04114 !                                                                       
04115   390    v(i,i) = 1.0_wp 
04116          g = rv1(i) 
04117          l = i 
04118   400 continue 
04119 !     .......... accumulation of left-hand transformations ..........   
04120   410 if (.not. matu) go to 510 
04121 !     ..........for i=min(m,n) step -1 until 1 do -- ..........         
04122       mn = n 
04123       if (m  <  n) mn = m 
04124 !                                                                       
04125       do 500 ii = 1, mn 
04126          i = mn + 1 - ii 
04127          l = i + 1 
04128          g = w(i) 
04129          if (i  ==  n) go to 430 
04130 !                                                                       
04131          do 420 j = l, n 
04132   420    u(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
04133 !                                                                       
04134   430    if (g  ==  0.0_wp) go to 475 
04135          if (i  ==  mn) go to 460 
04136 !                                                                       
04137          do 450 j = l, n 
04138             s = 0.0_wp 
04139 !                                                                       
04140             do 440 k = l, m 
04141   440       s = s + u(k,i) * u(k,j) 
04142 !     .......... double division avoids possible underflow ..........   
04143             f = (s / u(i,i)) / g 
04144 !                                                                       
04145             do 450 k = i, m 
04146                u(k,j) = u(k,j) + f * u(k,i) 
04147   450    continue 
04148 !                                                                       
04149   460    do 470 j = i, m 
04150   470    u(j,i) = u(j,i) / g 
04151 !                                                                       
04152          go to 490 
04153 !                                                                       
04154   475    do 480 j = i, m 
04155   480    u(j,i) = 0.0_wp 
04156 !                                                                       
04157   490    u(i,i) = u(i,i) + 1.0_wp 
04158   500 continue 
04159 !     .......... diagonalization of the bidiagonal form ..........      
04160   510 tst1 = x 
04161 !     .......... for k=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
04162       do 700 kk = 1, n 
04163          k1 = n - kk 
04164          k = k1 + 1 
04165          its = 0 
04166 !     .......... test for splitting.                                    
04167 !                for l=k step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
04168   520    do 530 ll = 1, k 
04169             l1 = k - ll 
04170             l = l1 + 1 
04171             tst2 = tst1 + abs(rv1(l)) 
04172             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 565 
04173 !     .......... rv1(1) is always zero, so there is no exit             
04174 !                through the bottom of the loop ..........              
04175             tst2 = tst1 + abs(w(l1)) 
04176             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 540 
04177   530    continue 
04178 !     .......... cancellation of rv1(l) if l greater than 1 ..........  
04179   540    c = 0.0_wp 
04180          s = 1.0_wp 
04181 !                                                                       
04182          do 560 i = l, k 
04183             f = s * rv1(i) 
04184             rv1(i) = c * rv1(i) 
04185             tst2 = tst1 + abs(f) 
04186             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 565 
04187             g = w(i) 
04188             h = pythag(f,g) 
04189             w(i) = h 
04190             c = g / h 
04191             s = -f / h 
04192             if (.not. matu) go to 560 
04193 !                                                                       
04194             do 550 j = 1, m 
04195                y = u(j,l1) 
04196                z = u(j,i) 
04197                u(j,l1) = y * c + z * s 
04198                u(j,i) = -y * s + z * c 
04199   550       continue 
04200 !                                                                       
04201   560    continue 
04202 !     .......... test for convergence ..........                        
04203   565    z = w(k) 
04204          if (l  ==  k) go to 650 
04205 !     .......... shift from bottom 2 by 2 minor ..........              
04206          if (its  ==  30) go to 1000 
04207          its = its + 1 
04208          x = w(l) 
04209          y = w(k1) 
04210          g = rv1(k1) 
04211          h = rv1(k) 
04212          f = 0.5_wp* (((g + z) / h) * ((g - z) / y) + y / h - h / y) 
04213          g = pythag(f,1.0_wp) 
04214          f = x - (z / x) * z + (h / x) * (y / (f + sign(g,f)) - h) 
04215 !     .......... next qr transformation ..........                      
04216          c = 1.0_wp 
04217          s = 1.0_wp 
04218 !                                                                       
04219          do 600 i1 = l, k1 
04220             i = i1 + 1 
04221             g = rv1(i) 
04222             y = w(i) 
04223             h = s * g 
04224             g = c * g 
04225             z = pythag(f,h) 
04226             rv1(i1) = z 
04227             c = f / z 
04228             s = h / z 
04229             f = x * c + g * s 
04230             g = -x * s + g * c 
04231             h = y * s 
04232             y = y * c 
04233             if (.not. matv) go to 575 
04234 !                                                                       
04235             do 570 j = 1, n 
04236                x = v(j,i1) 
04237                z = v(j,i) 
04238                v(j,i1) = x * c + z * s 
04239                v(j,i) = -x * s + z * c 
04240   570       continue 
04241 !                                                                       
04242   575       z = pythag(f,h) 
04243             w(i1) = z 
04244 !     .......... rotation can be arbitrary if z is zero ..........      
04245             if (z  ==  0.0_wp) go to 580 
04246             c = f / z 
04247             s = h / z 
04248   580       f = c * g + s * y 
04249             x = -s * g + c * y 
04250             if (.not. matu) go to 600 
04251 !                                                                       
04252             do 590 j = 1, m 
04253                y = u(j,i1) 
04254                z = u(j,i) 
04255                u(j,i1) = y * c + z * s 
04256                u(j,i) = -y * s + z * c 
04257   590       continue 
04258 !                                                                       
04259   600    continue 
04260 !                                                                       
04261          rv1(l) = 0.0_wp 
04262          rv1(k) = f 
04263          w(k) = x 
04264          go to 520 
04265 !     .......... convergence ..........                                 
04266   650    if (z  >=  0.0_wp) go to 700 
04267 !     .......... w(k) is made non-negative ..........                   
04268          w(k) = -z 
04269          if (.not. matv) go to 700 
04270 !                                                                       
04271          do 690 j = 1, n 
04272   690    v(j,k) = -v(j,k) 
04273 !                                                                       
04274   700 continue 
04275 !                                                                       
04276       go to 1001 
04277 !     .......... set error -- no convergence to a                       
04278 !                singular value after 30 iterations ..........          
04279  1000 ierr = k 
04280  1001 return 
04281 
04282       end subroutine svd
04283 
04284 !=============================================================================80
04285 
04286       subroutine tinvit(nm,n,d,e,e2,m,w,ind,z,                          &
04287      &                  ierr,rv1,rv2,rv3,rv4,rv6)                       
04288 !                                                                       
04289       integer i,j,m,n,p,q,r,s,ii,ip,jj,nm,its,tag,ierr,group 
04290       real(wp) d(n),e(n),e2(n),w(m),z(nm,m),                    
04291             rv1(n),rv2(n),rv3(n),rv4(n),rv6(n)                         
04292       real(wp) u,v,uk,xu,x0,x1,eps2,eps3,eps4,norm,order
04293       integer ind(m) 
04294 !                                                                       
04295 !     this subroutine is a translation of the inverse iteration tech-   
04296 !     nique in the algol procedure tristurm by peters and wilkinson.    
04297 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 418-439(1971).   
04298 !                                                                       
04299 !     this subroutine finds those eigenvectors of a tridiagonal         
04300 !     symmetric matrix corresponding to specified eigenvalues,          
04301 !     using inverse iteration.                                          
04302 !                                                                       
04303 !     on input                                                          
04304 !                                                                       
04305 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
04306 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
04307 !          dimension statement.                                         
04308 !                                                                       
04309 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
04310 !                                                                       
04311 !        d contains the diagonal elements of the input matrix.          
04312 !                                                                       
04313 !        e contains the subdiagonal elements of the input matrix        
04314 !          in its last n-1 positions.  e(1) is arbitrary.               
04315 !                                                                       
04316 !        e2 contains the squares of the corresponding elements of e,    
04317 !          with zeros corresponding to negligible elements of e.        
04318 !          e(i) is considered negligible if it is not larger than       
04319 !          the product of the relative machine precision and the sum    
04320 !          of the magnitudes of d(i) and d(i-1).  e2(1) must contain    
04321 !          0.0_wp if the eigenvalues are in ascending order, or 2.0_wp    
04322 !          if the eigenvalues are in descending order.  if  bisect,     
04323 !          tridib, or  imtqlv  has been used to find the eigenvalues,   
04324 !          their output e2 array is exactly what is expected here.      
04325 !                                                                       
04326 !        m is the number of specified eigenvalues.                      
04327 !                                                                       
04328 !        w contains the m eigenvalues in ascending or descending order. 
04329 !                                                                       
04330 !        ind contains in its first m positions the submatrix indices    
04331 !          associated with the corresponding eigenvalues in w --        
04332 !          1 for eigenvalues belonging to the first submatrix from      
04333 !          the top, 2 for those belonging to the second submatrix, etc. 
04334 !                                                                       
04335 !     on output                                                         
04336 !                                                                       
04337 !        all input arrays are unaltered.                                
04338 !                                                                       
04339 !        z contains the associated set of orthonormal eigenvectors.     
04340 !          any vector which fails to converge is set to zero.           
04341 !                                                                       
04342 !        ierr is set to                                                 
04343 !          zero       for normal return,                                
04344 !          -r         if the eigenvector corresponding to the r-th      
04345 !                     eigenvalue fails to converge in 5 iterations.     
04346 !                                                                       
04347 !        rv1, rv2, rv3, rv4, and rv6 are temporary storage arrays.      
04348 !                                                                       
04349 !     calls pythag for  sqrt(a*a + b*b) .                              
04350 !                                                                       
04351 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
04352 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
04353 !                                                                       
04354 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
04355 !                                                                       
04356 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
04357 !                                                                       
04358       ierr = 0 
04359       if (m  ==  0) go to 1001 
04360       tag = 0 
04361       order = 1.0_wp - e2(1) 
04362       q = 0 
04363 !     .......... establish and process next submatrix ..........        
04364   100 p = q + 1 
04365 !                                                                       
04366       do 120 q = p, n 
04367          if (q  ==  n) go to 140 
04368          if (e2(q+1)  ==  0.0_wp) go to 140 
04369   120 continue 
04370 !     .......... find vectors by inverse iteration ..........           
04371   140 tag = tag + 1 
04372       s = 0 
04373 !                                                                       
04374       do 920 r = 1, m 
04375          if (ind(r)  /=  tag) go to 920 
04376          its = 1 
04377          x1 = w(r) 
04378          if (s  /=  0) go to 510 
04379 !     .......... check for isolated root ..........                     
04380          xu = 1.0_wp 
04381          if (p  /=  q) go to 490 
04382          rv6(p) = 1.0_wp 
04383          go to 870 
04384   490    norm = abs(d(p)) 
04385          ip = p + 1 
04386 !                                                                       
04387          do 500 i = ip, q 
04388   500    norm = max(norm, abs(d(i))+abs(e(i))) 
04389 !     .......... eps2 is the criterion for grouping,                    
04390 !                eps3 replaces zero pivots and equal                    
04391 !                roots are modified by eps3,                            
04392 !                eps4 is taken very small to avoid overflow ..........  
04393 !        eps2 = 1.0d-3 * norm 
04394          eps2 = 0.001_wp * norm 
04395          eps3 = epslon(norm) 
04396          uk = q - p + 1 
04397          eps4 = uk * eps3 
04398          uk = eps4 / sqrt(uk) 
04399          s = p 
04400   505    group = 0 
04401          go to 520 
04402 !     .......... look for close or coincident roots ..........          
04403   510    if (abs(x1-x0)  >=  eps2) go to 505 
04404          group = group + 1 
04405          if (order * (x1 - x0)  <=  0.0_wp) x1 = x0 + order * eps3 
04406 !     .......... elimination with interchanges and                      
04407 !                initialization of vector ..........                    
04408   520    v = 0.0_wp 
04409 !                                                                       
04410          do 580 i = p, q 
04411             rv6(i) = uk 
04412             if (i  ==  p) go to 560 
04413             if (abs(e(i))  <  abs(u)) go to 540 
04414 !     .......... warning -- a divide check may occur here if            
04415 !                e2 array has not been specified correctly ..........   
04416             xu = u / e(i) 
04417             rv4(i) = xu 
04418             rv1(i-1) = e(i) 
04419             rv2(i-1) = d(i) - x1 
04420             rv3(i-1) = 0.0_wp 
04421             if (i  /=  q) rv3(i-1) = e(i+1) 
04422             u = v - xu * rv2(i-1) 
04423             v = -xu * rv3(i-1) 
04424             go to 580 
04425   540       xu = e(i) / u 
04426             rv4(i) = xu 
04427             rv1(i-1) = u 
04428             rv2(i-1) = v 
04429             rv3(i-1) = 0.0_wp 
04430   560       u = d(i) - x1 - xu * v 
04431             if (i  /=  q) v = e(i+1) 
04432   580    continue 
04433 !                                                                       
04434          if (u  ==  0.0_wp) u = eps3 
04435          rv1(q) = u 
04436          rv2(q) = 0.0_wp 
04437          rv3(q) = 0.0_wp 
04438 !     .......... back substitution                                      
04439 !                for i=q step -1 until p do -- ..........               
04440   600    do 620 ii = p, q 
04441             i = p + q - ii 
04442             rv6(i) = (rv6(i) - u * rv2(i) - v * rv3(i)) / rv1(i) 
04443             v = u 
04444             u = rv6(i) 
04445   620    continue 
04446 !     .......... orthogonalize with respect to previous                 
04447 !                members of group ..........                            
04448          if (group  ==  0) go to 700 
04449          j = r 
04450 !                                                                       
04451          do 680 jj = 1, group 
04452   630       j = j - 1 
04453             if (ind(j)  /=  tag) go to 630 
04454             xu = 0.0_wp 
04455 !                                                                       
04456             do 640 i = p, q 
04457   640       xu = xu + rv6(i) * z(i,j) 
04458 !                                                                       
04459             do 660 i = p, q 
04460   660       rv6(i) = rv6(i) - xu * z(i,j) 
04461 !                                                                       
04462   680    continue 
04463 !                                                                       
04464   700    norm = 0.0_wp 
04465 !                                                                       
04466          do 720 i = p, q 
04467   720    norm = norm + abs(rv6(i)) 
04468 !                                                                       
04469          if (norm  >=  1.0_wp) go to 840 
04470 !     .......... forward substitution ..........                        
04471          if (its  ==  5) go to 830 
04472          if (norm  /=  0.0_wp) go to 740 
04473          rv6(s) = eps4 
04474          s = s + 1 
04475          if (s  >  q) s = p 
04476          go to 780 
04477   740    xu = eps4 / norm 
04478 !                                                                       
04479          do 760 i = p, q 
04480   760    rv6(i) = rv6(i) * xu 
04481 !     .......... elimination operations on next vector                  
04482 !                iterate ..........                                     
04483   780    do 820 i = ip, q 
04484             u = rv6(i) 
04485 !     .......... if rv1(i-1)  ==  e(i), a row interchange               
04486 !                was performed earlier in the                           
04487 !                triangularization process ..........                   
04488             if (rv1(i-1)  /=  e(i)) go to 800 
04489             u = rv6(i-1) 
04490             rv6(i-1) = rv6(i) 
04491   800       rv6(i) = u - rv4(i) * rv6(i-1) 
04492   820    continue 
04493 !                                                                       
04494          its = its + 1 
04495          go to 600 
04496 !     .......... set error -- non-converged eigenvector ..........      
04497   830    ierr = -r 
04498          xu = 0.0_wp 
04499          go to 870 
04500 !     .......... normalize so that sum of squares is                    
04501 !                1 and expand to full order ..........                  
04502   840    u = 0.0_wp 
04503 !                                                                       
04504          do 860 i = p, q 
04505   860    u = pythag(u,rv6(i)) 
04506 !                                                                       
04507          xu = 1.0_wp / u 
04508 !                                                                       
04509   870    do 880 i = 1, n 
04510   880    z(i,r) = 0.0_wp 
04511 !                                                                       
04512          do 900 i = p, q 
04513   900    z(i,r) = rv6(i) * xu 
04514 !                                                                       
04515          x0 = x1 
04516   920 continue 
04517 !                                                                       
04518       if (q  <  n) go to 100 
04519  1001 return 
04520       end subroutine tinvit
04521 
04522 !=============================================================================80
04523 
04524       subroutine tql1(n,d,e,ierr) 
04525 !                                                                       
04526       integer i,j,l,m,n,ii,l1,l2,mml,ierr 
04527       real(wp) d(n),e(n) 
04528       real(wp) c,c2,c3,dl1,el1,f,g,h,p,r,s,s2,tst1,tst2
04529 !                                                                       
04530 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure tql1,     
04531 !     num. math. 11, 293-306(1968) by bowdler, martin, reinsch, and     
04532 !     wilkinson.                                                        
04533 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 227-240(1971).   
04534 !                                                                       
04535 !     this subroutine finds the eigenvalues of a symmetric
