04536 !     tridiagonal matrix by the ql method.                              
04537 !                                                                       
04538 !     on input                                                          
04539 !                                                                       
04540 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
04541 !                                                                       
04542 !        d contains the diagonal elements of the input matrix.          
04543 !                                                                       
04544 !        e contains the subdiagonal elements of the input matrix        
04545 !          in its last n-1 positions.  e(1) is arbitrary.               
04546 !                                                                       
04547 !      on output                                                        
04548 !                                                                       
04549 !        d contains the eigenvalues in ascending order.  if an          
04550 !          error exit is made, the eigenvalues are correct and          
04551 !          ordered for indices 1,2,...ierr-1, but may not be            
04552 !          the smallest eigenvalues.                                    
04553 !                                                                       
04554 !        e has been destroyed.                                          
04555 !                                                                       
04556 !        ierr is set to                                                 
04557 !          zero       for normal return,                                
04558 !          j          if the j-th eigenvalue has not been               
04559 !                     determined after 30 iterations.                   
04560 !                                                                       
04561 !     calls pythag for  sqrt(a*a + b*b) .                              
04562 !                                                                       
04563 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
04564 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
04565 !                                                                       
04566 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
04567 !                                                                       
04568 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
04569 !                                                                       
04570       ierr = 0 
04571       if (n  ==  1) go to 1001 
04572 !                                                                       
04573       do 100 i = 2, n 
04574   100 e(i-1) = e(i) 
04575 !                                                                       
04576       f = 0.0_wp 
04577       tst1 = 0.0_wp 
04578       e(n) = 0.0_wp 
04579 !                                                                       
04580       do 290 l = 1, n 
04581          j = 0 
04582          h = abs(d(l)) + abs(e(l)) 
04583          if (tst1  <  h) tst1 = h 
04584 !     .......... look for small sub-diagonal element ..........         
04585          do 110 m = l, n 
04586             tst2 = tst1 + abs(e(m)) 
04587             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 120 
04588 !     .......... e(n) is always zero, so there is no exit               
04589 !                through the bottom of the loop ..........              
04590   110    continue 
04591 !                                                                       
04592   120    if (m  ==  l) go to 210 
04593   130    if (j  ==  30) go to 1000 
04594          j = j + 1 
04595 !     .......... form shift ..........                                  
04596          l1 = l + 1 
04597          l2 = l1 + 1 
04598          g = d(l) 
04599          p = (d(l1) - g) / (2.0_wp * e(l)) 
04600          r = pythag(p,1.0_wp) 
04601          d(l) = e(l) / (p + sign(r,p)) 
04602          d(l1) = e(l) * (p + sign(r,p)) 
04603          dl1 = d(l1) 
04604          h = g - d(l) 
04605          if (l2  >  n) go to 145 
04606 !                                                                       
04607          do 140 i = l2, n 
04608   140    d(i) = d(i) - h 
04609 !                                                                       
04610   145    f = f + h 
04611 !     .......... ql transformation ..........                           
04612          p = d(m) 
04613          c = 1.0_wp 
04614          c2 = c 
04615          el1 = e(l1) 
04616          s = 0.0_wp 
04617          mml = m - l 
04618 !     .......... for i=m-1 step -1 until l do -- ..........             
04619          do 200 ii = 1, mml 
04620             c3 = c2 
04621             c2 = c 
04622             s2 = s 
04623             i = m - ii 
04624             g = c * e(i) 
04625             h = c * p 
04626             r = pythag(p,e(i)) 
04627             e(i+1) = s * r 
04628             s = e(i) / r 
04629             c = p / r 
04630             p = c * d(i) - s * g 
04631             d(i+1) = h + s * (c * g + s * d(i)) 
04632   200    continue 
04633 !                                                                       
04634          p = -s * s2 * c3 * el1 * e(l) / dl1 
04635          e(l) = s * p 
04636          d(l) = c * p 
04637          tst2 = tst1 + abs(e(l)) 
04638          if (tst2  >  tst1) go to 130 
04639   210    p = d(l) + f 
04640 !     .......... order eigenvalues ..........                           
04641          if (l  ==  1) go to 250 
04642 !     .......... for i=l step -1 until 2 do -- ..........               
04643          do 230 ii = 2, l 
04644             i = l + 2 - ii 
04645             if (p  >=  d(i-1)) go to 270 
04646             d(i) = d(i-1) 
04647   230    continue 
04648 !                                                                       
04649   250    i = 1 
04650   270    d(i) = p 
04651   290 continue 
04652 !                                                                       
04653       go to 1001 
04654 !     .......... set error -- no convergence to an                      
04655 !                eigenvalue after 30 iterations ..........              
04656  1000 ierr = l 
04657  1001 return 
04658       end subroutine tql1
04659 
04660 !=============================================================================80
04661 
04662       subroutine tql2(nm,n,d,e,z,ierr) 
04663 !                                                                       
04664       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,ii,l1,l2,nm,mml,ierr 
04665       real(wp) d(n),e(n),z(nm,n) 
04666       real(wp) c,c2,c3,dl1,el1,f,g,h,p,r,s,s2,tst1,tst2
04667 !                                                                       
04668 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure tql2,     
04669 !     num. math. 11, 293-306(1968) by bowdler, martin, reinsch, and     
04670 !     wilkinson.                                                        
04671 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 227-240(1971).   
04672 !                                                                       
04673 !     this subroutine finds the eigenvalues and eigenvectors            
04674 !     of a symmetric tridiagonal matrix by the ql method.               
04675 !     the eigenvectors of a full symmetric matrix can also              
04676 !     be found if  tred2  has been used to reduce this                  
04677 !     full matrix to tridiagonal form.                                  
04678 !                                                                       
04679 !     on input                                                          
04680 !                                                                       
04681 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
04682 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
04683 !          dimension statement.                                         
04684 !                                                                       
04685 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
04686 !                                                                       
04687 !        d contains the diagonal elements of the input matrix.          
04688 !                                                                       
04689 !        e contains the subdiagonal elements of the input matrix        
04690 !          in its last n-1 positions.  e(1) is arbitrary.               
04691 !                                                                       
04692 !        z contains the transformation matrix produced in the           
04693 !          reduction by  tred2, if performed.  if the eigenvectors      
04694 !          of the tridiagonal matrix are desired, z must contain        
04695 !          the identity matrix.                                         
04696 !                                                                       
04697 !      on output                                                        
04698 !                                                                       
04699 !        d contains the eigenvalues in ascending order.  if an          
04700 !          error exit is made, the eigenvalues are correct but          
04701 !          unordered for indices 1,2,...,ierr-1.                        
04702 !                                                                       
04703 !        e has been destroyed.                                          
04704 !                                                                       
04705 !        z contains orthonormal eigenvectors of the symmetric           
04706 !          tridiagonal (or full) matrix.  if an error exit is made,     
04707 !          z contains the eigenvectors associated with the stored       
04708 !          eigenvalues.                                                 
04709 !                                                                       
04710 !        ierr is set to                                                 
04711 !          zero       for normal return,                                
04712 !          j          if the j-th eigenvalue has not been               
04713 !                     determined after 30 iterations.                   
04714 !                                                                       
04715 !     calls pythag for  sqrt(a*a + b*b) .                              
04716 !                                                                       
04717 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
04718 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
04719 !                                                                       
04720 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
04721 !                                                                       
04722 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
04723 !                                                                       
04724       ierr = 0 
04725       if (n  ==  1) go to 1001 
04726 !                                                                       
04727       do 100 i = 2, n 
04728   100 e(i-1) = e(i) 
04729 !                                                                       
04730       f = 0.0_wp 
04731       tst1 = 0.0_wp 
04732       e(n) = 0.0_wp 
04733 !                                                                       
04734       do 240 l = 1, n 
04735          j = 0 
04736          h = abs(d(l)) + abs(e(l)) 
04737          if (tst1  <  h) tst1 = h 
04738 !     .......... look for small sub-diagonal element ..........         
04739          do 110 m = l, n 
04740             tst2 = tst1 + abs(e(m)) 
04741             if (tst2  ==  tst1) go to 120 
04742 !     .......... e(n) is always zero, so there is no exit               
04743 !                through the bottom of the loop ..........              
04744   110    continue 
04745 !                                                                       
04746   120    if (m  ==  l) go to 220 
04747   130    if (j  ==  30) go to 1000 
04748          j = j + 1 
04749 !     .......... form shift ..........                                  
04750          l1 = l + 1 
04751          l2 = l1 + 1 
04752          g = d(l) 
04753          p = (d(l1) - g) / (2.0_wp * e(l)) 
04754          r = pythag(p,1.0_wp) 
04755          d(l) = e(l) / (p + sign(r,p)) 
04756          d(l1) = e(l) * (p + sign(r,p)) 
04757          dl1 = d(l1) 
04758          h = g - d(l) 
04759          if (l2  >  n) go to 145 
04760 !                                                                       
04761          do 140 i = l2, n 
04762   140    d(i) = d(i) - h 
04763 !                                                                       
04764   145    f = f + h 
04765 !     .......... ql transformation ..........                           
04766          p = d(m) 
04767          c = 1.0_wp 
04768          c2 = c 
04769          el1 = e(l1) 
04770          s = 0.0_wp 
04771          mml = m - l 
04772 !     .......... for i=m-1 step -1 until l do -- ..........             
04773          do 200 ii = 1, mml 
04774             c3 = c2 
04775             c2 = c 
04776             s2 = s 
04777             i = m - ii 
04778             g = c * e(i) 
04779             h = c * p 
04780             r = pythag(p,e(i)) 
04781             e(i+1) = s * r 
04782             s = e(i) / r 
04783             c = p / r 
04784             p = c * d(i) - s * g 
04785             d(i+1) = h + s * (c * g + s * d(i)) 
04786 !     .......... form vector ..........                                 
04787             do 180 k = 1, n 
04788                h = z(k,i+1) 
04789                z(k,i+1) = s * z(k,i) + c * h 
04790                z(k,i) = c * z(k,i) - s * h 
04791   180       continue 
04792 !                                                                       
04793   200    continue 
04794 !                                                                       
04795          p = -s * s2 * c3 * el1 * e(l) / dl1 
04796          e(l) = s * p 
04797          d(l) = c * p 
04798          tst2 = tst1 + abs(e(l)) 
04799          if (tst2  >  tst1) go to 130 
04800   220    d(l) = d(l) + f 
04801   240 continue 
04802 !     .......... order eigenvalues and eigenvectors ..........          
04803       do 300 ii = 2, n 
04804          i = ii - 1 
04805          k = i 
04806          p = d(i) 
04807 !                                                                       
04808          do 260 j = ii, n 
04809             if (d(j)  >=  p) go to 260 
04810             k = j 
04811             p = d(j) 
04812   260    continue 
04813 !                                                                       
04814          if (k  ==  i) go to 300 
04815          d(k) = d(i) 
04816          d(i) = p 
04817 !                                                                       
04818          do 280 j = 1, n 
04819             p = z(j,i) 
04820             z(j,i) = z(j,k) 
04821             z(j,k) = p 
04822   280    continue 
04823 !                                                                       
04824   300 continue 
04825 !                                                                       
04826       go to 1001 
04827 !     .......... set error -- no convergence to an                      
04828 !                eigenvalue after 30 iterations ..........              
04829  1000 ierr = l 
04830  1001 return 
04831       end subroutine tql2
04832 
04833 !=============================================================================80
04834 
04835       subroutine trbak1(nm,n,a,e,m,z) 
04836 !                                                                       
04837       integer i,j,k,l,m,n,nm 
04838       real(wp) a(nm,n),e(n),z(nm,m) 
04839       real(wp) s 
04840 !                                                                       
04841 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure trbak1,   
04842 !     num. math. 11, 181-195(1968) by martin, reinsch, and wilkinson.   
04843 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 212-226(1971).   
04844 !                                                                       
04845 !     this subroutine forms the eigenvectors of a real symmetric        
04846 !     matrix by back transforming those of the corresponding            
04847 !     symmetric tridiagonal matrix determined by  tred1.                
04848 !                                                                       
04849 !     on input                                                          
04850 !                                                                       
04851 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
04852 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
04853 !          dimension statement.                                         
04854 !                                                                       
04855 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
04856 !                                                                       
04857 !        a contains information about the orthogonal trans-             
04858 !          formations used in the reduction by  tred1                   
04859 !          in its strict lower triangle.                                
04860 !                                                                       
04861 !        e contains the subdiagonal elements of the tridiagonal         
04862 !          matrix in its last n-1 positions.  e(1) is arbitrary.        
04863 !                                                                       
04864 !        m is the number of eigenvectors to be back transformed.        
04865 !                                                                       
04866 !        z contains the eigenvectors to be back transformed             
04867 !          in its first m columns.                                      
04868 !                                                                       
04869 !     on output                                                         
04870 !                                                                       
04871 !        z contains the transformed eigenvectors                        
04872 !          in its first m columns.                                      
04873 !                                                                       
04874 !     note that trbak1 preserves vector euclidean norms.                
04875 !                                                                       
04876 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
04877 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
04878 !                                                                       
04879 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
04880 !                                                                       
04881 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
04882 !                                                                       
04883       if (m  ==  0) go to 200 
04884       if (n  ==  1) go to 200 
04885 !                                                                       
04886       do 140 i = 2, n 
04887          l = i - 1 
04888          if (e(i)  ==  0.0_wp) go to 140 
04889 !                                                                       
04890          do 130 j = 1, m 
04891             s = 0.0_wp 
04892 !                                                                       
04893             do 110 k = 1, l 
04894   110       s = s + a(i,k) * z(k,j) 
04895 !     .......... divisor below is negative of h formed in tred1.        
04896 !                double division avoids possible underflow ..........   
04897             s = (s / a(i,l)) / e(i) 
04898 !                                                                       
04899             do 120 k = 1, l 
04900   120       z(k,j) = z(k,j) + s * a(i,k) 
04901 !                                                                       
04902   130    continue 
04903 !                                                                       
04904   140 continue 
04905 !                                                                       
04906   200 return 
04907       end subroutine trbak1
04908 
04909 !=============================================================================80
04910 
04911       subroutine tred1(nm,n,a,d,e,e2) 
04912 !                                                                       
04913       integer i,j,k,l,n,ii,nm,jp1 
04914       real(wp) a(nm,n),d(n),e(n),e2(n) 
04915       real(wp) f,g,h,scale 
04916 !                                                                       
04917 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure tred1,    
04918 !     num. math. 11, 181-195(1968) by martin, reinsch, and wilkinson.   
04919 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 212-226(1971).   
04920 !                                                                       
04921 !     this subroutine reduces a real symmetric matrix                   
04922 !     to a symmetric tridiagonal matrix using                           
04923 !     orthogonal similarity transformations.                            
04924 !                                                                       
04925 !     on input                                                          
04926 !                                                                       
04927 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
04928 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
04929 !          dimension statement.                                         
04930 !                                                                       
04931 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
04932 !                                                                       
04933 !        a contains the real symmetric input matrix.  only the          
04934 !          lower triangle of the matrix need be supplied.               
04935 !                                                                       
04936 !     on output                                                         
04937 !                                                                       
04938 !        a contains information about the orthogonal trans-             
04939 !          formations used in the reduction in its strict lower         
04940 !          triangle.  the full upper triangle of a is unaltered.        
04941 !                                                                       
04942 !        d contains the diagonal elements of the tridiagonal matrix.    
04943 !                                                                       
04944 !        e contains the subdiagonal elements of the tridiagonal         
04945 !          matrix in its last n-1 positions.  e(1) is set to zero.      
04946 !                                                                       
04947 !        e2 contains the squares of the corresponding elements of e.    
04948 !          e2 may coincide with e if the squares are not needed.        
04949 !                                                                       
04950 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
04951 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
04952 !                                                                       
04953 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
04954 !                                                                       
04955 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
04956 !                                                                       
04957       do 100 i = 1, n 
04958          d(i) = a(n,i) 
04959          a(n,i) = a(i,i) 
04960   100 continue 
04961 !     .......... for i=n step -1 until 1 do -- ..........               
04962       do 300 ii = 1, n 
04963          i = n + 1 - ii 
04964          l = i - 1 
04965          h = 0.0_wp 
04966          scale = 0.0_wp 
04967          if (l  <  1) go to 130 
04968 !     .......... scale row (algol tol then not needed) ..........       
04969          do 120 k = 1, l 
04970   120    scale = scale + abs(d(k)) 
04971 !                                                                       
04972          if (scale  /=  0.0_wp) go to 140 
04973 !                                                                       
04974          do 125 j = 1, l 
04975             d(j) = a(l,j) 
04976             a(l,j) = a(i,j) 
04977             a(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
04978   125    continue 
04979 !                                                                       
04980   130    e(i) = 0.0_wp 
04981          e2(i) = 0.0_wp 
04982          go to 300 
04983 !                                                                       
04984   140    do 150 k = 1, l 
04985             d(k) = d(k) / scale 
04986             h = h + d(k) * d(k) 
04987   150    continue 
04988 !                                                                       
04989          e2(i) = scale * scale * h 
04990          f = d(l) 
04991          g = -sign(sqrt(h),f) 
04992          e(i) = scale * g 
04993          h = h - f * g 
04994          d(l) = f - g 
04995          if (l  ==  1) go to 285 
04996 !     .......... form a*u ..........                                    
04997          do 170 j = 1, l 
04998   170    e(j) = 0.0_wp 
04999 !                                                                       
05000          do 240 j = 1, l 
05001             f = d(j) 
05002             g = e(j) + a(j,j) * f 
05003             jp1 = j + 1 
05004             if (l  <  jp1) go to 220 
05005 !                                                                       
05006             do 200 k = jp1, l 
05007                g = g + a(k,j) * d(k) 
05008                e(k) = e(k) + a(k,j) * f 
05009   200       continue 
05010 !                                                                       
05011   220       e(j) = g 
05012   240    continue 
05013 !     .......... form p ..........                                      
05014          f = 0.0_wp 
05015 !                                                                       
05016          do 245 j = 1, l 
05017             e(j) = e(j) / h 
05018             f = f + e(j) * d(j) 
05019   245    continue 
05020 !                                                                       
05021          h = f / (h + h) 
05022 !     .......... form q ..........                                      
05023          do 250 j = 1, l 
05024   250    e(j) = e(j) - h * d(j) 
05025 !     .......... form reduced a ..........                              
05026          do 280 j = 1, l 
05027             f = d(j) 
05028             g = e(j) 
05029 !                                                                       
05030             do 260 k = j, l 
05031   260       a(k,j) = a(k,j) - f * e(k) - g * d(k) 
05032 !                                                                       
05033   280    continue 
05034 !                                                                       
05035   285    do 290 j = 1, l 
05036             f = d(j) 
05037             d(j) = a(l,j) 
05038             a(l,j) = a(i,j) 
05039             a(i,j) = f * scale 
05040   290    continue 
05041 !                                                                       
05042   300 continue 
05043 !                                                                       
05044       return 
05045       end subroutine tred1
05046 
05047 !=============================================================================80
05048 
05049       subroutine tred2(nm,n,a,d,e,z) 
05050 !                                                                       
05051       integer i,j,k,l,n,ii,nm,jp1 
05052       real(wp) a(nm,n),d(n),e(n),z(nm,n) 
05053       real(wp) f,g,h,hh,scale 
05054 !                                                                       
05055 !     this subroutine is a translation of the algol procedure tred2,    
05056 !     num. math. 11, 181-195(1968) by martin, reinsch, and wilkinson.   
05057 !     handbook for auto. comp., vol.ii-linear algebra, 212-226(1971).   
05058 !                                                                       
05059 !     this subroutine reduces a real symmetric matrix to a              
05060 !     symmetric tridiagonal matrix using and accumulating               
05061 !     orthogonal similarity transformations.                            
05062 !                                                                       
05063 !     on input                                                          
05064 !                                                                       
05065 !        nm must be set to the row dimension of two-dimensional         
05066 !          array parameters as declared in the calling program          
05067 !          dimension statement.                                         
05068 !                                                                       
05069 !        n is the order of the matrix.                                  
05070 !                                                                       
05071 !        a contains the real symmetric input matrix.  only the          
05072 !          lower triangle of the matrix need be supplied.               
05073 !                                                                       
05074 !     on output                                                         
05075 !                                                                       
05076 !        d contains the diagonal elements of the tridiagonal matrix.    
05077 !                                                                       
05078 !        e contains the subdiagonal elements of the tridiagonal         
05079 !          matrix in its last n-1 positions.  e(1) is set to zero.      
05080 !                                                                       
05081 !        z contains the orthogonal transformation matrix                
05082 !          produced in the reduction.                                   
05083 !                                                                       
05084 !        a and z may coincide.  if distinct, a is unaltered.            
05085 !                                                                       
05086 !     questions and comments should be directed to burton s. garbow,    
05087 !     mathematics and computer science div, argonne national laboratory 
05088 !                                                                       
05089 !     this version dated august 1983.                                   
05090 !                                                                       
05091 !     ------------------------------------------------------------------
05092 !                                                                       
05093       do 100 i = 1, n 
05094 !                                                                       
05095          do 80 j = i, n 
05096    80    z(j,i) = a(j,i) 
05097 !                                                                       
05098          d(i) = a(n,i) 
05099   100 continue 
05100 !                                                                       
05101       if (n  ==  1) go to 510 
05102 !     .......... for i=n step -1 until 2 do -- ..........               
05103       do 300 ii = 2, n 
05104          i = n + 2 - ii 
05105          l = i - 1 
05106          h = 0.0_wp 
05107          scale = 0.0_wp 
05108          if (l  <  2) go to 130 
05109 !     .......... scale row (algol tol then not needed) ..........       
05110          do 120 k = 1, l 
05111   120    scale = scale + abs(d(k)) 
05112 !                                                                       
05113          if (scale  /=  0.0_wp) go to 140 
05114   130    e(i) = d(l) 
05115 !                                                                       
05116          do 135 j = 1, l 
05117             d(j) = z(l,j) 
05118             z(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
05119             z(j,i) = 0.0_wp 
05120   135    continue 
05121 !                                                                       
05122          go to 290 
05123 !                                                                       
05124   140    do 150 k = 1, l 
05125             d(k) = d(k) / scale 
05126             h = h + d(k) * d(k) 
05127   150    continue 
05128 !                                                                       
05129          f = d(l) 
05130          g = -sign(sqrt(h),f) 
05131          e(i) = scale * g 
05132          h = h - f * g 
05133          d(l) = f - g 
05134 !     .......... form a*u ..........                                    
05135          do 170 j = 1, l 
05136   170    e(j) = 0.0_wp 
05137 !                                                                       
05138          do 240 j = 1, l 
05139             f = d(j) 
05140             z(j,i) = f 
05141             g = e(j) + z(j,j) * f 
05142             jp1 = j + 1 
05143             if (l  <  jp1) go to 220 
05144 !                                                                       
05145             do 200 k = jp1, l 
05146                g = g + z(k,j) * d(k) 
05147                e(k) = e(k) + z(k,j) * f 
05148   200       continue 
05149 !                                                                       
05150   220       e(j) = g 
05151   240    continue 
05152 !     .......... form p ..........                                      
05153          f = 0.0_wp 
05154 !                                                                       
05155          do 245 j = 1, l 
05156             e(j) = e(j) / h 
05157             f = f + e(j) * d(j) 
05158   245    continue 
05159 !                                                                       
05160          hh = f / (h + h) 
05161 !     .......... form q ..........                                      
05162          do 250 j = 1, l 
05163   250    e(j) = e(j) - hh * d(j) 
05164 !     .......... form reduced a ..........                              
05165          do 280 j = 1, l 
05166             f = d(j) 
05167             g = e(j) 
05168 !                                                                       
05169             do 260 k = j, l 
05170   260       z(k,j) = z(k,j) - f * e(k) - g * d(k) 
05171 !                                                                       
05172             d(j) = z(l,j) 
05173             z(i,j) = 0.0_wp 
05174   280    continue 
05175 !                                                                       
05176   290    d(i) = h 
05177   300 continue 
05178 !     .......... accumulation of transformation matrices ..........     
05179       do 500 i = 2, n 
05180          l = i - 1 
05181          z(n,l) = z(l,l) 
05182          z(l,l) = 1.0_wp 
05183          h = d(i) 
05184          if (h  ==  0.0_wp) go to 380 
05185 !                                                                       
05186          do 330 k = 1, l 
05187   330    d(k) = z(k,i) / h 
05188 !                                                                       
05189          do 360 j = 1, l 
05190             g = 0.0_wp 
05191 !                                                                       
05192             do 340 k = 1, l 
05193   340       g = g + z(k,i) * z(k,j) 
05194 !                                                                       
05195             do 360 k = 1, l 
05196                z(k,j) = z(k,j) - g * d(k) 
05197   360    continue 
05198 !                                                                       
05199   380    do 400 k = 1, l 
05200   400    z(k,i) = 0.0_wp 
05201 !                                                                       
05202   500 continue 
05203 !                                                                       
05204   510 do 520 i = 1, n 
05205          d(i) = z(n,i) 
05206          z(n,i) = 0.0_wp 
05207   520 continue 
05208 !                                                                       
05209       z(n,n) = 1.0_wp 
05210       e(1) = 0.0_wp 
05211       return 
05212       end subroutine tred2
05213 
05214 !=============================================================================80
05215       subroutine Eigen_Sym(n,AA,RR,EE)
05216 
05217       implicit none
05218 
05219       integer,                     intent(in   ) :: n
05220       real(wp), dimension(n,n), intent(in   ) :: AA
05221 
05222       real(wp), dimension(n  ), intent(  out) :: EE
05223       real(wp), dimension(n,n), intent(  out) :: RR
05224 
05225 !     input
05226 !     n : dimension of matrix
05227 !     A : AA(n,n) ->  A = A^T
05228 
05229 !     output
05230 !     R   : Matrix of eigenvectors satisfying  A = R lam R^T ; 
05231 !           with     R R^T = R R^T = I
05232 !     Eig : Vector of eigenvalues
05233 
05234 !     Determine the eigenvalues and eigenvectors for a symmetric matrix
05235 !     we do not assume the matrix A is SPD, only symmetric
05236 !     
05237       real(wp), parameter                     :: eps = 1.0e-15_wp
05238       real(wp) :: root
05239       real(wp) :: t11,t12,t21,t22
05240       real(wp) :: a11,a12,a13,a22,a23,a33
05241       real(wp) :: b,c,d, p,q
05242       real(wp) :: mag1,mag2
05243       real(wp) :: pi, disc, phi
05244       real(wp) :: r1,r2,r3,t1, err, mag, al
05245       complex(wp) :: z3p,z3m, eye
05246       integer        :: j
05247 
05248       continue
05249 
05250       pi = acos(-1.0_wp)
05251       if(maxval(abs(AA - Transpose(AA))) >= eps) then
05252         write(*,*)'matrix is not symmetric;  stopping'
05253       endif
05254 
05255       if(n == 1) then
05256 
05257         write(*,*)'matrix dimension == 1;  stopping'
05258         stop
05259 
05260       elseif(n == 2) then
05261 
05262         a11 = AA(1,1) ;  a12 = AA(1,2)
05263                          a22 = AA(2,2) 
05264 
05265         root   = sqrt(4.0_wp*a12*a12 +(a11 - a22)*(a11 - a22))
05266         EE(1) = 0.5_wp * ((a11 + a22) - root )
05267         EE(2) = 0.5_wp * ((a11 + a22) + root )
05268 
05269         t11 = -( -a11 + a22 + root )/(2.0_wp*a12)
05270         t12 = 1.0_wp
05271         mag1 = 1.0_wp / sqrt(t11*t11+t12*t12)
05272         
05273         t21 = +( +a11 - a22 + root )/(2.0_wp*a12)
05274         t22 = 1.0_wp
05275         mag2 = 1.0_wp / sqrt(t21*t21+t22*t22)
05276 
05277         RR(1,1) = t11 * mag1
05278         RR(1,2) = t12 * mag1
05279         RR(2,1) = t21 * mag2
05280         RR(2,2) = t12 * mag2
05281 
05282       elseif(n == 3) then
05283 
05284          a11 = AA(1,1) ; a12 = AA(1,2) ; a13 = AA(1,3)
05285                          a22 = AA(2,2) ; a23 = AA(2,3)
05286                                          a33 = AA(3,3)
05287 
05288          b = (- a11 - a22 - a33)
05289          c = (- a12*a12 - a13*a13 + a11*a22                 &
05290            &  - a23*a23 + a11*a33 + a22*a33)
05291          d = (+ a13*a13*a22 - a12*a13*a23 - a12*a13*a23     &
05292            &  + a11*a23*a23 + a12*a12*a33 - a11*a22*a33)
05293 
05294          p  = c - b*b / 3.0_wp
05295          q  = d + (2.0_wp*b*b*b - 9.0_wp*b*c)/(27.0_wp)
05296 
05297          phi = - acos(1.5_wp*q/p*sqrt(-3.0_wp/p))
05298          al = 2.0_wp * sqrt(-p/3.0_wp) 
05299          EE(1) =  al * cos((phi - 2.0_wp*0.0_wp*pi)/3.0_wp) - b/3.0_wp
05300          EE(2) =  al * cos((phi - 2.0_wp*1.0_wp*pi)/3.0_wp) - b/3.0_wp
05301          EE(3) =  al * cos((phi - 2.0_wp*2.0_wp*pi)/3.0_wp) - b/3.0_wp
05302 !        err =                                                     &
05303 !            & + EE(1)*EE(1)*EE(1) + b*EE(1)*EE(1) + c*EE(1) + d   &
05304 !            & + EE(2)*EE(2)*EE(2) + b*EE(2)*EE(2) + c*EE(2) + d   &
05305 !            & + EE(3)*EE(3)*EE(3) + b*EE(3)*EE(3) + c*EE(3) + d
05306 !        if(sqrt(err*err) >= 1.0e-11) then
05307 !          write(*,*)'cubic polynomial error:  stopping'
05308 !          stop
05309 !        endif
05310          do j = 1,3
05311            RR(1,j) = 1.0_wp  
05312            RR(2,j) = - (a13*a23 + a12*(-a33 + EE(j))) / (a23*a23 + (a22 - EE(j))*(-a33 + EE(j)))
05313            RR(3,j) = - (a12*a23 + a13*(-a22 + EE(j))) / (a23*a23 + (a22 - EE(j))*(-a33 + EE(j)))
05314            mag = sqrt(dot_product(RR(:,j),RR(:,j)))
05315            RR(:,j) = RR(:,j)/mag
05316          enddo
05317 
05318       elseif(n == 4) then
05319 
05320       elseif(n == 5) then
05321 
05322       else
05323 
05324       endif
05325 
05326       end subroutine Eigen_Sym
05327 
05328       end module eispack_module
